English: The former account I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach
Bahnar: Ơ Theophil, lăm hla bơar mă mônh hơdrol sơ̆, inh chih ră roi kơ ih tôm tơdrong Yêsu pơm păng 'bơ̆r Sư bơtho

English: until the day in which He was taken up, after He through the Holy Spirit had given commandments to the apostles whom He had chosen
Bahnar: tơm hmơm truh tơ năr 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk Sư tơ plĕnh. Hơdrol kơ Sư wă tŏk tơ plĕnh, Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ Sư bơtho lu jơ̆ng 'bang mă đêl Sư rơih.

English: to whom He also presented Himself alive after His suffering by many infallible proofs, being seen by them during forty days and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Yêsu lôch tam mă tŏk tơ plĕnh noh Sư năm tơ'bôh akâu Sư tơ jơ̆ng 'bang Sư ei. Yêsu tơbăt kơ lu sư akâu Sư kơdih oei arih. Kơplah puăn-jĭt năr noh Sư tơ'bôh akâu păng bơtho lu sư gah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r.

English: And being assembled together with them, He commanded them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to wait for the Promise of the Father, “which,” He said, “you have heard from Me
Bahnar: Hơtai ei lu sư oei akŭm dih băl, Yêsu khă lu sư: “Iĕm 'nĕ tam jăk đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem, iĕm athei chang gô Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng mă đêl 'Bă Inh pơkă gô ăn kơ iĕm kư̆m thoi Inh roi kơ iĕm ki.

English: for John truly baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit not many days from now.”
Bahnar: Yôhan pơm kơ iĕm 'batem păng đak, mă-lei pă đunh boih 'Bă Inh gô pơm kơ iĕm 'batem phara, Sư gô ăn kơ iĕm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư.”

English: Therefore, when they had come together, they asked Him, saying, “Lord, will You at this time restore the kingdom to Israel?”
Bahnar: Na dôm lu sư âu oei akŭm dih băl jet Yêsu thoi âu: “Ơ Kră Yang, hăm trŏ dang ei Ih wă ăn dêh Isơrael rơngei dơ̆ng?”

English: And He said to them, “It is not for you to know times or seasons which the Father has put in His own authority.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Năr 'noh 'Bă Inh pơkă kơdih, Sư ưh kơ ăn iĕm băt ôh.

English: But you shall receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you; and you shall be witnesses to Me in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur oei păng iĕm, iĕm gô đei jơhngơ̆m pran năm bơtho tơdrong Inh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, jơ̆p kơ dêh char Juđê păng dêh Samari, đơ̆ng noh jơ̆p kơ teh đak.”

English: Now when He had spoken these things, while they watched, He was taken up, and a cloud received Him out of their sight.
Bahnar: Sư bơtho khan kơ đe ei đang boih, đơ̆ng noh Kră Yang Yêsu tŏk tơ kơpal plĕnh, hơmơ̆l gom Sư. Na đe ei hnhoi Sư dĭng tơ hơmơ̆l gom Sư ưh pă 'bôh boih.

English: And while they looked steadfastly toward heaven as He went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel
Bahnar: Lu sư oei 'bloh tơ plĕnh khŏm khŏm, na lu sư 'bôh hloi 'bar 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng hrŭk ao kok dơ̆ng jê̆ 'bơ̆t lu đe ei. Na bre linh jang 'lơ̆ng khan kơ lu đe ei thoi âu

English: who also said, “Men of Galilee, why do you stand gazing up into heaven? This same Jesus, who was taken up from you into heaven, will so come in like manner as you saw Him go into heaven.”
Bahnar: “Ơ bơngai Galilê, iĕm lăng 'bloh chă kiơ tơ plĕnh? Ning-mônh Sư gô jur dơ̆ng kư̆m thoi Sư tŏk mơ̆n.”

English: Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is near Jerusalem, a Sabbath day’s journey.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na lu bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu đơ̆ng kông Ôliwơ brŏk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem dang minh kơsô̆.

English: And when they had entered, they went up into the upper room where they were staying: Peter, James, John, and Andrew; Philip and Thomas; Bartholomew and Matthew; James the son of Alphaeus and Simon the Zealot; and Judas the son of James.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem boih na lu sư tŏk tơ hnam anih gah kơpal. Na anăn lu sư oei tơ ei: Pêtrôs, Yôhan, Yakơ, Andrê, Philip, Thôm, 'Barthôlêmi, Mathiơ, Yakơ kon Alphê, Simôn mă kiơ̆ khŭl đe Sêlôt sơ̆, Juđa kon Yakơ bơngai nai.

English: These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with His brothers.
Bahnar: Lu đe âu krao khan ling-lang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Kư̆m đei Mari mĕ Yêsu păng lu oh Yêsu drŏ-nglo păng lu drŏ-kăn nai dơ̆ng akŭm pôm đon krao khan păng lu sư mơ̆n.

English: And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples (altogether the number of names was about a hundred and twenty), and said
Bahnar: Kơplah noh sơ̆, minh năr ei đei dang lăp minh-hrĕng 'bar-jĭt 'nu bơngai akŭm dih băl, Pêtrôs iung 'bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk bôl sư khan hloi

English: “Men and brethren, this Scripture had to be fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before by the mouth of David concerning Judas, who became a guide to those who arrested Jesus
Bahnar: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ Đawit chih pơkă lê̆ hơdrol roi gah Juđa sơ̆ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei. Yua kơ thoi noh na trŏ dang ei tơpă. Juđa tơ'bôh trong kơ đe năm rôp Yêsu.

English: for he was numbered with us and obtained a part in this ministry.”
Bahnar: Juđa sơ̆ oei păng bơ̆n, jang hơdai păng bơ̆n.

English: (Now this man purchased a field with the wages of iniquity; and falling headlong, he burst open in the middle and all his entrails gushed out.
Bahnar: “Juđa iŏk jên đơ̆ng bơngai wă rôp Yêsu na đơ̆ng jên ei sư blơ̆ răt mir đe. Đơ̆ng noh na Juđa sư pơrăm kơdih akâu, sư huŏng hơtat pơchah klak lôch hloi.

English: And it became known to all those dwelling in Jerusalem; so that field is called in their own language, Akel Dama, that is, Field of Blood.)
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh na lu sư anăn mir ei Akelđama, wă khan mir pơda.

English: “For it is written in the Book of Psalms: ‘Let his dwelling place be desolate, And let no one live in it’; and, ‘Let another take his office.’
Bahnar: Đawit chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong hơriso hơdrol kơ đe tam mă tơpŭ kơ Juđa thoi âu: ‘Hnam sư gô adro ưh kơ đei bu oei. Tơdrong jang sư bơ̆n ăn kơ bơngai nai iŏk.’

English: “Therefore, of these men who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us
Bahnar: “Na dang ei bơ̆n athei rơih minh 'nu dơ̆ng wă mơ̆t bơ̆jang hơdai lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu bơ̆n, na sư hơdai păng bơ̆n gô roi tơbăt kơ đe Yêsu iung arih boih. Bơ̆n athei rơih chă minh 'nu bơngai đêl oei hơdai păng bơ̆n, đơ̆ng Yêsu 'nao oei păng bơ̆n na Yôhan pơm 'batem sơ̆ truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk Yêsu tơ plĕnh.”

English: beginning from the baptism of John to that day when He was taken up from us, one of these must become a witness with us of His resurrection.”
Bahnar: “Na dang ei bơ̆n athei rơih minh 'nu dơ̆ng wă mơ̆t bơ̆jang hơdai lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu bơ̆n, na sư hơdai păng bơ̆n gô roi tơbăt kơ đe Yêsu iung arih boih. Bơ̆n athei rơih chă minh 'nu bơngai đêl oei hơdai păng bơ̆n, đơ̆ng Yêsu 'nao oei păng bơ̆n na Yôhan pơm 'batem sơ̆ truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk Yêsu tơ plĕnh.”

English: And they proposed two: Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs pơma đang boih na lu sư rơih iŏk 'bar 'nu bơngai, minh 'nu đei pêng tŏ anăn: Yôsep 'Barsa'ba Jutu; păng minh 'nu dơ̆ng anăn sư Mathias.

English: And they prayed and said, “You, O Lord, who know the hearts of all, show which of these two You have chosen
Bahnar: Na lu sư krao khan kơ Kră Yang thoi âu: “Kră Yang, Ih băt đĭ lăm jơhngơ̆m đon kon bơngai. Apinh Ih tơ'bôh kơ nhôn bơngai ayơ Ih rơih boih wă pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu wă păl Juđa. Juđa tŭk tơdrong jang âu năm tơ anih sư trŏ dang noh boih.”

English: When the Day of Pentecost had fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.
Bahnar: Truh Năr Giĕng Pangtơkôt, lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu akŭm minh anih.

English: And suddenly there came a sound from heaven, as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled the whole house where they were sitting.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơtơ̆ng grơu đei re jơwa đơ̆ng plĕnh thoi lĕ kial hơbŭt tih 'bĕnh kơ hnam hloi.

English: Then there appeared to them divided tongues, as of fire, and one sat upon each of them.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bôh pla ŭnh jruh rim 'bơ̆t lu sư.

English: And they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng mơ̆t 'bĕnh kơ rim 'nu lu sư. Na lu sư pơtơm pơma phara hloi nơ̆r kiơ̆ thoi Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ lu sư pơma.

English: And there were dwelling in Jerusalem Jews, devout men, from every nation under heaven.
Bahnar: Lăm năr 'noh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, đei lơ lu đe Juđê, lu sư mă 'maih kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei; lu sư năm đơ̆ng jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: And when this sound occurred, the multitude came together, and were confused, because everyone heard them speak in his own language.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư kơtơ̆ng jơwa 'noh hei lu sư wang năm tơkan. Lu sư sơleng kơ đon yua kơ lu sư kơtơ̆ng lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu pơma thoi nơ̆r pơma teh đak sư kơdih.

English: Then they were all amazed and marveled, saying to one another, “Look, are not all these who speak Galileans?
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sư wang hlĭch hlăch păng khan: “Lu bơngai 'noh tơring Galilê ngăl.

English: And how is it that we hear, each in our own language in which we were born?
Bahnar: Mă-lei lơliơ bơ̆n mơ̆ng sư pơma thoi pơma nơ̆r bơ̆n kơdih?

English: Parthians and Medes and Elamites, those dwelling in Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia
Bahnar: Bơ̆n phŏ phŏ đei bôl mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Parthê, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Mêđơ, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Êlam, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Mesôpôtôme, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Juđê; kư̆m đei mơ'nah đơ̆ng Kapadôs, kư̆m đei mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Pôntơ, kư̆m đei dơ̆ng mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Asi.

English: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya adjoining Cyrene, visitors from Rome, both Jews and proselytes
Bahnar: Mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Phiji, kư̆m đei mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Pamphili, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ, kư̆m đei mơ'nah đơ̆ng tơring Siren lăm dêh char Libi. Đơ̆ng Pơlei Rôm kư̆m đei mơ̆n, mơ'nah bơngai Juđê, lu mơ'nah bơngai nai kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Juđê.

English: Cretans and Arabs—we hear them speaking in our own tongues the wonderful works of God.”
Bahnar: Bơ̆n đơ̆ng dêh char Kret, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh char Arabia. Dôm lu bơ̆n âu đei lơ dêh char tơpă, mă-lei bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng sư pơma tôm đĭ lu nơ̆r kon bơngai bơ̆n phara. Lu sư roi dôm lu tơdrong mơsêh mơyang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm.”

English: So they were all amazed and perplexed, saying to one another, “Whatever could this mean?”
Bahnar: Na lu kon tơring wang hlĭch hlăch hăm ưh kơ băt tơchĕng lơliơ dơ̆ng. Thoi noh lu sư pơma băl tơduă lu sư khan: “Lơliơ tơdrong 'nâu?”

English: Others mocking said, “They are full of new wine.”
Bahnar: Sơmă đei lu mơ'nah pơjăm khan: “Lu sư suai.”

English: But Peter, standing up with the eleven, raised his voice and said to them, “Men of Judea and all who dwell in Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and heed my words.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Pêtrôs dơ̆ng hơdai hăm lu mơjĭt-mônh 'nu bôl sư. Sư bơtho kơ lu bơngai oei tơ ei khan: “Ơ lu kon Juđê hăm lu bơngai oei tơ lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem, iĕm mơ̆ng inh pơma bĕ; iĕm athei băt tơdrong 'nâu.

English: For these are not drunk, as you suppose, since it is only the third hour of the day.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn âu ưh kơ suai ôh, yua kơ dang ei 'nao lăp tơsĭn jơ pơgê.

English: But this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong 'noh hei, đei bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei anăn sư Jôel, sư khan lê̆ hơdrol thoi âu

English: ‘And it shall come to pass in the last days, says God, That I will pour out of My Spirit on all flesh; Your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, Your young men shall see visions, Your old men shall dream dreams.
Bahnar: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei khan: Lăm năr hơtuch kơnh, Inh wă ăn Yang Bơhngol Inh kơ jơ̆p-jang bơngai. Lu kon drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn sư wă pơma nơ̆r khan lê̆ hơdrol, lu tơdăm gô apo 'bôh lu tơdrong mă ưh tam mă truh, lu 'bok kră gô apo mơ̆n.

English: And on My menservants and on My maidservants I will pour out My Spirit in those days; And they shall prophesy.
Bahnar: Na lăm năr 'noh kơnh Inh gô ăn Yang Bơhngol Inh kơ đĭ-đăng kơ lu đĭch đam Inh mă drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn, na lu sư gô pơma nơ̆r khan lê̆ hơdrol.

English: I will show wonders in heaven above And signs in the earth beneath: Blood and fire and vapor of smoke.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơm tơdrong hlĭch hlăch tơ kơpal plĕnh, hăm tơ'bôh tơdrong pha tơ ala teh; 'noh lu pham, ŭnh hăm 'nhui.

English: The sun shall be turned into darkness, And the moon into blood, Before the coming of the great and awesome day of the LORD.
Bahnar: Măt 'năr jing măng mu, măt khei wă jing thoi pham, hơdrol kơ năr 'lơ̆ng, năr đe pơư pơang anăn 'Bok Kei-Dei tam mă truh.

English: And it shall come to pass That whoever calls on the name of the LORD Shall be saved.’
Bahnar: Thoi noh bu mă krao khan kơ Kră Yang, sư gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong răm.’ ”

English: “Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus of Nazareth, a Man attested by God to you by miracles, wonders, and signs which God did through Him in your midst, as you yourselves also know
Bahnar: Pêtrôs oei pơma: “Ơ lu đe Isơrael, mơ̆ng inh bĕ. Yêsu Pơlei Nasaret, bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh Sư pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang, pơm tơdrong hlĭch hlăch, tơ'bôh kơ iĕm tơdrong chrơp, 'Bok Kei-Dei yua Sư pơm lu tơdrong 'noh tơ lăm lu iĕm, thoi lu iĕm đei băt boih.

English: Him, being delivered by the determined purpose and foreknowledge of God, you have taken by lawless hands, have crucified, and put to death
Bahnar: Đe rôp Sư kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă lê̆ hơdrol. Lu iĕm pơlôch Sư. Lu iĕm athei lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang.

English: whom God raised up, having loosed the pains of death, because it was not possible that He should be held by it.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei kuă ăn Sư lôch răm na pơklaih Sư đơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh, ăn Sư iung arih dơ̆ng, yua kơ Sư ưh kơ đei lôch ling-lang ôh. Đe ưh kơ gơh rôp pơkơ̆ng Sư lăm tơdrong lôch ôh.

English: For David says concerning Him: ‘I foresaw the LORD always before my face, For He is at my right hand, that I may not be shaken.
Bahnar: Đawit khan lê̆ hơdrol gah tơdrong Yêsu thoi âu: ‘Inh băt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei păng Inh ling-lang, Sư oei jê̆ Inh wă kơ Inh huay kơ hli.

English: Therefore my heart rejoiced, and my tongue was glad; Moreover my flesh also will rest in hope.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh jơhngơ̆m Inh hiôk chơt, Inh roi tơdrong hiôk Inh kơ đe. Akâu Inh lôch, mă-lei akâu Inh gô iung arih dơ̆ng

English: For You will not leave my soul in Hades, Nor will You allow Your Holy One to see corruption.
Bahnar: kơlih kơ Ih ưh kơ đei achăng tŭk Inh lăm anih bơngai lôch ôh, Ih kư̆m ưh kơ ăn Kon 'Lơ̆ng Ih lôch ôm ôh.

English: You have made known to me the ways of life; You will make me full of joy in Your presence.’
Bahnar: Ih tơiung arih Inh đơ̆ng lôch; yua kơ Ih oei păng Inh, jơhngơ̆m Inh gô hiôk chơt tơpă.’ ”

English: “Men and brethren, let me speak freely to you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his tomb is with us to this day.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs oei pơma: “Ơ 'nhŏng oh, inh wă pơma kơ iĕm mă nhên gah Đawit 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆. Đawit lôch boih. Klaih kơ noh đe 'bŭ sư. Bơsat sư tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem kư̆m oei khơ̆ dang ei mơ̆n.

English: Therefore, being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him that of the fruit of his body, according to the flesh, He would raise up the Christ to sit on his throne
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao Đawit bơngai khan lê̆ hơdrol. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ sư khan, kon sâu sư ning-mônh gô pơm Pơtao kư̆m lei-lăi thoi sư sơ̆ mơ̆n.

English: he, foreseeing this, spoke concerning the resurrection of the Christ, that His soul was not left in Hades, nor did His flesh see corruption.
Bahnar: Đawit băt kơ 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n, Sư gô iung arih dơ̆ng na Đawit khan thoi âu: 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei achăng tŭk Sư lăm anih bơngai lôch, akâu Sư ưh kơ jing ôm ôh.

English: This Jesus God has raised up, of which we are all witnesses.
Bahnar: “Bơngai Yêsu mă nhôn bơtho âu, 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Sư đơ̆ng lôch boih. Nhôn 'bôh Sư iung arih tơpă.

English: Therefore being exalted to the right hand of God, and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, He poured out this which you now see and hear.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk Yêsu anih gah 'ma kơ Sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Yêsu Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơ Sư pơkă. Na Yêsu ăn kơ nhôn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng mơ̆n. Yua kơ thoi noh iĕm 'bôh tơdrong mơsêh mơyang hei.

English: “For David did not ascend into the heavens, but he says himself: ‘The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand
Bahnar: Đawit ưh kơ đei tŏk tơ plĕnh ôh, mă-lei sư khan: ‘Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Yŏng Kơdră inh thoi âu: Ih kư̆ oei gah 'ma kơ Inh pơgơ̆r

English: Till I make Your enemies Your footstool.” ’
Bahnar: tơ̆p Inh blah rôp lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ Ih thuơ tơ kơnơl jơ̆ng Ih.’

English: “Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly that God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Christ.”
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael băt mă nhên: Yêsu mă iĕm pơ̆ng pơlôch tơ 'long pơglang, Sư boih 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn pơm Yŏng bơ̆n păng 'Bok Krist mă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n kư̆m Sư mơ̆n.”

English: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, “Men and brethren, what shall we do?”
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh boih, lu kon tơring mơn lăm jơhngơ̆m sư na jet Pêtrôs hăm lu bôl sư khan: “Ơ 'nhŏng oh, nhôn athei pơm lơliơ wă klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch?”

English: Then Peter said to them, “Repent, and let every one of you be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins; and you shall receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan: “Iĕm athei tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch iĕm. Iĕm athei iŏk 'batem hăm anăn Yêsu Krist wă kơ Sư pơklaih tơdrong yoch iĕm, Sư ăn kơ iĕm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng.

English: For the promise is to you and to your children, and to all who are afar off, as many as the Lord our God will call.”
Bahnar: 'Nâu nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư pơkă ăn kơ iĕm, kơ lu kon sâu iĕm păng lu bơngai mă oei tơ ataih đơ̆ng bơ̆n, dôm lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang bơ̆n krao iŏk wă lui kơ Sư.”

English: And with many other words he testified and exhorted them, saying, “Be saved from this perverse generation.”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs bơtho lơ tơdrong dơ̆ng hăm pơlung lu sư thoi âu: “Lu iĕm athei weh đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung bơngai pơm kơnê̆ 'nâu.”

English: Then those who gladly received his word were baptized; and that day about three thousand souls were added to them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai mă iŏk nơ̆r bơtho 'noh, lu sư iŏk 'batem. Lăm năr 'nei đei dang pêng-rơbâu 'nu bơngai mơ̆t tơ lu bơngai lui.

English: And they continued steadfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and in prayers.
Bahnar: Rim năr lu sư mơ̆ng lu jơ̆ng 'bang bơtho. Lu sư pơgơ̆p băl thoi 'nhŏng oh, sŏng sa 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ Yêsu hăm krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hơdai.

English: Then fear came upon every soul, and many wonders and signs were done through the apostles.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai tơring ei hli, yua kơ lu jơ̆ng 'bang pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh chrơp.

English: Now all who believed were together, and had all things in common
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui pơgơ̆p băl, dôm lu mŭk tơmam sư jing hơdai.

English: and sold their possessions and goods, and divided them among all, as anyone had need.
Bahnar: Lu sư tĕch mŭk tơmam, chŭn mir sư, asong băl jên kơ rim 'nu lu sư kiơ̆ kơ kăl yua.

English: So continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, they ate their food with gladness and simplicity of heart
Bahnar: Rim năr lu sư akŭm tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, hăm akŭm tơ lăm hnam sư kơdih. Lu sư sŏng sa hơdai dih băl 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ Yêsu. Lu sư chơt hiôk tơpă.

English: praising God and having favor with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily those who were being saved.
Bahnar: Lu sư bơnê kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu kon tơring tơrang kư̆m hơiă kơ lu sư. Rim năr đei bơngai lui na Kră Yang pơklaih lu sư păng tơmơ̆t lu đe noh tơ lăm khŭl bơngai lui.

English: Now Peter and John went up together to the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs păng Yôhan năm tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Sư pơtơm dih băl đơ̆ng pêng jơ kơsơ̆ wă akŭm krao khan păng đe.

English: And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms from those who entered the temple
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai hơwen hơwo đơ̆ng nge, đơ̆ng mĕ sư tơpŭ. Rim năr đei bơngai năm tung ba sư tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm tơoei sư 'bơ̆t 'măng tơm. 'Măng tơm ei đe anăn 'Măng Tơm 'Lơ̆ng Rŏ. Na bơngai hơwen hơwo ei apinh jên lu bơngai năm akŭm.

English: who, seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, asked for alms.
Bahnar: Lăp sư 'bôh bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan wă mơ̆t akŭm, sư apinh jên bre sư.

English: And fixing his eyes on him, with John, Peter said, “Look at us.”
Bahnar: Bre Pêtrôs lăng sư pơnhên. Đơ̆ng noh Pêtrôs khan: “Bơngai hơwen hơwo, ih lăng nhi.”

English: So he gave them his attention, expecting to receive something from them.
Bahnar: Na sư lăng bre sư. Sư ngêh kơ bre Pêtrôs wă ăn kơ sư jên.

English: Then Peter said, “Silver and gold I do not have, but what I do have I give you: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, rise up and walk.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs khan kơ sư: “Inh ưh kơ đei jên ôh, mă-lei inh tơgŭm ih. Yua anăn Yêsu Krist Pơlei Nasaret, yak bĕ.”

English: And he took him by the right hand and lifted him up, and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Pêtrôs rôp ti sư gah 'ma tơiung sư. Jơ̆ng sư jing pran hloi.

English: So he, leaping up, stood and walked and entered the temple with them—walking, leaping, and praising God.
Bahnar: Sư iung 'ngrơh gơh yak. Sư hơdai wang mơ̆t tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei hơdai bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan mơ̆n. Sư yak 'lơ̆ng, jơhngơ̆m sư hiôk păng sư bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih sư.

English: And all the people saw him walking and praising God.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai lăm hnam akŭm ei 'bôh sư gơh yak păng bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then they knew that it was he who sat begging alms at the Beautiful Gate of the temple; and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.
Bahnar: Đe kơnăl kơ sư đêl hmă oei 'bơ̆t 'măng tơm apinh jên. Na đe lăm hnam ei sơleng kơ đon yua kơ sư gơh yak boih.

English: Now as the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch which is called Solomon’s, greatly amazed.
Bahnar: Bơngai hơwen hơwo ei rôp ti bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan. Lu sư oei 'bơ̆t pra hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, anăn Pra Sôlômôn. Na đĭ-đăng bơngai tơ ei sơleng kơ đon năm tơ lu sư.

English: So when Peter saw it, he responded to the people: “Men of Israel, why do you marvel at this? Or why look so intently at us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made this man walk?
Bahnar: Pêtrôs 'bôh lu sư năm na khan kơ lu sư: “Ơ khŭl Isơrael, iĕm ưh pơwao kiơ kơ đon, na iĕm lăng 'bloh kơ nhi tơdrong nhi pơklaih bơngai hơwen hơwo âu khan tơdrong mơsêh nhi pơm kơdih yua kơ nhi bơngai 'lơ̆ng? Ưh ôh.

English: The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, glorified His Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let Him go.
Bahnar: 'Nâu dơ̆ng, lu kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆ thoi đe Abraham, Isăk, Jakôp, sư lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk atŏk Kon Sư Yêsu pơm tih. Ki iĕm jao Yêsu tơ Pilat wă sek tơlang Yêsu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, na Pilat wă achăng Sư ră, mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă kơ Yêsu ôh. Lu iĕm khan wă pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang đĕch. Iĕm apinh Pilat tơlĕch ăn kơ iĕm bơngai juăt kơ pơlôch đe

English: But you denied the Holy One and the Just, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you
Bahnar: 'Nâu dơ̆ng, lu kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆ thoi đe Abraham, Isăk, Jakôp, sư lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk atŏk Kon Sư Yêsu pơm tih. Ki iĕm jao Yêsu tơ Pilat wă sek tơlang Yêsu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, na Pilat wă achăng Sư ră, mă-lei lu iĕm ưh kơ wă kơ Yêsu ôh. Lu iĕm khan wă pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang đĕch. Iĕm apinh Pilat tơlĕch ăn kơ iĕm bơngai juăt kơ pơlôch đe

English: and killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses.
Bahnar: iĕm pơlôch Yêsu bơngai mă gơh ăn kơ bơ̆n arih ling-lang. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Sư boih. Nhôn kư̆m 'bôh Sư arih boih tơpă.

English: And His name, through faith in His name, has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which comes through Him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Yêsu, bơngai âu jing pran dơ̆ng. Iĕm băt boih kơ bơngai hơwen hơwo âu đơ̆ng sơ̆. Yua kơ nhôn gơnang kơ Yêsu tơpă na bơngai hơwen hơwo âu gơh klaih. Dang ei iĕm 'bôh sư klaih boih.

English: “Yet now, brethren, I know that you did it in ignorance, as did also your rulers.
Bahnar: “Ơ đe 'nhŏng oh, iĕm ưh kơ băt kơ Sư na iĕm pơlôch Sư Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu 'bok tih iĕm kư̆m hơdai ưh kơ băt mơ̆n.

English: But those things which God foretold by the mouth of all His prophets, that the Christ would suffer, He has thus fulfilled.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong noh trŏ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆. 'Bok Kei-Dei yua đĭ-đăng lu bơngai khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ pơkă 'Bok Krist gô lôch pơmat.

English: Repent therefore and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, so that times of refreshing may come from the presence of the Lord
Bahnar: Dang ei iĕm athei tơbral, wih tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei dơ̆ng, na 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơklaih yoch iĕm păng ăn kơ iĕm hiôk chơt

English: and that He may send Jesus Christ, who was preached to you before
Bahnar: Sư gô wơh Yêsu Krist 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih mă Sư rơih boih jur wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n.

English: whom heaven must receive until the times of restoration of all things, which God has spoken by the mouth of all His holy prophets since the world began.
Bahnar: Dang ei Yêsu oei tơ plĕnh truh tơ năr tôch kơnh. Sư wă jur tơ teh dơ̆ng na Sư gô pơm ming tôm tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng dơ̆ng, kư̆m thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn lu bơngai khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆.

English: For Moses truly said to the fathers, ‘The LORD your God will raise up for you a Prophet like me from your brethren. Him you shall hear in all things, whatever He says to you.
Bahnar: Thoi Môis khan sơ̆: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ iĕm minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng khŭl bơ̆n wă pơtruh nơ̆r Sư kư̆m thoi inh mơ̆n. Iĕm athei chu mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r Sư pơma kơ iĕm.

English: And it shall be that every soul who will not hear that Prophet shall be utterly destroyed from among the people.’
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ chu yom Sư, iĕm athei pơlôch tŭk sư.’

English: Yes, and all the prophets, from Samuel and those who follow, as many as have spoken, have also foretold these days.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ jô̆ đơ̆ng 'bok Samuel kư̆m khan lê̆ hơdrol gah tơdrong Yêsu mă bơ̆n 'bôh dang ei.

English: You are sons of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying to Abraham, ‘And in your seed all the families of the earth shall be blessed.’
Bahnar: “Bơ̆n boih kon sâu lu bơngai khan lê̆ hơdrol noh. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ăn kơ lu 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆, Sư kư̆m pơkă ăn kơ bơ̆n lei-lăi mơ̆n. Sư khan kơ Abraham: ‘Yua kơ đei minh 'nu Kon Sâu ih na đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai ala teh gô hiôk.’

English: Now as they spoke to the people, the priests, the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees came upon them
Bahnar: Kơplah bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan oei pơma kơ lu đe ei, na blư kơ lu 'bok soi truh tơ ei. 'Bok yŏng lu linh wei-lăng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm păng lu bơngai Sađusê kư̆m kiơ̆ sư mơ̆n.

English: being greatly disturbed that they taught the people and preached in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
Bahnar: Lu sư ơh klai kơ bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan bơtho khan tơdrong Yêsu iung arih đơ̆ng lôch boih, khan bơngai bơ̆n lôch boih na khan gô iung arih dơ̆ng lei-lăi thoi Yêsu.

English: And they laid hands on them, and put them in custody until the next day, for it was already evening.
Bahnar: Na lu sư rôp tah bre sư lăm hnam phak yua kơ kơsơ̆ boih, ưh kơ tam sek tơlang.

English: However, many of those who heard the word believed; and the number of the men came to be about five thousand.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng Pêtrôs păng Yôhan bơtho ei đei lơ 'nu bơngai lui kiơ̆ kơ Yêsu. Na jô̆ đơ̆ng Yêsu tŏk tơ plĕnh truh tơ đe rôp bre sư, gah drŏ-nglo đĕch đei pơđăm-rơbâu 'nu bơngai lui kiơ̆ kơ Yêsu boih.

English: And it came to pass, on the next day, that their rulers, elders, and scribes
Bahnar: Truh pơgê dơning na lu 'bok pơgơ̆r đe Juđê, lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu 'bok gơh sek tơlang, pêng khŭl lu 'bok âu akŭm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem wă sek tơlang tơdrong bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan.

English: as well as Annas the high priest, Caiaphas, John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the family of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Pêng khŭl ei akŭm păng Ana pơm 'bok soi tơm, Kaiphe, Yôhan, Aleksandrê păng đĭ adrĕch đe 'bok soi tơm.

English: And when they had set them in the midst, they asked, “By what power or by what name have you done this?”
Bahnar: Lu kră sek tơlang anhăk ba bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan wă sek tơlang. Lu sư jet bre Pêtrôs: “Đơ̆ng bu ăn kơ biĕm gơh pơklaih bơngai hơwen hơwo âu?”

English: Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, “Rulers of the people and elders of Israel
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Ơ đe kră sek tơlang păng kră pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Juđê

English: If we this day are judged for a good deed done to a helpless man, by what means he has been made well
Bahnar: tơ̆ng iĕm wă jet nhi tơdrong bơngai hơwen hơwo klaih boih âu, nhi gô roi kơ iĕm păng roi kơ đĭ-đăng lu khŭl Juđê mơ̆n, Yêsu Krist Pơlei Nasaret pơklaih sư. Iĕm băt mơ̆n Yêsu, iĕm pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang ki. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Sư đơ̆ng lôch boih. Na bơngai hơwen hơwo âu gơh klaih yua kơ Yêsu tơgŭm sư.

English: let it be known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, by Him this man stands here before you whole.
Bahnar: tơ̆ng iĕm wă jet nhi tơdrong bơngai hơwen hơwo klaih boih âu, nhi gô roi kơ iĕm păng roi kơ đĭ-đăng lu khŭl Juđê mơ̆n, Yêsu Krist Pơlei Nasaret pơklaih sư. Iĕm băt mơ̆n Yêsu, iĕm pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang ki. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Sư đơ̆ng lôch boih. Na bơngai hơwen hơwo âu gơh klaih yua kơ Yêsu tơgŭm sư.

English: This is the ‘stone which was rejected by you builders, which has become the chief cornerstone.’
Bahnar: Yêsu thoi lĕ kơ minh pôm tơmo mă lu bơngai man hnam tŭk lê̆, mă-lei tơmo noh dang ei gĭt tơpă, yua wă man 'bơ̆t mum hnam. Iĕm boih thoi lĕ kơ lu bơngai man hnam noh yua kơ iĕm tŭk lê̆ Yêsu.

English: Nor is there salvation in any other, for there is no other name under heaven given among men by which we must be saved.”
Bahnar: Pă đei bu nai dơ̆ng gơh pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Kon pôm Sư Yêsu Krist đĕch wă pơklaih bơ̆n.”

English: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were uneducated and untrained men, they marveled. And they realized that they had been with Jesus.
Bahnar: Na lu sư sơleng kơ đon 'bôh bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan pơma nuih tơpă. Lu sư kơnăl kơ bre sư bơngai ưh kơ đei hŏk, bơngai kuli đĕch, na lu sư kơnăl kơ bre sư oei hơdai păng Yêsu sơ̆.

English: And seeing the man who had been healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.
Bahnar: Mă bơngai đêl hơwen hơwo ei kư̆m dơ̆ng hơdai păng bre Pêtrôs mơ̆n. Lu 'bok sek tơlang ei 'bôh bơngai đêl hơwen hơwo ei klaih 'lơ̆ng boih, na lu sư ưh pă gơh pơjah thoi yơ dơ̆ng.

English: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves
Bahnar: Na lu sư athei đe tơlĕch bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan tơ 'ngoaih tŏ sĕt đĕch yua kơ lu sư wă pơđâu tơdrong noh kơdrô̆ lu sư.

English: saying, “What shall we do to these men? For, indeed, that a notable miracle has been done through them is evident to all who dwell in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.
Bahnar: “Bơ̆n wă pơm liơ kơ bre sư? Đĭ-đăng bơngai lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem kơtơ̆ng boih tơdrong mơsêh mơyang noh bre sư pơklaih bơngai hơwen hơwo âu, bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh khan ưh ôh yua tơdrong noh tơpă.

English: But so that it spreads no further among the people, let us severely threaten them, that from now on they speak to no man in this name.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơ̆n athei khă bre sư bơtho tơdrong Yêsu wă kơ tơdrong noh jah tôch.”

English: So they called them and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.
Bahnar: Na lu sư krao tơmơ̆t bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan tơ lăm dơ̆ng khan hloi: “Biĕm 'nĕ pă bơtho tơdrong Yêsu dơ̆ng hŏ.”

English: But Peter and John answered and said to them, “Whether it is right in the sight of God to listen to you more than to God, you judge.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan pơma tơwih kơ sư thoi âu: “Iĕm tơchĕng lăng deh, 'Bok Kei-Dei athei nhi chu kơ iĕm dah athei chu kơ Sư đĕch?

English: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.”
Bahnar: Nhi athei roi đĭ tơdrong nhi 'bôh Yêsu pơm păng đĭ tơdrong Sư pơma đĕch.”

English: So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding no way of punishing them, because of the people, since they all glorified God for what had been done.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai sek tơlang khă sư pă minh 'măng dơ̆ng na tơlĕch bre sư. Lu đe 'bok sek tơlang, sư tơchĕng tơduă sư khan: “Ưh pă gơh phak bre sư thoi yơ boih. Bơ̆n athei tơlĕch bre sư đĕch, yua kơ kon pơlei pơla đĭ ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih bơngai hơwen hơwo noh boih.”

English: For the man was over forty years old on whom this miracle of healing had been performed.
Bahnar: Bơngai đêl hơwen hơwo ei sư hloh puăn-jĭt sơnăm boih.

English: And being let go, they went to their own companions and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said to them.
Bahnar: Bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan lĕch đơ̆ng ei năm tơ lu bôl sư păng roi đĭ tơdrong lu 'bok soi tơm păng lu kră sek tơlang khă bre sư.

English: So when they heard that, they raised their voice to God with one accord and said: “Lord, You are God, who made heaven and earth and the sea, and all that is in them
Bahnar: Lu bôl sư kơtơ̆ng thoi noh boih, na đĭ kơ lu sư ei krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu: “Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, nhôn băt kơ Ih pơjing plĕnh teh păng đak dơsĭ; păng đĭ-đăng tơmam đơ̆ng Ih pơjing ngăl.

English: who by the mouth of Your servant David have said: ‘Why did the nations rage, And the people plot vain things?
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Ih yua 'bơ̆r đĭch đam Ih 'bok nhôn Đawit sơ̆, khan thoi âu: ‘Ơ Kră Yang, kơlih tơdrong kiơ dêh char đe tơmoi hil kơ Ih păng Kon Ih 'Bok Krist? Yua kơ kiơ bơngai Isơrael wă pơm kơnê̆ ră kơ Ih, mă-lei sư ưh kơ kĕ? Păng lu 'bok pơtao, lu kră pơgơ̆r hơdai wă ayăt kơ Ih mơ̆n.’

English: The kings of the earth took their stand, And the rulers were gathered together Against the LORD and against His Christ.’
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Ih yua 'bơ̆r đĭch đam Ih 'bok nhôn Đawit sơ̆, khan thoi âu: ‘Ơ Kră Yang, kơlih tơdrong kiơ dêh char đe tơmoi hil kơ Ih păng Kon Ih 'Bok Krist? Yua kơ kiơ bơngai Isơrael wă pơm kơnê̆ ră kơ Ih, mă-lei sư ưh kơ kĕ? Păng lu 'bok pơtao, lu kră pơgơ̆r hơdai wă ayăt kơ Ih mơ̆n.’

English: “For truly against Your holy Servant Jesus, whom You anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles and the people of Israel, were gathered together
Bahnar: Lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem âu lu kră pơgơ̆r hlôi ayăt kơ Kon Ih Yêsu mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, Sư boih 'Bok Krist mă Ih ăn pơgơ̆r nhôn. 'Bok pơtao Hêrôt păng 'bok pơgơ̆r Pilat, bre sư pơm minh đon păng lu bơngai dêh đe tơmoi păng lu bơngai Isơrael wă ayăt kơ Yêsu; trŏ tơpă yua kơ đơ̆ng nơ̆r Ih khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆, truh dang ei 'blep tơpă boih.

English: to do whatever Your hand and Your purpose determined before to be done.
Bahnar: Lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem âu lu kră pơgơ̆r hlôi ayăt kơ Kon Ih Yêsu mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, Sư boih 'Bok Krist mă Ih ăn pơgơ̆r nhôn. 'Bok pơtao Hêrôt păng 'bok pơgơ̆r Pilat, bre sư pơm minh đon păng lu bơngai dêh đe tơmoi păng lu bơngai Isơrael wă ayăt kơ Yêsu; trŏ tơpă yua kơ đơ̆ng nơ̆r Ih khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆, truh dang ei 'blep tơpă boih.

English: Now, Lord, look on their threats, and grant to Your servants that with all boldness they may speak Your word
Bahnar: Dang ei ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư oei hil kơ nhôn khă nhôn bơtho tơdrong Yêsu; na dang ei nhôn apinh Ih tơgŭm lu nhôn đĭch đam Ih, wă kơ nhôn nuih chă bơtho nơ̆r Ih kơ kon bơngai.

English: by stretching out Your hand to heal, and that signs and wonders may be done through the name of Your holy Servant Jesus.”
Bahnar: Apinh Ih yua mơsêh mơyang Ih wă pơklaih đe jĭ jăn. Păng apinh Kon Ih Yêsu mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ăn kơ nhôn pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang.”

English: And when they had prayed, the place where they were assembled together was shaken; and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and they spoke the word of God with boldness.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư krao khan đang boih, hnam mă sư akŭm ei adrŏ kyĭng kiơ̆ng. Đĭ-đăng lu sư 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng na jing nuih tơpă bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now the multitude of those who believed were of one heart and one soul; neither did anyone say that any of the things he possessed was his own, but they had all things in common.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai lui pôm đon pôm jơhngơ̆m. Rim 'nu lu sư đei tơmam kơdih kơdih, mă-lei lu sư jô̆ tơmam sư hơdai ngăl.

English: And with great power the apostles gave witness to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. And great grace was upon them all.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu roi kơ đe lu sư 'bôh Yêsu iung arih boih. Lu sư kư̆m gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang mơ̆n đơ̆ng Yêsu ăn kơ lu sư gơh tơgŭm đe. Păng 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m tơgŭm lu sư lăm tôm tơdrong mơ̆n.

English: Nor was there anyone among them who lacked; for all who were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the proceeds of the things that were sold
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu ưh kơ đei bu jơ̆l kơ tơmam ưh kơ mah ôh yua kơ dôm lu bơngai đei hnam, mir 'ba, sư blơ̆ mơdro đei bơ̆n kon jên.

English: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai nai dơ̆ng, anăn sư Anania, akăn sư Sepir; bre sư tĕch mir đei jên na klo sư iŏk lê̆ minh pah, minh pah klo sư ăn kơ lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu. Akăn sư kư̆m băt mơ̆n klo sư 'măn lê̆ minh pah ei.

English: And he kept back part of the proceeds, his wife also being aware of it, and brought a certain part and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai nai dơ̆ng, anăn sư Anania, akăn sư Sepir; bre sư tĕch mir đei jên na klo sư iŏk lê̆ minh pah, minh pah klo sư ăn kơ lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu. Akăn sư kư̆m băt mơ̆n klo sư 'măn lê̆ minh pah ei.

English: But Peter said, “Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and keep back part of the price of the land for yourself?
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ Anania, lơliơ yang Satan pơhlŭ ih na ih hơlĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng? Ih iŏk 'măn lê̆ jên mir ih minh pah mă-lei nơ̆r ih khan ăn đĭ hloi. Mă-lei nhôn ưh kơ đei pơgŏ ih ôh yua kơ mir noh mir ih kơdih, jên noh kư̆m lei-lăi mơ̆n. Kơlih kơ kiơ ih pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ thoi noh? Mă noh kơ sĭ ih hơlĕnh kơ bơngai ôh, ih hơlĕnh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch mă tơpă 'noh.”

English: While it remained, was it not your own? And after it was sold, was it not in your own control? Why have you conceived this thing in your heart? You have not lied to men but to God.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ Anania, lơliơ yang Satan pơhlŭ ih na ih hơlĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng? Ih iŏk 'măn lê̆ jên mir ih minh pah mă-lei nơ̆r ih khan ăn đĭ hloi. Mă-lei nhôn ưh kơ đei pơgŏ ih ôh yua kơ mir noh mir ih kơdih, jên noh kư̆m lei-lăi mơ̆n. Kơlih kơ kiơ ih pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ thoi noh? Mă noh kơ sĭ ih hơlĕnh kơ bơngai ôh, ih hơlĕnh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch mă tơpă 'noh.”

English: Then Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and breathed his last. So great fear came upon all those who heard these things.
Bahnar: Anania sư kơtơ̆ng Pêtrôs khan thoi noh, sư pơ̆k lôch hloi. Lu bơngai kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh lu sư hli tơpă.

English: And the young men arose and wrapped him up, carried him out, and buried him.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơdăm oei ngôi 'bơ̆t ei lơ̆k asu ăn kơ Anania khăn na lu sư tung 'bŭ Anania.

English: Now it was about three hours later when his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng Anania lôch dang pêng jơ, akăn Anania mơ̆t tơ anih đêl klo sư lôch ei, sư ưh kơ băt kơ klo sư lôch ôh.

English: And Peter answered her, “Tell me whether you sold the land for so much?” She said, “Yes, for so much.”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs jet sư: “Ih roi kơ inh, hăm trŏ kơ biĕm tĕch mir dôm noh đĕch dah kiơ?” Na sư khan: “Trŏ boih, dôm noh tơpă.”

English: Then Peter said to her, “How is it that you have agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord? Look, the feet of those who have buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out.”
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan kơ sư: “Lơliơ ih hơdai wang pôm đon păng klo ih lĕ na biĕm wă pơlong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei? To ih lăng deh, lu bơngai mă 'bŭ klo ih, lu sư 'nao wih đơ̆ng 'bŭ sư, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t 'măng to, lu sư wă tung 'bŭ ih lei-lăi thoi klo ih mơ̆n.”

English: Then immediately she fell down at his feet and breathed her last. And the young men came in and found her dead, and carrying her out, buried her by her husband.
Bahnar: Yă Sepir pơ̆k lôch 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Pêtrôs hloi. Lăp lu đe tơdăm truh mơ̆t tơ hnam ei, 'bôh yă Sepir lôch dơ̆ng, lu sư tung 'bŭ yă Sepir kư̆m jê̆ klo sư mơ̆n.

English: So great fear came upon all the church and upon all who heard these things.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai lui păng bơngai nai, lu sư hli tơpă yua kơ 'bôh 'bar 'nu bơngai lôch thoi noh.

English: And through the hands of the apostles many signs and wonders were done among the people. And they were all with one accord in Solomon’s Porch.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn. Lu bơngai lui pôm jơhngơ̆m akŭm tơ pra hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm mă đe anăn Pra Sôlômôn.

English: Yet none of the rest dared join them, but the people esteemed them highly.
Bahnar: Đe nai ưh kơ pơ̆n akŭm păng sư, mă-lei đe khan kơ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpă.

English: And believers were increasingly added to the Lord, multitudes of both men and women
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu mă drŏ-nglo mă drŏ-kăn, rai đunh rai lơ, đe mah anhăk ba lu bơngai jĭ jăn tơ trong tơ'bĭch sư tơ giơng dah tơ sơkok wă kơ yơ̆p ngôi Pêtrôs năm brih 'bơm lu bơngai jĭ jăn ei na lu sư klaih.

English: so that they brought the sick out into the streets and laid them on beds and couches, that at least the shadow of Peter passing by might fall on some of them.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu mă drŏ-nglo mă drŏ-kăn, rai đunh rai lơ, đe mah anhăk ba lu bơngai jĭ jăn tơ trong tơ'bĭch sư tơ giơng dah tơ sơkok wă kơ yơ̆p ngôi Pêtrôs năm brih 'bơm lu bơngai jĭ jăn ei na lu sư klaih.

English: Also a multitude gathered from the surrounding cities to Jerusalem, bringing sick people and those who were tormented by unclean spirits, and they were all healed.
Bahnar: Tăp dăr Pơlei Jêrusalem lu kon pơlei pơla lơlang lơlap năm anhăk ba lu bơngai jĭ jăn păng lu bơngai yang mơ̆t. Na đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư klaih ngăl.

English: Then the high priest rose up, and all those who were with him (which is the sect of the Sadducees), and they were filled with indignation
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'bok soi tơm păng lu bôl sư khŭl đe Sađusê areh klai khŭl bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu, tah lu sư tơ hnam phak.

English: and laid their hands on the apostles and put them in the common prison.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'bok soi tơm păng lu bôl sư khŭl đe Sađusê areh klai khŭl bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu, tah lu sư tơ hnam phak.

English: But at night an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors and brought them out, and said
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei năm pơih ăn kơ lu sư 'măng kơmăng tơlĕch lu sư păng khan

English: “Go, stand in the temple and speak to the people all the words of this life.”
Bahnar: “Năm tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm bĕ, bơtho kơ kon pơlei pơla gah tơdrong iĕm arih 'nao.”

English: And when they heard that, they entered the temple early in the morning and taught. But the high priest and those with him came and called the council together, with all the elders of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na 'năr lĕch pơgê dơning sư năm bơtho tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm thoi đêl. 'Bok soi tơm păng lu bôl sư năm truh tơ hnam sư akŭm. Sư krao lu kră sek tơlang păng khŭl lu kră dêh Juđê. Đơ̆ng noh lu sư wơh linh năm ba lu bơngai phak tơ lu kră sek tơlang ră.

English: But when the officers came and did not find them in the prison, they returned and reported
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp lu linh truh tơ hnam phak 'biao ưh kơ 'bôh lu sư lăm ei. Na lu linh brŏk tơ đe kră sek tơlang păng khan

English: saying, “Indeed we found the prison shut securely, and the guards standing outside before the doors; but when we opened them, we found no one inside!”
Bahnar: “Nhôn 'bôh ră 'măng hnam phak khuă kơjăp păng lu bơngai gak oei 'bơ̆t 'măng ei, mă-lei lăp nhôn pơih 'măng 'biao ưh kơ 'bôh bu lăm noh.”

English: Now when the high priest, the captain of the temple, and the chief priests heard these things, they wondered what the outcome would be.
Bahnar: Yŏng linh wei hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm păng lu 'bok soi tih kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, lu sư sơleng kơ đon tơpă păng ưh kơ băt lu jơ̆ng 'bang tơ yơ boih.

English: So one came and told them, saying, “Look, the men whom you put in prison are standing in the temple and teaching the people!”
Bahnar: Na blư 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai brŏk đơ̆ng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Na bơngai ei roi kơ lu kră sek tơlang, sư khan: “Lu bơngai mă iĕm tah tơ hnam phak noh brei, sư dang ei oei bơtho kon pơlei pơla tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm.”

English: Then the captain went with the officers and brought them without violence, for they feared the people, lest they should be stoned.
Bahnar: Na 'bok yŏng linh păng lu linh sư năm rôp dơ̆ng jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu. Mă-lei lu linh ưh kơ đei pơm kơnê̆ ôh yua kơ lu sư hli kơ kon pơlei klơ̆m lu sư păng tơmo.

English: And when they had brought them, they set them before the council. And the high priest asked them
Bahnar: Lu linh ei anhăk ba lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu truh 'bơ̆t anăp lu kră sek tơlang. 'Bok soi tơm khan kơ lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu

English: saying, “Did we not strictly command you not to teach in this name? And look, you have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this Man’s blood on us!”
Bahnar: “Nhôn khă iĕm bơtho tơdrong Yêsu boih, mă-lei iĕm oei bơtho tơdrong Sư jơ̆p kơ Pơlei Jêrusalem păng iĕm bơtho jâu nhôn pơlôch Yêsu mơ̆n.”

English: But Peter and the other apostles answered and said: “We ought to obey God rather than men.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs tơl tang lu bôl sư: “Nhôn athei chu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch, nhôn ưh kơ wă chu kon bơngai ôh.

English: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus whom you murdered by hanging on a tree.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei boih, khŭl bơ̆n bơngai Isơrael lui kơ Sư mă đơ̆ng 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆. Iĕm pơ̆ng pơlôch Yêsu tơ 'long pơglang tơpă. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Yêsu đơ̆ng lôch.

English: Him God has exalted to His right hand to be Prince and Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk Yêsu anih gah 'ma kơ Sư, ăn Yêsu pơm 'Bok Pơgơ̆r bơ̆n. Sư kư̆m pơm 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih bơ̆n mơ̆n, wă kơ bơngai Isơrael bơ̆n tơbral tơdrong yoch bơ̆n kơdih kơdih na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch bơ̆n.

English: And we are His witnesses to these things, and so also is the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey Him.”
Bahnar: Nhôn 'bôh tơpă lu tơdrong noh na roi kơ iĕm. Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kư̆m tơbăt ăn kơ nhôn tơdrong noh mơ̆n yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai chu lui kơ Sư.”

English: When they heard this, they were furious and plotted to kill them.
Bahnar: Lu kră sek tơlang kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, sư hil mơmĭl tơpă wă pơlôch lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu.

English: Then one in the council stood up, a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law held in respect by all the people, and commanded them to put the apostles outside for a little while.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei minh 'nu bơngai kơdră sek tơlang iung pơma. Sư bơngai khŭl đe Pharisi, anăn sư Gemel. Sư bơngai bơtho tơdrong juăt Juđê păng đĭ-đăng bơngai ư-ang kơ sư. Sư athei bơngai gak tơlĕch lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu tơ 'ngoaih tŏ sĕt.

English: And he said to them: “Men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what you intend to do regarding these men.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh sư khan thoi âu: “Ơ 'nhŏng oh bơngai Isơrael, iĕm sek tơlang lu bơngai âu iĕm kơchăng bĕ.

English: For some time ago Theudas rose up, claiming to be somebody. A number of men, about four hundred, joined him. He was slain, and all who obeyed him were scattered and came to nothing.
Bahnar: Thuđa sơ̆, sư pơang kơdih akâu pơm 'bok tih, kư̆m đei dang puăn-hrĕng 'nu bơngai kiơ̆ sư. Mă-lei đe pơlôch sư, na đĭ-đăng bơngai kiơ̆ sư tơklah tơklang pă gơh pơm thoi yơ boih.

English: After this man, Judas of Galilee rose up in the days of the census, and drew away many people after him. He also perished, and all who obeyed him were dispersed.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh, lăp 'bok pơtao chih iŏk anăn bơngai sơ̆, đei Juđa bơngai đơ̆ng dêh Galilê, sư pơsô̆ pơsôr đe kiơ̆ sư, mă-lei sư kư̆m lôch lei-lăi mơ̆n păng đĭ-đăng bơngai kiơ̆ sư tơklah tơklang.

English: And now I say to you, keep away from these men and let them alone; for if this plan or this work is of men, it will come to nothing
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dang ei inh khan kơ iĕm 'nĕ pơm kiơ kơ lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu âu, lê̆ đĕch. Dah tơdrong sư lĕch đơ̆ng kon bơngai pơm đĕch, tơdrong sư 'noh gô hiong.

English: Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, there arose a complaint against the Hebrews by the Hellenists, because their widows were neglected in the daily distribution.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei đe lui kiơ̆ Yêsu rai lơ. Lu bơngai lui ei khŭl bơngai Juđê pơma nơ̆r Grĕk păng khŭl Juđê mơ̆n sư pơma nơ̆r Juđê, lu sư pơjah pơjăng dih băl. Na khŭl mă pơma nơ̆r Grĕk, lu sư khan kơ đe mă asong tơmam sa, khan rim năr lu bơngai yă adro gah khŭl sư, đe ăn tơmam sa ưh kơ mah.

English: Then the twelve summoned the multitude of the disciples and said, “It is not desirable that we should leave the word of God and serve tables.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu krao akŭm đĭ-đăng bơngai lui khan hloi: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, nhôn ưh kơ wăn wă asong tơmam sa ôh, nhôn bơngai bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch.

English: Therefore, brethren, seek out from among you seven men of good reputation, full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei rơih chă lăm bôl iĕm tơpơh 'nu, lăm tơpơh 'nu 'noh chă bơngai tơpăt mă hơgei 'biơ̆ păng bơngai mă 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, noh nhôn wă kơ lu sư wei-lăng đe asong tơmam.

English: but we will give ourselves continually to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”
Bahnar: Na nhôn krao khan păng bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch.”

English: And the saying pleased the whole multitude. And they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit, and Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas, a proselyte from Antioch
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu đe ei kơtơ̆ng sư pơma thoi noh boih lu sư lăp đon tơpă. Na lu bơngai lui rơih iŏk lu bơngai âu: Êtien, sư bơngai lui kơjăp tơpă păng sư 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng; lu bơngai âu dơ̆ng, anăn lu sư Philip, Prôkơrô, Nikanor, Timôn, Parmina, Nikôla. Nikôla âu sư ưh kơ sĭ bơngai Juđê ôh, mă-lei sư kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt đe Juđê đơ̆ng sư lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆. Sư đơ̆ng Pơlei Antiôs.

English: whom they set before the apostles; and when they had prayed, they laid hands on them.
Bahnar: Lu bôl sư anhăk ba lu sư tơpơh 'nu bơngai ei tơ lu bơngai jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu. Na lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu pel hloi kơ̆l krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu sư jang tơdrong ei.

English: Then the word of God spread, and the number of the disciples multiplied greatly in Jerusalem, and a great many of the priests were obedient to the faith.
Bahnar: Đe bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei rai đunh rai jơ̆p. Lu bơngai lui lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem rai lơ tơpă, kư̆m đei bơngai 'bok soi lui kiơ̆ kơ Yêsu lơ mơ̆n.

English: And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and signs among the people.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m tơgŭm 'bok Êtien jing pran pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang 'bơ̆t anăp đe kon pơlei pơla.

English: Then there arose some from what is called the Synagogue of the Freedmen (Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and those from Cilicia and Asia), disputing with Stephen.
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem đei lu bơngai đơ̆ng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei đe anăn hnam akŭm đe rơngei. Đei lu bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei Siren, đơ̆ng Pơlei Aleksandrê păng đơ̆ng dêh Salisia, đơ̆ng noh dêh Asi năm akŭm tơ ei ngăl. Lăm lu bơngai ei đei mơ'nah chă pơjah pơjăng păng Êtien.

English: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.
Bahnar: Lu sư klai yua kơ jei Êtien ngăl. Yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm Êtien pơma hơgei, dôm nơ̆r lu sư pơma jei Êtien ngăl.

English: Then they secretly induced men to say, “We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư năm khan kơ bôl sư na athei bôl sư chă roi kơ đe thoi âu: “Nhôn kơtơ̆ng Êtien pơma kơnê̆ kơ Môis păng 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: And they stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes; and they came upon him, seized him, and brought him to the council.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu sư pơchŭt lu kon pơlei pơla, đe kră sek tơlang păng lu kră bơtho tơdrong juăt Juđê. Đơ̆ng noh na đe năm rôp Êtien anhăk ba sư tơ anăp đe kră sek tơlang.

English: They also set up false witnesses who said, “This man does not cease to speak blasphemous words against this holy place and the law
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh sư ăn bơngai hơlĕnh gah Êtien roi kơ lu kră sek tơlang thoi âu: “Bơngai âu ling-lang pơma kơnê̆ kơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm âu păng pơma kơnê̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n.

English: for we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and change the customs which Moses delivered to us.”
Bahnar: Nhôn kơtơ̆ng sư khan Yêsu gô pơrăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm âu păng tơplih tơdrong juăt mă đêl Môis ată kơ bơ̆n sơ̆.”

English: And all who sat in the council, looking steadfastly at him, saw his face as the face of an angel.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai oei tơ hnam sek tơlang 'bloh pơchơ̆k kơ Êtien, 'bôh muh măt sư nhen lĕ muh măt linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: Then the high priest said, “Are these things so?”
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơm jet Êtien: “Hăm trŏ kơ ih pơm thoi noh tơpă dah ưh?”

English: And he said, “Brethren and fathers, listen: The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Haran
Bahnar: 'Bok Êtien khan thoi âu: “Ơ đe 'nhŏng oh lu 'bok kră pơgơ̆r dêh bơ̆n, apinh iĕm mơ̆ng inh pơma 'biơ̆ bĕ. Tơ'ngla mơsêh mơyang 'Bok Kei-Dei năm tơ Abraham mă 'bok kră bơ̆n sơ̆ lăp Abraham oei tơ dêh Mesôpôtôme, hơdrol kơ sư wă năm oei tơ Pơlei Haran.

English: and said to him, ‘Get out of your country and from your relatives, and come to a land that I will show you.’
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ sư thoi âu: ‘Ih jăk achăng kơtum kơtŏng 'nhŏng oh ih đơ̆ng dêh char ih âu, năm hloi oei tơ dêh nai mă Inh gô tơ'bôh kơ ih.’

English: Then he came out of the land of the Chaldeans and dwelt in Haran. And from there, when his father was dead, He moved him to this land in which you now dwell.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Abraham jăk đơ̆ng dêh Mesôpôtôme năm oei tơ Pơlei Haran. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'bă Abraham lôch, 'Bok Kei-Dei athei Abraham năm oei tơ dêh bơ̆n oei dang ei.

English: And God gave him no inheritance in it, not even enough to set his foot on. But even when Abraham had no child, He promised to give it to him for a possession, and to his descendants after him.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă ăn kơ sư oei dêh char bơ̆n âu păng pơkă wă ăn kơ lu kon sư oei dêh char âu mơ̆n, mă-lei kơplah noh 'Bok Kei-Dei tam mă ăn kơ sư anih oei 'bơ̆t ayơ ôh. Hơtai ei Abraham kư̆m ưh kơ đei kon.

English: But God spoke in this way: that his descendants would dwell in a foreign land, and that they would bring them into bondage and oppress them four hundred years.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ sư thoi âu: ‘Lu kon sâu ih gô oei tơ dêh đe puăn-hrĕng sơnăm, kon sâu ih gô oei tơ ei thoi tơmoi đĕch. Đe gô ayăt kơ lu sư, rôp lu sư pơm đĭch đam.’

English: ‘And the nation to whom they will be in bondage I will judge,’ said God, ‘and after that they shall come out and serve Me in this place.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh gô sek tơlang păng phak dêh ei, na lu kon sâu ih gô jăk đơ̆ng dêh ei na oei tơ dêh âu, kơkuh kơ Inh oei tơ dêh âu.

English: Then He gave him the covenant of circumcision; and so Abraham begot Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day; and Isaac begot Jacob, and Jacob begot the twelve patriarchs.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă khan gô tơgŭm Abraham ling-lang, na Sư athei Abraham kăt tơdra akar lu kon sư wă kơ kon sư 'blŏk tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă tơgŭm sư ling-lang. Akăn Abraham tơpŭ minh 'nu kon anăn sư Isăk. Lăp 'bă sư kăt tơdra akar sư, Isăk 'nao tơhngam năr boih. Na Isăk pơjing minh 'nu kon anăn sư Jakôp. Na Jakôp pơjing mơjĭt-'bar 'nu kon, lu đe ei boih 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆.

English: “And the patriarchs, becoming envious, sold Joseph into Egypt. But God was with him
Bahnar: “Na lu 'bok kơdră bơ̆n ei sơ̆ gar oh sư, na tĕch oh sư Yôsep pơm đĭch đe tơ dêh Êyiptơ. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng Yôsep mơ̆n.

English: and delivered him out of all his troubles, and gave him favor and wisdom in the presence of Pharaoh, king of Egypt; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
Bahnar: Păng tơdrong anat anot sư 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m dŏng mơnat kơ sư mơ̆n. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư đei 'bơ̆r đon hơgei na 'bok pơtao Pharôn đe Êyiptơ lăp đon kơ Yôsep, na 'bok pơtao ăn kơ sư pơm kră pơgơ̆r dêh đe Êyiptơ păng pơgơ̆r hnam pơtao mơ̆n.

English: Now a famine and great trouble came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and our fathers found no sustenance.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt đĭ kơ dêh Êyiptơ păng dêh Kanaan, na đĭ-đăng bơngai đei tơdrong anat anot. Na lu 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆ ưh kơ đei tơmam sa ôh.

English: But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.
Bahnar: Na Jakôp kơtơ̆ng dêh đe Êyiptơ đei tơmam sa 'ba lơ, na sư wơh lu kon sư năm tơ ei.

English: And the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph’s family became known to the Pharaoh.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu sư năm pă 'măng dơ̆ng na lu sư kơnăl kơ oh sư Yôsep. Mă đe kư̆m roi ăn kơ pơtao Pharôn gah tơdrong 'nhŏng oh đe Yôsep mơ̆n.

English: Then Joseph sent and called his father Jacob and all his relatives to him, seventy-five people.
Bahnar: Na Yôsep krao 'bă sư Jakôp păng đĭ-đăng 'nhŏng oh sư tơpơh-jĭt pơđăm 'nu năm oei păng sư.

English: So Jacob went down to Egypt; and he died, he and our fathers.
Bahnar: Na Jakôp năm oei tơ dêh char Êyiptơ. Sư lôch tơ ei hloi păng đĭ-đăng kon sư lu kơdră bơ̆n kư̆m lôch tơ ei mơ̆n.

English: And they were carried back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a sum of money from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem.
Bahnar: Đe tung atâu lu sư tơ Pơlei Sichem 'bŭ sư jê̆ bơsat Abraham. Abraham răt teh bơsat noh đơ̆ng đe Emmor. Lu sư oei tơ Pơlei Sichem.

English: “But when the time of the promise drew near which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt
Bahnar: “Hơdrol sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă ăn kơ Abraham păng lu kon sâu sư oei tơ dêh bơ̆n âu. Na năr 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ei wă jê̆ truh boih, na lu bơngai Isơrael sơ̆ mă oei tơ dêh char Êyiptơ rai lơ tơpă

English: till another king arose who did not know Joseph.
Bahnar: truh minh 'nu pơtao tŏk pơgơ̆r tơ dêh Êyiptơ ưh kơ băt kơ Yôsep sơ̆ ôh.

English: This man dealt treacherously with our people, and oppressed our forefathers, making them expose their babies, so that they might not live.
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao ei pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆ păng sư pơgŏ lu sư athei hŭt pơơ̆t đĭ kon nge lu sư wă kơ lu kon nge jah lôch.

English: At this time Moses was born, and was well pleasing to God; and he was brought up in his father’s house for three months.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei đei mĕ Môis tơpŭ kơ sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ nge Môis mơ̆n. Mĕ 'bă sư rong nge Môis tơ hnam lăp pêng khei.

English: But when he was set out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him away and brought him up as her own son.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh mĕ sư tah lăm bai năm tơ'bĭch tơ kơpơ̆ng đak krong. Na kon adruh 'bok pơtao iŏk 'me rong nge Môis, pơm kon kơdih hloi.

English: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and deeds.
Bahnar: Truh Môis tơdăm 'lŏ boih, sư pơhrăm tôm tơdrong đe Êyiptơ. Sư bơngai 'bơ̆r đon tơpă, sư pơm tôm tơdrong hơgei.

English: “Now when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren, the children of Israel.
Bahnar: “Truh tơ Môis puăn-jĭt sơnăm boih, sư tơchĕng wă năm hơpong tơ buôl sư đe Isơrael.

English: And seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended and avenged him who was oppressed, and struck down the Egyptian.
Bahnar: Môis 'bôh bơngai đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ pơm kơnê̆ kơ bôl Môis na sư năm tơdŏng bôl sư pơlôch hloi bơngai Êyiptơ ei.

English: For he supposed that his brethren would have understood that God would deliver them by his hand, but they did not understand.
Bahnar: Na Môis ngêh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bôl sư băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn Môis tơiung pơklaih rơngei lu sư đơ̆ng dêh đe Êyiptơ ning-mônh mă-lei lu bôl sư ưh kơ băt.

English: And the next day he appeared to two of them as they were fighting, and tried to reconcile them, saying, ‘Men, you are brethren; why do you wrong one another?’
Bahnar: Năr dơning dơ̆ng Môis sư 'bôh 'bar 'nu bôl sư tơteh dih băl. Na sư năm găn bre ei păng khan thoi âu: ‘Ơ bre âu, biĕm 'nhŏng oh dah ưh na kơlih tơdrong kiơ biĕm tơteh dih băl?’

English: But he who did his neighbor wrong pushed him away, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai mă đei tơdrong yoch ei tơweh Môis păng khan: ‘Bu athei ih tŏk pơgơ̆r nhôn păng tơdrong sek tơlang kơ nhôn tơ âu?

English: Do you want to kill me as you did the Egyptian yesterday?’
Bahnar: Ih năm găn nhi âu inh băt ih wă pơlôch inh thoi ih pơlôch bơngai Êyiptơ năr brei.’

English: Then, at this saying, Moses fled and became a dweller in the land of Midian, where he had two sons.
Bahnar: Môis sư kơtơ̆ng bơngai mă tơhil băl ei khan kơ sư thoi noh, jơhngơ̆m sư hli tơpă, na sư kơdâu jăk tơ dêh Miđian, oei hloi tơ ei. Kơplah sư oei tơ ei, Môis sư iŏk akăn na akăn sư tơpŭ 'bar 'nu hơ'lơ̆p drŏ-nglo.

English: “And when forty years had passed, an Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire in a bush, in the wilderness of Mount Sinai.
Bahnar: “Môis oei tơ ei puăn-jĭt sơnăm. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư oei tơ ei puăn-jĭt sơnăm, truh tơ minh năr dơ̆ng sư năm tơ char glă jê̆ kông Sinai. Minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei năm tơ 'long jê̆ Môis ei pơm kơ ŭnh sa 'long ei.

English: When Moses saw it, he marveled at the sight; and as he drew near to observe, the voice of the Lord came to him
Bahnar: Môis lăng ŭnh sa 'long ei sơleng kơ đon. Sư năm mă jê̆ 'long ei wă lăng na kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ sư thoi âu

English: saying, ‘I am the God of your fathers—the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’ And Moses trembled and dared not look.
Bahnar: ‘Inh boih Kră Yang wei-lăng lu 'bok kơdră ih Abraham, Isăk, Jakôp.’ Na Môis hli tơrơ tơpă. Môis ưh kơ pơ̆n hue lăng Sư ôh.

English: ‘Then the LORD said to him, “Take your sandals off your feet, for the place where you stand is holy ground.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei akhan kơ sư thoi âu: ‘Ih plôh chơkhŏ ih bĕ, yua kơ ih oei jê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Inh.

English: I have surely seen the oppression of My people who are in Egypt; I have heard their groaning and have come down to deliver them. And now come, I will send you to Egypt.” ’
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh boih tơdrong đe Êyiptơ pơđep lu iĕm mă kon Inh. Inh kơtơ̆ng iĕm nhơ̆m hmoi na dang ei Inh jur wă dŏng mơnat kơ lu iĕm. Iung bĕ, Inh wơh ih năm tơ dêh Êyiptơ.’

English: “This Moses whom they rejected, saying, ‘Who made you a ruler and a judge?’ is the one God sent to be a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the Angel who appeared to him in the bush.
Bahnar: Hơdrol kơ Môis wă jăk sơ̆ đe Isơrael ưh kơ wă kơ Môis na khan thoi âu: ‘Bu athei ih tŏk pơgơ̆r nhôn păng tơdrong sek tơlang kơ nhôn?’ Mă-lei lăp 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh linh jang 'lơ̆ng pơma păng pơm kơ 'long ŭnh sa ei, na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Môis pơgơ̆r păng tơdŏng đe Isơrael đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: He brought them out, after he had shown wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red Sea, and in the wilderness forty years.
Bahnar: “Môis anhăk lu đe Isơrael đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Môis pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang tơ dêh Êyiptơ, tơ đak dơsĭ 'brê păng tơ char glă kơplah puăn-jĭt sơnăm.

English: “This is that Moses who said to the children of Israel, ‘The LORD your God will raise up for you a Prophet like me from your brethren. Him you shall hear.’
Bahnar: Môis kư̆m khan kơ đe Isơrael thoi âu: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ iĕm minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng khŭl bơ̆n wă pơtruh nơ̆r Sư kư̆m thoi inh mơ̆n.’

English: “This is he who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the Angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers, the one who received the living oracles to give to us
Bahnar: Lăp lu đe Isơrael oei akŭm kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ char glă ei sơ̆ đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma kơ Môis tơ kông Sinai, na Môis pơtruh nơ̆r ei kơ lu kơdră bơ̆n. Môis sư iŏk nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ bơ̆n arih ling-lang, pơtruh nơ̆r ei ăn kơ bơ̆n ră.

English: whom our fathers would not obey, but rejected. And in their hearts they turned back to Egypt
Bahnar: “Mă-lei lu kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆ ưh kơ chu kơ Môis ôh, ưh kơ wă kơ Môis pơgơ̆r lu sư. Lu sư 'maih wih tơ dêh Êyiptơ đĕch.

English: saying to Aaron, ‘Make us gods to go before us; as for this Moses who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.’
Bahnar: Na lu sư khan kơ 'bok Arôn: ‘Ih pơm kơ bơ̆n rup yang wă kơ bôl bơ̆n tung sư năm hơdrol kơ bơ̆n, na bơ̆n kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng. Môis anhăk bơ̆n đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ ră mă-lei bơ̆n ưh kơ băt kơ sư năm tơ yơ dang ei.’

English: And they made a calf in those days, offered sacrifices to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands.
Bahnar: Na hơtai ei lu sư pơm minh pôm rup yang kon rơmo hloi na lu sư gop tơmam soi khan gia kơ rơmo ei. Lu sư sŏng sa tih tơpă yua kơ rup yang ei lu sư pơm kơdih păng maih.

English: Then God turned and gave them up to worship the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the Prophets: ‘Did you offer Me slaughtered animals and sacrifices during forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
Bahnar: “Thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh pă wă kơ lu sư dơ̆ng ôh. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư kơkuh kơ măt 'năr, măt khei păng lu sơnglŏng tơ plĕnh ti đĕch. 'Noh thoi lu 'bok pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: ‘Ơ lu đe Isơrael, iĕm ưh kơ sơmah kơ Inh Kră Yang iĕm 'Bok Kei-Dei kơplah iĕm oei puăn-jĭt sơnăm tơ char glă sơ̆.

English: You also took up the tabernacle of Moloch, And the star of your god Remphan, Images which you made to worship; And I will carry you away beyond Babylon.’
Bahnar: Iĕm tung ba hnam yang Malŏk noh, păng rup sơnglŏng yang Rapan; dôm lu rup âu iĕm pơm kơdih wă kơkuh kơ sư đĕch, na Inh gô pơpuh lê̆ iĕm jăk oei tơ pah to Pơlei Babilôn.’

English: “Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness, as He appointed, instructing Moses to make it according to the pattern that he had seen
Bahnar: 'Bok Êtien oei pơma: “Lu kră bơ̆n oei tơ char glă ei sơ̆, lu sư đei hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Bok Kei-Dei athei Môis pơm Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm ei kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'bôh.

English: which our fathers, having received it in turn, also brought with Joshua into the land possessed by the Gentiles, whom God drove out before the face of our fathers until the days of David
Bahnar: Lu kon sư dơ̆ng, lăp 'bok Jôsuê pơgơ̆r, lu sư tung ba hnam ei tơ dêh Kanaan mă bơ̆n oei dang ei, na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơpuh lê̆ lu bơngai mă oei tơ dêh Kanaan sơ̆ ăn kơ lu 'bok kơdră bơ̆n oei tơ dêh Kanaan. Hnam ei oei truh tơ Đawit pơm pơtao.

English: who found favor before God and asked to find a dwelling for the God of Jacob.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ Đawit, na Đawit apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơm hnam akŭm tih wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei oei. 'Bok Kei-Dei boih mă Jakôp lui kơkuh kơ Sư sơ̆.

English: But Solomon built Him a house.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Đawit ưh kơ pơm ôh hnam ei, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn kơ sư pơm. Mă-lei kon Đawit Sôlômôn pơm.

English: “However, the Most High does not dwell in temples made with hands, as the prophet says
Bahnar: “Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ wă oei ôh hnam kon bơngai pơm. 'Noh thoi bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆

English: ‘Heaven is My throne, And earth is My footstool. What house will you build for Me? says the LORD, Or what is the place of My rest?
Bahnar: ‘Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r plĕnh păng teh, lơliơ iĕm gơh pơm ăn kơ Inh hnam oei lĕ? Inh ưh kơ kăl kơ hnam oei ôh.

English: Has My hand not made all these things?’
Bahnar: Inh boih Kră Yang iĕm mă pơjing đĭ-đăng kơ plĕnh teh.’ ”

English: “You stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears! You always resist the Holy Spirit; as your fathers did, so do you.
Bahnar: Êtien oei pơma kơ lu kră sek tơlang thoi âu: “Ơ lu iĕm bơngai ngĕng mă ưh kơ chu. Iĕm ling-lang kuă kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơgơ̆r, na iĕm pơm kơnê̆ kư̆m thoi lu 'bok kơdră iĕm sơ̆ mơ̆n.

English: Which of the prophets did your fathers not persecute? And they killed those who foretold the coming of the Just One, of whom you now have become the betrayers and murderers
Bahnar: Lu 'bok kơdră iĕm sơ̆ pơm kơnê̆ areh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu 'bok kơdră iĕm sơ̆ pơlôch lu bơngai mă pơkă lê̆ hơdrol kơ tơdrong 'Bok Krist bơngai mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt wă truh. Na Sư truh boih mă-lei iĕm plĕch kơ Sư păng pơlôch Sư hloi.

English: who have received the law by the direction of angels and have not kept it.”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei ată đơ̆ng linh jang 'lơ̆ng Sư, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ răk nơ̆r Sư ôh.”

English: When they heard these things they were cut to the heart, and they gnashed at him with their teeth.
Bahnar: Êtien pơma kơ lu 'bok sek tơlang ei 'lơ̆ng ră mơ̆n, mă lu 'bok sek tơlang ei tơkăp sơnĕnh hil mơmĭl areh kơ Êtien.

English: But he, being full of the Holy Spirit, gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God
Bahnar: Mă-lei Êtien 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm sư tơpă. Sư ngoi lăng tơ plĕnh 'bôh ŭnh pơchrang hơdah đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư kư̆m 'bôh Yêsu oei gah 'ma kơ 'Bă Sư mơ̆n.

English: and said, “Look! I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!”
Bahnar: Na Êtien khan kơ lu 'bok sek tơlang ei khan: “Iĕm lăng, plĕnh tơpơih ti, inh 'bôh Kon Bơngai oei gah 'ma kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Then they cried out with a loud voice, stopped their ears, and ran at him with one accord
Bahnar: Na lu đe ei kơtơ̆ng Êtien pơma thoi noh, lu sư pơma 'bơ̆r re chĭt đon hloi

English: and they cast him out of the city and stoned him. And the witnesses laid down their clothes at the feet of a young man named Saul.
Bahnar: păng tơluh rôp anhăk Êtien tơ jih pơlei wă klơ̆m sư păng tơmo. Na lu bơngai hơlĕnh kơ sư hei plôh ao lu sư kơdih, 'măn 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Sôl, sư bơngai oei tơdăm.

English: And they stoned Stephen as he was calling on God and saying, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu sư klơ̆m Êtien păng tơmo, wă kơ Êtien lôch. Lăp đơ̆ng ei, Êtien sư krao khan thoi âu: “Ơ Kră Yang Yêsu, apinh Ih iŏk bơhngol inh.”

English: Then he knelt down and cried out with a loud voice, “Lord, do not charge them with this sin.” And when he had said this, he fell asleep.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng pơma 'bơ̆r re thoi âu: “Ơ Kră Yang, Ih 'nĕ jô̆ yo kơ lu bơngai pơlôch inh.” Na sư lôch hloi. Sôl kư̆m wă kơ đe pơlôch Êtien mơ̆n.

English: Now Saul was consenting to his death. At that time a great persecution arose against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria, except the apostles.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ đe pơlôch Êtien ei, lu bơngai ưh kơ lui pơm lơ tơdrong kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai lui kiơ̆ kơ Yêsu tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Na đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lui ei jăk tơklah tơklang jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Juđê păng dêh Samari. Pôm lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu đĕch ưh kơ jăk.

English: And devout men carried Stephen to his burial, and made great lamentation over him.
Bahnar: Đei lu bơngai lui kơjăp năm 'bŭ atâu Êtien. Lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi ơh kơ Êtien lôch.

English: As for Saul, he made havoc of the church, entering every house, and dragging off men and women, committing them to prison.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sôl pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai lui wă kơ lu sư hiong răm. Sư năm jơ̆p jơ̆p mơ̆t tơ hnam đe, rôp lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu, bơngai drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn, tah hloi lu sư lăm hnam phak.

English: Therefore those who were scattered went everywhere preaching the word.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai jăk đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem ei, lu sư năm bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei jơ̆p jơ̆p.

English: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria and preached Christ to them.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei Philip năm tơ Pơlei Samari, bơtho gah tơdrong Yêsu. Sư khan: “Yêsu boih 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n.”

English: And the multitudes with one accord heeded the things spoken by Philip, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Philip pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang. Na lu kon pơlei pơla 'bôh Philip pơm thoi noh, na lu sư wă mơ̆ng mă nhên.

English: For unclean spirits, crying with a loud voice, came out of many who were possessed; and many who were paralyzed and lame were healed.
Bahnar: Philip pơklaih lu bơngai yang mơ̆t. Lăp Philip pơklaih bơngai yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t ei, na yang ei pơret kơdâu hloi jăk tơ nai. Sư kư̆m đei pơklaih lơ bơngai kue jo mơ̆n.

English: And there was great joy in that city.
Bahnar: Na pơlei ei chơt hiôk tơpă.

English: But there was a certain man called Simon, who previously practiced sorcery in the city and astonished the people of Samaria, claiming that he was someone great
Bahnar: Lăm pơlei ei đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Simôn. Đơ̆ng sơ̆ sư pơm lơ tơdrong hlĭch tơpă na lu bơngai Samari sơleng kơ đon. Simôn sư pơang akâu kơdih khan sư bơngai hơgei tơpă.

English: to whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, “This man is the great power of God.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei pơla mă bơngai tih, bơngai iĕ năm mơ̆ng Simôn ngăl. Lu sư khan: “'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Simôn pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang hơgei tơpă.”

English: And they heeded him because he had astonished them with his sorceries for a long time.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tơdrong hlĭch âu đunh boih na lu sư mơ̆ng Simôn tơpă.

English: But when they believed Philip as he preached the things concerning the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, both men and women were baptized.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp lu sư lui kơ nơ̆r Philip bơtho gah Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist păng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n, na Philip pơm 'batem kơ lu sư bơngai drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn hloi.

English: Then Simon himself also believed; and when he was baptized he continued with Philip, and was amazed, seeing the miracles and signs which were done.
Bahnar: Simôn kư̆m lui mơ̆n păng iŏk 'batem. Klaih kơ noh sư oei păng Philip ling-lang. Sư 'bôh tơdrong mơsêh mơyang đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Philip pơm, na sư sơleng kơ đon ưh kơ băt thoi yơ dơ̆ng.

English: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them
Bahnar: Lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem kơtơ̆ng ang đe Samri lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei boih. Na lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu wơh Pêtrôs păng Yôhan năm tơ dêh Samari wă krao khan kơ lu bơngai 'nao lui, apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng

English: who, when they had come down, prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem kơtơ̆ng ang đe Samri lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei boih. Na lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu wơh Pêtrôs păng Yôhan năm tơ dêh Samari wă krao khan kơ lu bơngai 'nao lui, apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng

English: For as yet He had fallen upon none of them. They had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
Bahnar: yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tam mă oei păng lu sư. Lu sư iŏk 'batem hăm anăn Kră Yang Yêsu đĕch.

English: Then they laid hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs păng Yôhan pel kơ̆l lu bơngai lui na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur oei păng lu sư hloi.

English: And when Simon saw that through the laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Spirit was given, he offered them money
Bahnar: Simôn 'bôh bre sư pel kơ̆l lu sư, Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur oei păng lu sư hloi na Simôn khan wă ăn jên kơ bre sư.

English: saying, “Give me this power also, that anyone on whom I lay hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”
Bahnar: Sư khan thoi âu: “Apinh biĕm ăn kơ inh gơh pel kơ̆l đe na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei păng đe hloi, na inh ăn kơ biĕm jên.”

English: But Peter said to him, “Your money perish with you, because you thought that the gift of God could be purchased with money!
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan kơ Simôn thoi âu: “Ih păng jên ih gô hiong lăm dơnâu ŭnh đĕch, ih ngêh khan gơh răt Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: You have neither part nor portion in this matter, for your heart is not right in the sight of God.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn kơ ih tơdrong âu ôh yua kơ Sư 'bôh jơhngơ̆m ih ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng păng Sư.

English: Repent therefore of this your wickedness, and pray God if perhaps the thought of your heart may be forgiven you.
Bahnar: Ih athei tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch ih âu. Apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei 'nĕ jô̆ yo kơ ih tơdrong ih tơchĕng yoch noh hei.

English: For I see that you are poisoned by bitterness and bound by iniquity.”
Bahnar: Đon ih kơnê̆ tơpă, ih oei hiong lăm tơdrong măng mu.”

English: Then Simon answered and said, “Pray to the Lord for me, that none of the things which you have spoken may come upon me.”
Bahnar: Na Simôn khan kơ bre sư thoi âu: “Apinh biĕm krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm inh; apinh Sư mơnat kơ inh 'nĕ ăn kơ inh hiong lăm dơnâu ŭnh thoi ih khan hei.”

English: So when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.
Bahnar: Na tơ Pơlei Samari bre Pêtrôs păng Yôhan bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu păng roi dôm tơdrong sư 'bôh Yêsu pơm sơ̆. Klaih kơ noh bre sư wih tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem dơ̆ng. Kơplah bre sư oei yak rok trong, bre sư mơ̆t drong lơ tơ pơlei đe wă bơtho rah Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng Yêsu tơ pơlei đe lăm dêh char Samari.

English: Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip, saying, “Arise and go toward the south along the road which goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.” This is desert.
Bahnar: Na gah Philip dơ̆ng, linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Ih năm tơ gah gơal Pơlei Jêrusalem hŏ, gah trong char glă chơngue mă jur đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem truh tơ Pơlei Gasa.”

English: So he arose and went. And behold, a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace the queen of the Ethiopians, who had charge of all her treasury, and had come to Jerusalem to worship
Bahnar: Na Philip năm hloi. Kơplah Philip yak rok trong ei sư 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai pơm tih kư̆m oei yak rok trong ei mơ̆n. Bơngai pơm tih ei, sư khŭl bơngai dêh char Êthiôpia.
