Sư wei-lăng jên yă Kanđake. Yă Kanđake pơm pơtao dêh char Êthiôpia. Na bơngai mă wei jên yă pơtao ei, ki sư năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem năm kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: was returning. And sitting in his chariot, he was reading Isaiah the prophet.
Bahnar: Na năr ei sư wih đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem. Kơplah sư oei yak rok trong hao kơpal gre aseh sư, sư đŏk lăng sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, đơ̆ng Êsai chih khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆.

English: Then the Spirit said to Philip, “Go near and overtake this chariot.”
Bahnar: Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng khan kơ Philip: “Năm bĕ ih, yak hơdai păng bơngai hao gre aseh noh.”

English: So Philip ran to him, and heard him reading the prophet Isaiah, and said, “Do you understand what you are reading?”
Bahnar: Na Philip năm yak hơdai păng kơtơ̆ng 'bok ei đŏk sơ̆p hla bơar Êsai. Philip khan kơ sư: “Ih đŏk lăng tơdrong noh, ih hăm hlôh ưh?”

English: And he said, “How can I, unless someone guides me?” And he asked Philip to come up and sit with him.
Bahnar: 'Bok ei khan: “Lơliơ inh gơh hlôh, ưh kơ đei bu bơtho inh?” Sư apinh Philip tŏk gre sư oei jê̆ păng sư.

English: The place in the Scripture which he read was this: “He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; And as a lamb before its shearer is silent, So He opened not His mouth.
Bahnar: Na 'bok ei đŏk lăng sơ̆p hla bơar ei thoi âu: “Bơngai noh đe anhăk ba Sư thoi đe anhăk triu wă pơlôch. Thoi kon triu ưh kơ chă hmoi lăp đe yuă sŏk sư, bơngai noh kư̆m ưh kơ đei ôr pơma ha pơret ôh.

English: In His humiliation His justice was taken away, And who will declare His generation? For His life is taken from the earth.”
Bahnar: Đe jô̆ kơ Sư bơngai ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng, păng lu bơngai sek tơlang kơ Sư ưh kơ tơpăt. Lu bơngai hơtai Sư oei arih ei sơ̆ pơm kơnê̆ tơpă, na pơlôch Sư.”

English: So the eunuch answered Philip and said, “I ask you, of whom does the prophet say this, of himself or of some other man?”
Bahnar: Na bơngai wei jên yă pơtao ei jet Philip: “'Bok pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei ei sơ̆ roi tơdrong sư kơdih dah roi tơdrong đe?”

English: Then Philip opened his mouth, and beginning at this Scripture, preached Jesus to him.
Bahnar: Na Philip khan kơ sư: “Tơdrong ba đŏk 'noh hei, Êsai khan lê̆ hơdrol gah tơdrong Yêsu.” Na đơ̆ng noh Philip bơtho sư tôm tơdrong Yêsu.

English: Now as they went down the road, they came to some water. And the eunuch said, “See, here is water. What hinders me from being baptized?”
Bahnar: Kơplah bre sư oei yak rok trong ei, bre sư 'bôh đak. Na bơngai ei khan kơ Philip: “Ih lăng 'bơ̆t âu đei đak glung. Ih hăm gơh pơm kơ inh 'batem dang ei dah ưh?”

English: Then Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may.” And he answered and said, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”
Bahnar: Philip khan: “Dah ih lui hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak ih, gơh mơ̆n pơm.” Na bơngai pơm tih ei khan: “Inh lui kơ Yêsu Krist Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: So he commanded the chariot to stand still. And both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water, and he baptized him.
Bahnar: 'Bok tih ei khan kơ bơngai wơ̆r gre sư athei dơ̆ng, na gre aseh ei dơ̆ng. Bre sư jur tơ đak, Philip pơm hloi kơ sư 'batem.

English: Now when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught Philip away, so that the eunuch saw him no more; and he went on his way rejoicing.
Bahnar: Philip pơm kơ sư 'batem đang boih, bre sư tŏk tơ kông. Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng hiŏng anhăk Philip tơ nai, na 'bok tih ei ưh kơ 'bôh sư tơ yơ dơ̆ng. Mă-lei 'bok ei kư̆ kơ brŏk tơ pơlei sư. Jơhngơ̆m sư chơt hiôk tơpă.

English: Then Saul, still breathing threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest
Bahnar: Sôl sư oei kơnam wă pơlôch lu bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu. Sư năm apinh tơ 'bok soi tơm pơm ăn kơ sư hla bơar wă kơ gơh rôp lu bơngai lui. Na 'bok soi pơm ăn kơ Sôl hla bơar gơh năm rôp đe tơ rim hnam akŭm đe Juđê tơ Pơlei Đamas, anhăk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem dôm lu bơngai lui kiơ̆ Yêsu mă drŏ-nglo mă drŏ-kăn.

English: and asked letters from him to the synagogues of Damascus, so that if he found any who were of the Way, whether men or women, he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Sôl sư oei kơnam wă pơlôch lu bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu. Sư năm apinh tơ 'bok soi tơm pơm ăn kơ sư hla bơar wă kơ gơh rôp lu bơngai lui. Na 'bok soi pơm ăn kơ Sôl hla bơar gơh năm rôp đe tơ rim hnam akŭm đe Juđê tơ Pơlei Đamas, anhăk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem dôm lu bơngai lui kiơ̆ Yêsu mă drŏ-nglo mă drŏ-kăn.

English: As he journeyed he came near Damascus, and suddenly a light shone around him from heaven.
Bahnar: Kơplah Sôl oei yak rok trong wă jê̆ truh tơ Pơlei Đamas, sư 'bôh hloi ŭnh đơ̆ng plĕnh pơchrang tăp dăr kơ sư.

English: Then he fell to the ground, and heard a voice saying to him, “Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me?”
Bahnar: Sư huŏng hơtat hloi đơ̆ng kơdŭ aseh. Na Sôl sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma kơ sư khan thoi âu: “Ơ Sôl, Inh pơm kiơ kơ ih, na ih pơm kơnê̆ kơ Inh?”

English: And he said, “Who are You, Lord?” Then the Lord said, “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting. It is hard for you to kick against the goads.”
Bahnar: Sôl khan: “Ơ 'Bok, anăn Ih bu?” Kră Yang Yêsu khan: “Inh Yêsu mă ih areh kơ Inh.

English: So he, trembling and astonished, said, “Lord, what do You want me to do?” Then the Lord said to him, “Arise and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei ih iung bĕ năm mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Đamas. Tơ noh đe gô khan kơ ih Inh wă ăn kơ ih jang tơdrong kiơ kơnh.”

English: And the men who journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice but seeing no one.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai năm hơdai hăm Sôl ei sơleng kơ đon ưh kơ đei pơma; dang lĕ kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh bu.

English: Then Saul arose from the ground, and when his eyes were opened he saw no one. But they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Sôl iung hloi. Lăp sư lar măt, măt sư bơbul, ưh kơ 'bôh hơdah. Na bôl sư rôp ti chông ba sư truh tơ Pơlei Đamas.

English: And he was three days without sight, and neither ate nor drank.
Bahnar: Pêng năr Sôl sư ưh kơ đei sŏng sa păng nhă đak. Măt sư ưh kơ 'bôh hơdah ôh.

English: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus named Ananias; and to him the Lord said in a vision, “Ananias.” And he said, “Here I am, Lord.”
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Đamas đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Anania, sư lui kơ Yêsu. Anania kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ơ Anania ơi.” Anania khan: “Ơ Kră Yang, Ih wă kơ kiơ? Inh tơ âu.”

English: So the Lord said to him, “Arise and go to the street called Straight, and inquire at the house of Judas for one called Saul of Tarsus, for behold, he is praying.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Inh athei ih năm tơ Trong Tơpăt, truh tơ hnam Juđa, chă minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei Tarsơ, anăn sư Sôl. Tơ ei sư oei krao khan kơ Inh.

English: And in a vision he has seen a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hand on him, so that he might receive his sight.”
Bahnar: Sôl sư apo 'bôh ih mơ̆t tơ sư pel kơ̆l sư wă kơ gơh 'bôh thoi đêl.”

English: Then Ananias answered, “Lord, I have heard from many about this man, how much harm he has done to Your saints in Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Anania tơl: “Ơ Kră Yang Yêsu, inh kơtơ̆ng lơ 'măng boih Sôl âu dah kiơ pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai lui kơ Ih tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem?

English: And here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call on Your name.”
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih kư̆m ăn kơ sư gơh rôp lu bơngai lui kơ Ih oei tơ âu.”

English: But the Lord said to him, “Go, for he is a chosen vessel of Mine to bear My name before Gentiles, kings, and the children of Israel.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu khan kơ Anania: “Ih jah năm tơ sư, yua kơ Inh rơih sư wă kơ bơtho tơdrong Inh jơ̆p kơ teh đak, bơtho lu 'bok pơtao păng lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: For I will show him how many things he must suffer for My name’s sake.”
Bahnar: Inh wă tơbăt kơ sư, sư gô đei tơdrong pơmat dang yơ yua kơ sư gô bơtho tơdrong Inh.”

English: And Ananias went his way and entered the house; and laying his hands on him he said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you came, has sent me that you may receive your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
Bahnar: Anania năm tơ Sôl, sư pel kơ̆l Sôl khan hloi: “Ơ 'nhŏng, Kră Yang Yêsu mă ih tơ'bơ̆p tơ trong hăm mơsêh mơyang Sư, Sư wơh inh năm tơ ih wă ăn kơ ih gơh 'bôh hơdah thoi đêl păng ăn kơ ih 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng.”

English: Immediately there fell from his eyes something like scales, and he received his sight at once; and he arose and was baptized.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Sôl gơh 'bôh hơdah hloi, yua kơchai măt sư huŏng. Klaih kơ noh đe pơm hloi kơ sư 'batem.

English: So when he had received food, he was strengthened. Then Saul spent some days with the disciples at Damascus.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng đe pơm kơ sư 'batem sư đei sŏng por. Đơ̆ng noh sư đei jơhngơ̆m 'biơ̆ mơ̆n. Sư oei păng lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu tơ Pơlei Đamas đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n.

English: Immediately he preached the Christ in the synagogues, that He is the Son of God.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m bơtho hloi tơdrong Yêsu tơ hnam akŭm đe Juđê. Sư khan Yêsu Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: Then all who heard were amazed, and said, “Is this not he who destroyed those who called on this name in Jerusalem, and has come here for that purpose, so that he might bring them bound to the chief priests?”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai kơtơ̆ng sư sơleng kơ đon păng khan: “Hăm trŏ 'bok âu dah kiơ pơm răm kơ lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem ki? Sư kư̆m khan wă năm tơ âu rôp bơngai lui kơ Yêsu ăn kơ lu 'bok soi tih dơ̆ng.”

English: But Saul increased all the more in strength, and confounded the Jews who dwelt in Damascus, proving that this Jesus is the Christ.
Bahnar: Sôl bơtho rai đunh rai hơgei na lu bơngai Juđê oei tơ Pơlei Đamas ưh pă gơh pơjah ôh. Sư bơtho khan Yêsu boih 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă kơ pơgơ̆r bơ̆n.

English: Now after many days were past, the Jews plotted to kill him.
Bahnar: Đunh đơ̆ng noh lu bơngai Juđê pơđâu wă pơlôch Sôl.

English: But their plot became known to Saul. And they watched the gates day and night, to kill him.
Bahnar: Lu sư gak lăng 'măng tơm pơlei prăt măng prăt năr wă rôp pơlôch Sôl. Mă-lei Sôl kơtơ̆ng thoi noh.

English: Then the disciples took him by night and let him down through the wall in a large basket.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai kiơ̆ gah Sôl tơ kơmăng tah Sôl lăm bai, chô̆ bai păng tơlei tơjur hloi sư đơ̆ng dur pơlei tơ teh.

English: And when Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples; but they were all afraid of him, and did not believe that he was a disciple.
Bahnar: Sôl năm truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem boih, sư wă akŭm kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hơdai lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu. Mă-lei lu đe noh hli kơ Sôl. Lu sư ưh kơ lui kơ Sôl kiơ̆ Yêsu boih.

English: But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles. And he declared to them how he had seen the Lord on the road, and that He had spoken to him, and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Barna'ba năm ba Sôl tơ lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu. 'Barna'ba roi kơ lu sư tơdrong Sôl tơ'bơ̆p Kră Yang Yêsu păng kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Yêsu pơma kơplah Sôl oei yak rok trong. Sư kư̆m roi kơ lu sư tơdrong Sôl bơtho đe kư̆m nuih 'biơ̆ tơpă mơ̆n kơplah sư oei bơtho tơdrong Yêsu kơ khŭl bơngai Juđê tơ Pơlei Đamas.

English: So he was with them at Jerusalem, coming in and going out.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh na Sôl oei hơdai păng lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu. Păng sư kư̆m nuih 'biơ̆ mơ̆n bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu jơ̆p kơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Sư pơjah pơjăng păng lu đe Juđê mă pơma nơ̆r Grĕk. Mă-lei lu bơngai 'noh wă pơlôch sư.

English: And he spoke boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus and disputed against the Hellenists, but they attempted to kill him.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh na Sôl oei hơdai păng lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu. Păng sư kư̆m nuih 'biơ̆ mơ̆n bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu jơ̆p kơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Sư pơjah pơjăng păng lu đe Juđê mă pơma nơ̆r Grĕk. Mă-lei lu bơngai 'noh wă pơlôch sư.

English: When the brethren found out, they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him out to Tarsus.
Bahnar: Lu bôl Sôl kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na năm ba sư truh tơ Pơlei Sêsarê. Đơ̆ng noh na Sôl năm truh tơ pơlei sư Tarsơ minh drô̆ sư.

English: Then the churches throughout all Judea, Galilee, and Samaria had peace and were edified. And walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, they were multiplied.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sôl lui boih na lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu oei jơ̆p-jang dêh Juđê păng dêh Galilê, dêh Samri hiôk-hian huay pă đei tơdrong truh tơ lu sư. Lu sư kư̆m rai đunh rai pran. Lu sư lui tơpă kơ Kră Yang păng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm lu sư ling-lang, na lu sư rai đunh rai lơ.

English: Now it came to pass, as Peter went through all parts of the country, that he also came down to the saints who dwelt in Lydda.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs năm akŭm jơ̆p pơlei, sư kư̆m năm hơpong tơ lu bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Liđa.

English: There he found a certain man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden eight years and was paralyzed.
Bahnar: Tơ ei đei minh 'nu bơngai hơwen hơwo, anăn sư Anêa. Sư ưh kơ gơh iung oei ôh, sư 'bĭch ling-lang ling-lang minh anih đĭ tơhngam sơnăm boih.

English: And Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus the Christ heals you. Arise and make your bed.” Then he arose immediately.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan kơ Anêa: “Ơ Anêa, Yêsu Krist wă pơklaih ih dang ei, ih iung bĕ, chơ̆p hơmet buk ih.” Đơ̆ng noh Anêa sư iung hloi.

English: So all who dwelt at Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai pơlei đe Liđa păng pơlei đe Sarôn 'bôh sư klaih boih, na 'bar tŏ pơlei ei, lu sư lui hloi kơ Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: At Joppa there was a certain disciple named Tabitha, which is translated Dorcas. This woman was full of good works and charitable deeds which she did.
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Japa đei bơngai lui kơ Yêsu, anăn sư Tabitha lăm nơ̆r Juđê, Đêka lăm nơ̆r Grĕk. Yă Đêka ling-lang sư gơh tơgŭm đe bơngai dơnuh hin păng gơh mơnat kơ đe.

English: But it happened in those days that she became sick and died. When they had washed her, they laid her in an upper room.
Bahnar: Hơtai Pêtrôs oei tơ Pơlei Liđa, yă Đêka đei tơdrong jĭ sư lôch hloi. Đei bôl sư ôp arao 'nhao akâu atâu ei păng tơ'bĭch sư lăm hnam gah kơpal.

English: And since Lydda was near Joppa, and the disciples had heard that Peter was there, they sent two men to him, imploring him not to delay in coming to them.
Bahnar: Pơlei đe Japa jê̆ pơlei đe Liđa. Lu bơngai lui kiơ̆ Yêsu kơtơ̆ng Pêtrôs oei tơ pơlei đe Liđa, sư wơh 'bar 'nu bơngai năm krao Pêtrôs đơ̆ng pơlei đe Liđa. Sư khan: “Ơ Pêtrôs, ih năm tơgŭm 'biơ̆ nhi bĕ, yua kơ nhôn đei bơngai lôch boih.”

English: Then Peter arose and went with them. When he had come, they brought him to the upper room. And all the widows stood by him weeping, showing the tunics and garments which Dorcas had made while she was with them.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs năm kiơ̆ hloi bre sư tơ Pơlei Japa. Lăp sư truh tơ hnam boih, đe năm ba sư tŏk lăng tơ hnam kơpal ei. Lu yă adro tơ'bôh kơ Pêtrôs ao yă Đêka đêl sĭt boih, wă kơ Pêtrôs băt kơ yă Đêka sư oei arih sư gơh tơgŭm đe. Lu yă adro hơdai nhơ̆m hmoi ơh mơ̆n.

English: But Peter put them all out, and knelt down and prayed. And turning to the body he said, “Tabitha, arise.” And she opened her eyes, and when she saw Peter she sat up.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs athei lu sư lĕch đĭ-đăng đơ̆ng lăm hnam ei. Pêtrôs sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng krao khan kơ Kră Yang. Đơ̆ng noh sư iung glĕch akâu sư kơdih, hue lăng atâu ei. Sư khan: “Ơ Đêka, iung bĕ.” Đơ̆ng noh yă Đêka lar măt păng 'bôh hloi Pêtrôs. Yă Đêka iung đơ̆ng 'bĭch tơoei 'bơ̆t anih sư.

English: Then he gave her his hand and lifted her up; and when he had called the saints and widows, he presented her alive.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Pêtrôs rôp ti sư tơiung sư hloi. Klaih kơ noh Pêtrôs krao đe yă adro păng lu bơngai lui, tơ'bôh kơ lu sư yă Đêka iung arih boih.

English: There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius, a centurion of what was called the Italian Regiment
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Sêsarê đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Kôrnei. Sư 'bok yŏng linh lăm khŭl linh đe anăn khŭl Itali, mă-lei sư wei lăp minh grŭp đĕch.

English: a devout man and one who feared God with all his household, who gave alms generously to the people, and prayed to God always.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ sĭ bơngai Juđê mơ̆n mă-lei sư păng đĭ hnam dơnŏ sư lui kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư kư̆m hơlăng kơ đe Juđê tơmam păng krao khan ling-lang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: About the ninth hour of the day he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God coming in and saying to him, “Cornelius!”
Bahnar: Minh năr ei dang pêng jơ kơsơ̆, 'bok Kôrnei 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei năm mơ̆t tơ hnam sư. Linh jang 'lơ̆ng khan kơ sư: “Ơ Kôrnei.”

English: And when he observed him, he was afraid, and said, “What is it, lord?” So he said to him, “Your prayers and your alms have come up for a memorial before God.
Bahnar: Na 'bok Kôrnei lăng sư. Sư hli dêh. Na 'bok Kôrnei khan: “Ơ 'bok, Ih wă kơ kiơ?” Na linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei khan: “'Bok Kei-Dei kơtơ̆ng ih krao khan ling-lang păng 'bôh ih hơlăng kơ đe kon pơlei pơla tơmam, na 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơgŭm ih.

English: Now send men to Joppa, and send for Simon whose surname is Peter.
Bahnar: Na dang ei ih athei bơngai jang kơ ih năm tơ Pơlei Japa krao minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Pêtrôs.

English: He is lodging with Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea. He will tell you what you must do.”
Bahnar: Sư oei păng minh 'nu bơngai jang akar, anăn sư Simôn. Hnam sư jê̆ đak dơsĭ.”

English: And when the angel who spoke to him had departed, Cornelius called two of his household servants and a devout soldier from among those who waited on him continually.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ linh jang 'lơ̆ng brŏk, 'bok Kôrnei krao 'bar 'nu bơngai jang kơ sư păng minh 'nu linh juăt awih awăn păng sư. Linh ei kư̆m lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: So when he had explained all these things to them, he sent them to Joppa.
Bahnar: Kôrnei roi kơ lu sư đĭ tơdrong sư 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng hei, athei hloi lu sư năm tơ Pơlei Japa chă Pêtrôs.

English: The next day, as they went on their journey and drew near the city, Peter went up on the housetop to pray, about the sixth hour.
Bahnar: Năr dơning dơ̆ng lu sư năm wă jê̆ truh tơ Pơlei Japa. Lăp truh 'năr dơ̆ng, Pêtrôs tŏk tơ anih hnam mă kơpal sư wă krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then he became very hungry and wanted to eat; but while they made ready, he fell into a trance
Bahnar: Sư pơngot wă sa. Kơplah đe oei hơmet tơmam sa kơ sư, sư 'bôh plĕnh tơpơih păng 'bôh anŭng che đơ̆ng plĕnh jruh 'bơ̆t anăp sư.

English: and saw heaven opened and an object like a great sheet bound at the four corners, descending to him and let down to the earth.
Bahnar: Sư pơngot wă sa. Kơplah đe oei hơmet tơmam sa kơ sư, sư 'bôh plĕnh tơpơih păng 'bôh anŭng che đơ̆ng plĕnh jruh 'bơ̆t anăp sư.

English: In it were all kinds of four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and birds of the air.
Bahnar: Lăm ei Pêtrôs 'bôh tôm kơ kon sem dơrong păng sem bri, đei bơ̆n 'bih kơep lep-ler bơ̆n sem păr.

English: And a voice came to him, “Rise, Peter; kill and eat.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng plĕnh thoi âu: “Ơ Pêtrôs, iung bĕ pơlôch 'buh sa lu kon sem âu.”

English: But Peter said, “Not so, Lord! For I have never eaten anything common or unclean.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs khan: “Ơ Kră Yang, inh ưh kơ gơh sa ôh, yua kơ inh ưh kơ lah sa lu tơmam âu, kơlih kơ tơdrong juăt nhôn giĕng ưh kơ gơh sa.”

English: And a voice spoke to him again the second time, “What God has cleansed you must not call common.”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs kơtơ̆ng dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Dôm tơmam âu 'Bok Kei-Dei khan 'lơ̆ng boih, ưh kơ đei giĕng ôh; na ih khan giĕng. Thoi noh ih pơma ưh kơ trŏ păng Sư dơ̆ng.”

English: This was done three times. And the object was taken up into heaven again.
Bahnar: Pêng 'măng Pêtrôs kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r đơ̆ng plĕnh pơma thoi noh. Klaih kơ noh che noh tŏk dơ̆ng tơ plĕnh.

English: Now while Peter wondered within himself what this vision which he had seen meant, behold, the men who had been sent from Cornelius had made inquiry for Simon’s house, and stood before the gate.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan: “Inh tơchĕng thoi yơ kih tơdrong noh hei?” Na bơngai đơ̆ng Kôrnei truh boih tơ Pơlei Japa. Na sư jet đe tơ yơ hnam Simôn. Đe tơ'bôh kơ sư. Na sư truh tơ 'măng hnam boih.

English: And they called and asked whether Simon, whose surname was Peter, was lodging there.
Bahnar: Sư jet bơngai hnam ei: “Pêtrôs hăm oei tơ âu?”

English: While Peter thought about the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three men are seeking you.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs sư oei tơchĕng tơdrong sư 'bôh hei, na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng khan kơ sư: “Pêng 'nu bơngai truh tơ âu, sư chă ih.

English: Arise therefore, go down and go with them, doubting nothing; for I have sent them.”
Bahnar: Ih jur mă tĕnh bĕ, năm hơdai păng lu sư, ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ ôh, yua kơ Inh athei sư năm tơ âu. Na dang ei ih 'nĕ pă tơchĕng giĕng tơdrong mơ̆t lăm hnam tơmoi ưh kơ khŭl Juđê.”

English: Then Peter went down to the men who had been sent to him from Cornelius, and said, “Yes, I am he whom you seek. For what reason have you come?”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs jur tơ lu sư khan hloi: “Inh boih bơngai iĕm chă, iĕm wă tơdrong kiơ?”

English: And they said, “Cornelius the centurion, a just man, one who fears God and has a good reputation among all the nation of the Jews, was divinely instructed by a holy angel to summon you to his house, and to hear words from you.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan: “'Bok Kôrnei sư yŏng linh, sư athei nhôn năm tơ ih tơ âu. Sư bơngai tơpăt, lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n. Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Juđê kư̆m khan sư 'lơ̆ng. Linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei athei sư krao ih năm tơ hnam sư wă kơ sư gơh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r ih bơtho.”

English: Then he invited them in and lodged them. On the next day Peter went away with them, and some brethren from Joppa accompanied him.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs athei sư mơ̆t tơ hnam sư păng athei sư 'bĭch minh măng tơ hnam sư ei. Pơgê dơning dơ̆ng lu sư iung năm hơdai. Kư̆m đei bơngai lui đơ̆ng Pơlei Japa ei năm hơdai păng sư mơ̆n.

English: And the following day they entered Caesarea. Now Cornelius was waiting for them, and had called together his relatives and close friends.
Bahnar: Năr dơmônh dơ̆ng lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Sêsarê. Kôrnei chang gô lu sư. Sư kư̆m krao akŭm lu kơtum păng lu bôl buăl sư mơ̆n.

English: As Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshiped him.
Bahnar: Lăp Pêtrôs truh tơ 'măng dur sư, na Kôrnei năm tơ anăp Pêtrôs. Kôrnei sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng kơkuh kơ sư.

English: But Peter lifted him up, saying, “Stand up; I myself am also a man.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs rôp ti sư tơiung păng khan: “Iung bĕ. Inh kư̆m kon bơngai lei-lăi thoi ih mơ̆n.”

English: And as he talked with him, he went in and found many who had come together.
Bahnar: Bre sư oei pơma dơnuh mơ̆t hloi lăm hnam Kôrnei. Pêtrôs 'bôh lơ bơngai akŭm lăm hnam ei.

English: Then he said to them, “You know how unlawful it is for a Jewish man to keep company with or go to one of another nation. But God has shown me that I should not call any man common or unclean.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm kư̆m băt boih tơdrong juăt nhôn bơngai Juđê ưh kơ ăn nhôn mơ̆t tơ hnam đe tơmoi phara khŭl păng ngôi hơdai păng đe. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt kơ inh nhên boih, inh ưh kơ gơh jô̆ kơ bơngai phara khŭl kơnê̆ ôh.

English: Therefore I came without objection as soon as I was sent for. I ask, then, for what reason have you sent for me?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lăp iĕm krao inh, inh năm hloi. Apinh iĕm roi kơ inh iĕm đei tơdrong kiơ na iĕm krao inh âu.”

English: So Cornelius said, “Four days ago I was fasting until this hour; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing
Bahnar: Na 'bok Kôrnei khan kơ Pêtrôs: “Puăn năr kơ âu boih, dang jơ âu mơ̆n, pêng jơ kơsơ̆, inh oei lăm hnam inh âu, krao khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na inh 'bôh hloi minh 'nu bơngai hrŭk ao kok hơdah, sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp inh.

English: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your alms are remembered in the sight of God.
Bahnar: Bơngai ei khan kơ inh: ‘Ơ Kôrnei, 'Bok Kei-Dei kơtơ̆ng ih krao khan păng Sư băt kơ ih hơlăng kơ đe tơmam na 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơgŭm ih.

English: Send therefore to Joppa and call Simon here, whose surname is Peter. He is lodging in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea. When he comes, he will speak to you.’
Bahnar: Na dang ei ih athei bơngai jang kơ ih năm tơ Pơlei Japa krao minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Pêtrôs. Sư oei păng minh 'nu bơngai jang akar, anăn sư Simôn. Hnam sư jê̆ đak dơsĭ.’

English: So I sent to you immediately, and you have done well to come. Now therefore, we are all present before God, to hear all the things commanded you by God.”
Bahnar: Na inh athei bơngai jang kơ inh năm krao ih hloi. Na ih năm hloi tơ âu. Inh bơnê kơ ih tơpă. Nhôn akŭm tơ âu 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆ng đĭ đơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei athei ih bơtho.”

English: Then Peter opened his mouth and said: “In truth I perceive that God shows no partiality.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs pơma thoi âu: “Dang ei inh băt tơpă boih 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ đĭ-đăng bơngai lei-lăi đĕch.

English: But in every nation whoever fears Him and works righteousness is accepted by Him.
Bahnar: Lăm rim khŭl bơngai, bơngai bu lui kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng pơm trŏ thoi Sư wă, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m lăp đon kơ lu sư lei-lăi ngăl.

English: The word which God sent to the children of Israel, preaching peace through Jesus Christ—He is Lord of all
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh Kon Sư Yêsu bơtho nơ̆r Sư tơ lu bơngai Isơrael. Nơ̆r noh Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ bơ̆n oei hiôk păng 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist lôch tang bơ̆n, Sư Yŏng đĭ-đăng bơngai bơ̆n.

English: that word you know, which was proclaimed throughout all Judea, and began from Galilee after the baptism which John preached
Bahnar: Iĕm băt boih tơdrong noh: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Yôhan bơtho tơdrong 'batem kơ đe, Yêsu năm jơ̆p kơ dêh đe Juđê, blŭng-a đơ̆ng dêh Galilê, bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, for God was with Him.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Yêsu đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm Sư pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang. Yêsu năm chă tơgŭm đe păng pơklaih đĭ-đăng bơngai đơ̆ng yang Satan pơđep. Yêsu gơh pơm thoi noh yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm Sư.

English: And we are witnesses of all things which He did both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem, whom they killed by hanging on a tree.
Bahnar: Nhôn kư̆m 'bôh mơ̆n đĭ tơdrong Sư pơm tơ dêh đe Juđê păng tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Đe pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang.

English: Him God raised up on the third day, and showed Him openly
Bahnar: Mă-lei pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng, 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Sư đơ̆ng lôch păng tơ'bôh akâu Sư kơ đe.

English: not to all the people, but to witnesses chosen before by God, even to us who ate and drank with Him after He arose from the dead.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sư ưh kơ tơ'bôh akâu Sư kơ đĭ kon pơlei pơla ôh. Sư tơ'bôh akâu Sư kơ lu bơngai Sư rơih hơdrol wă pơm kơdranh kơ Sư iung arih boih. Sư tơ'bôh akâu Sư kơ nhôn. Nhôn sŏng sa hơdai păng Sư đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Sư iung arih.

English: And He commanded us to preach to the people, and to testify that it is He who was ordained by God to be Judge of the living and the dead.
Bahnar: Yêsu athei nhôn bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng kơ lu kon pơlei pơla, tơbăt ăn kơ đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Yêsu sek tơlang dôm lu bơngai arih, bơngai lôch.

English: To Him all the prophets witness that, through His name, whoever believes in Him will receive remission of sins.”
Bahnar: Yêsu boih, dôm lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă khan gô truh. Lu sư khan bơngai bu lui kơ Sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơklaih yoch sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch bơ̆n kơlih kơ Yêsu Krist lôch tang tơ 'long pơglang sơ̆.”

English: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell upon all those who heard the word.
Bahnar: Kơplah Pêtrôs oei pơma na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur oei tơ rim 'nu lu bơngai mă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Sư bơtho.

English: And those of the circumcision who believed were astonished, as many as came with Peter, because the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out on the Gentiles also.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui đơ̆ng Pơlei Japa mă kiơ̆ Pêtrôs ei sư bơngai Juđê. Sư kơtơ̆ng lu kon pơlei ei pơma nơ̆r hlĭch ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na sư băt 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kơ lu kon pơlei ei boih. Na sư sơleng kơ đon kơlih kơ sư lăng lu bơngai akŭm ei ưh kơ trŏ kơ khŭl bơngai Juđê thoi sư. Sư ngêh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kơ khŭl Juđê đĕch. Na Pêtrôs pơma kơ lu bôl sư thoi âu

English: For they heard them speak with tongues and magnify God. Then Peter answered
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui đơ̆ng Pơlei Japa mă kiơ̆ Pêtrôs ei sư bơngai Juđê. Sư kơtơ̆ng lu kon pơlei ei pơma nơ̆r hlĭch ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na sư băt 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kơ lu kon pơlei ei boih. Na sư sơleng kơ đon kơlih kơ sư lăng lu bơngai akŭm ei ưh kơ trŏ kơ khŭl bơngai Juđê thoi sư. Sư ngêh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kơ khŭl Juđê đĕch. Na Pêtrôs pơma kơ lu bôl sư thoi âu

English: Now the apostles and brethren who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.
Bahnar: Lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu păng lu bơngai lui tơ dêh Juđê kơtơ̆ng ang kon tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl sư lui kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei boih.

English: And when Peter came up to Jerusalem, those of the circumcision contended with him
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem đei lu bơngai Juđê khan kon tơmoi lui boih athei kăt tơdra akar. Lăp Pêtrôs truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem lu sư pơjah păng Pêtrôs. Lu sư khan

English: saying, “You went in to uncircumcised men and ate with them!”
Bahnar: “Lơliơ ih năm hơpong kơ lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar thoi bơ̆n? Ih kư̆m sŏng sa păng lu sư tăm.”

English: But Peter explained it to them in order from the beginning, saying
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs pơma tơwih kơ lu sư. Sư roi kơ lu sư đĭ tơdrong noh thoi âu

English: “I was in the city of Joppa praying; and in a trance I saw a vision, an object descending like a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and it came to me.
Bahnar: “Hơtai inh oei tơ Pơlei Japa ki, minh năr ei inh oei krao khan na inh 'bôh minh pôm tơmam anŭng che tih đơ̆ng plĕnh jruh 'bơ̆t anăp inh.

English: When I observed it intently and considered, I saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, creeping things, and birds of the air.
Bahnar: Inh lăng lăm che ei 'bôh tôm kơ sem dơrong păng sem bri. Đei bơ̆n 'bih kơep lep-ler, bơ̆n sem păr.

English: And I heard a voice saying to me, ‘Rise, Peter; kill and eat.’
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng plĕnh kơ inh thoi âu: ‘Ơ Pêtrôs, iung bĕ, pơlôch 'buh sa lu kon sem âu.’

English: But I said, ‘Not so, Lord! For nothing common or unclean has at any time entered my mouth.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh khan kơ Sư thoi âu: ‘Ơ Kră Yang, inh ưh kơ gơh sa yua inh ưh kơ lah sa lu tơmam âu, yua kơ tơdrong juăt nhôn giĕng ưh kơ gơh sa.’

English: But the voice answered me again from heaven, ‘What God has cleansed you must not call common.’
Bahnar: Na inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r đơ̆ng plĕnh pơma dơ̆ng: ‘Dôm tơmam âu 'Bok Kei-Dei khan 'lơ̆ng boih, ưh kơ đei giĕng ôh; na ih khan giĕng. Thoi noh ih pơma ưh kơ trŏ păng Sư dơ̆ng.’

English: Now this was done three times, and all were drawn up again into heaven.
Bahnar: Pêng 'măng inh kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r đơ̆ng plĕnh pơma thoi noh. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh che 'noh tŏk dơ̆ng tơ plĕnh.

English: At that very moment, three men stood before the house where I was, having been sent to me from Caesarea.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei pêng 'nu bơngai truh tơ hnam inh oei. Đe wơh lu sư năm tơ inh. Lu sư ei đơ̆ng Pơlei Sêsarê.

English: Then the Spirit told me to go with them, doubting nothing. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered the man’s house.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng athei inh năm hơdai păng lu sư păng khan kơ inh thoi âu: ‘Ih 'nĕ pă tơchĕng giĕng tơdrong mơ̆t lăm hnam tơmoi ưh kơ khŭl Juđê.’ Bôl inh âu tơdrâu 'nu kư̆m năm hơdai hăm inh mơ̆n. Na nhôn mơ̆t tơ hnam Kôrnei.

English: And he told us how he had seen an angel standing in his house, who said to him, ‘Send men to Joppa, and call for Simon whose surname is Peter
Bahnar: Sư roi kơ nhôn tơdrong sư 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm hnam sư. Linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei khan kơ sư: ‘Ih athei bơngai jang kơ ih năm tơ Pơlei Japa krao minh 'nu bơngai, anăn sư Pêtrôs.

English: who will tell you words by which you and all your household will be saved.’
Bahnar: Sư gô bơtho ih, na 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơklaih ih păng đĭ-đăng hnam dơnŏ ih.’

English: And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them, as upon us at the beginning.
Then I remembered the word of the Lord, how He said, ‘John indeed baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
Bahnar: Na inh 'blŏk kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang Yêsu khan sơ̆: ‘Yôhan pơm kơ iĕm 'batem păng đak, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơm kơ iĕm 'batem phara, Sư gô ăn kơ iĕm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư.’

English: If therefore God gave them the same gift as He gave us when we believed on the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I that I could withstand God?”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng thoi Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n sơ̆ lăp bơ̆n lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist, na Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng hloi. Na inh ưh kơ wă găn 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh.”

English: When they heard these things they became silent; and they glorified God, saying, “Then God has also granted to the Gentiles repentance to life.”
Bahnar: Lăp lu bôl Pêtrôs kơtơ̆ng Pêtrôs pơma thoi noh, lu sư chu hloi, huay pă pơjah dơ̆ng. Na lu sư ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng khan: “'Noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ kon tơmoi tơbral tơdrong yoch lu sư, wă kơ lu sư arih ling-lang kư̆m thoi bơ̆n mơ̆n.”

English: Now those who were scattered after the persecution that arose over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, preaching the word to no one but the Jews only.
Bahnar: Lăp đe pơlôch Êtien đe kư̆m pơm lơ tơdrong kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai lui mơ̆n. Na lu bơngai lui kư̆m jăk truh tơ dêh Phênisi, dêh Chiprơ păng Pơlei Antiôs mơ̆n păng bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng kơ bơngai Juđê ngăl.

English: But some of them were men from Cyprus and Cyrene, who, when they had come to Antioch, spoke to the Hellenists, preaching the Lord Jesus.
Bahnar: Lăm lu bơngai lui ei đei bơngai đơ̆ng dêh Chiprơ păng bơngai Pơlei Siren lu sư khŭl Juđê, mă-lei lu sư năm bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu kơ lu kon tơmoi ưh kơ khŭl sư tơ Pơlei Antiôs.

English: And the hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Yêsu Krist tơgŭm lu sư bơtho đe na đei lơ bơngai lui kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: Then news of these things came to the ears of the church in Jerusalem, and they sent out Barnabas to go as far as Antioch.
Bahnar: Lu 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong 'noh, na lu sư wơh minh 'nu 'Barna'ba năm tơ Pơlei Antiôs.

English: When he came and had seen the grace of God, he was glad, and encouraged them all that with purpose of heart they should continue with the Lord.
Bahnar: Lăp 'Barna'ba truh boih tơ Pơlei Antiôs, sư 'bôh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu sư tơpă. Na jơhngơ̆m 'Barna'ba chơt hiôk. Na 'Barna'ba pơlung lu sư khŏm khŏm wă kơ lu sư lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak lu sư kơdih.

English: For he was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a great many people were added to the Lord.
Bahnar: 'Barna'ba sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng, sư lui kơjăp păng sư 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm sư ling-lang. Na hơtai ei đei lơ bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: Then Barnabas departed for Tarsus to seek Saul.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh dơ̆ng, 'Barna'ba năm tơ Pơlei Tarsơ sư chă Sôl.

English: And when he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. So it was that for a whole year they assembled with the church and taught a great many people. And the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.
Bahnar: Lăp sư chă 'bôh boih, sư anhăk ba Sôl tơ Pơlei Antiôs. Kơplah minh sơnăm bre sư bơtho lu bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Antiôs. Bre sư bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei na lơ bơngai năm mơ̆ng. Tơ ei đe anăn lu bơngai lui, bơngai Krist. Đơ̆ng sơ̆ đe ưh kơ anăn thoi noh ôh.

English: And in these days prophets came from Jerusalem to Antioch.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei đei lu bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem năm tơ Pơlei Antiôs. Lu sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then one of them, named Agabus, stood up and showed by the Spirit that there was going to be a great famine throughout all the world, which also happened in the days of Claudius Caesar.
Bahnar: Lăm lu sư ei đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Abus. Lăp lu bơngai ei oei akŭm, Abus iung pơma. Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ sư khan lê̆ hơdrol gô đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Na kơplah pơtao Klôt pơgơ̆r, kư̆m đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt.

English: Then the disciples, each according to his ability, determined to send relief to the brethren dwelling in Judea.
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai lui kơtơ̆ng gô đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt, na lu sư wă tơra jên ăn kơ lu bôl sư lui tơ dêh Juđê. Na rim 'nu lu sư ăn jên kiơ̆ kơ akâu sư đei.

English: This they also did, and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul.
Bahnar: Na lu sư ăn jên kơ bre 'Barna'ba păng Sôl. Bre sư chĕp ba jên 'noh tơ dêh Juđê wă ăn kơ lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai lui.

English: Now about that time Herod the king stretched out his hand to harass some from the church.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei pơtao Hêrôt rôp lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu mơ'nah wă kơ pơrăm lu sư.

English: Then he killed James the brother of John with the sword.
Bahnar: Na sư koh pơlôch Yakơ 'nhŏng kơ Yôhan.

English: And because he saw that it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to seize Peter also. Now it was during the Days of Unleavened Bread.
Bahnar: Hêrôt 'bôh đe 'bok tih Juđê lăp đon tơpă, na lăp đe Juđê pơm giĕng sa 'Bĕng Mi Ưh Kơ Đei 'Buih Pông, Hêrôt rôp Pêtrôs.

English: So when he had arrested him, he put him in prison, and delivered him to four squads of soldiers to keep him, intending to bring him before the people after Passover.
Bahnar: Hêrôt tah Pêtrôs lăm hnam phak. Sư ăn kơ mơjĭt-tơdrâu 'nu linh gak Pêtrôs. Đang kơ giĕng boih Hêrôt wă pơlôch Pêtrôs 'bơ̆t anăp đe Juđê ră.

English: Peter was therefore kept in prison, but constant prayer was offered to God for him by the church.
Bahnar: Hơtai Pêtrôs oei lăm hnam phak, na lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu krao khan ling-lang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m apinh Sư tơgŭm Pêtrôs wă kơ gơh lĕch.

English: And when Herod was about to bring him out, that night Peter was sleeping, bound with two chains between two soldiers; and the guards before the door were keeping the prison.
Bahnar: Na truh măng ei tơ lăm hnam phak noh đe oei chô̆ Pêtrôs păng tơlei glang mam 'bar dăng. Sư oei tep đei linh gak, minh 'nu gah 'ma minh 'nu gah 'ngiĕo. Tơ 'măng hnam ei kư̆m đei linh gak mơ̆n. Pơtao Hêrôt athei lu linh gô pơgê dơning tơlĕch sư yua kơ 'bok pơtao wă pơlôch sư boih.

English: Now behold, an angel of the Lord stood by him, and a light shone in the prison; and he struck Peter on the side and raised him up, saying, “Arise quickly!” And his chains fell off his hands.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăm hnam ei đei hloi ŭnh hơdah, linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei năm wă tơlĕch Pêtrôs. Linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei pel 'bơ̆t sơngiĕng păng râu Pêtrôs, khan hloi: “Iung mă kuăng wăi.” Na tơlei glang đêl đe chô̆ ti Pêtrôs ei tơyaih hloi.

English: Then the angel said to him, “Gird yourself and tie on your sandals”; and so he did. And he said to him, “Put on your garment and follow me.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na linh jang khan kơ sư: “Hrŭk ao 'bot chơkhŏ ih wăi.” Na Pêtrôs hrŭk ao 'bot chơkhŏ sư hloi. “Păng asu khăn ih kiơ̆ inh.”

English: So he went out and followed him, and did not know that what was done by the angel was real, but thought he was seeing a vision.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs asu khăn sư, iung yak kiơ̆ linh jang 'lơ̆ng tơ 'ngoaih hloi. Mă-lei Pêtrôs khan nhen lĕ apo đĕch.

English: When they were past the first and the second guard posts, they came to the iron gate that leads to the city, which opened to them of its own accord; and they went out and went down one street, and immediately the angel departed from him.
Bahnar: Na bre sư lĕch 'bar tăl dur đei linh gak mă ưh kơ đei 'măng ôh. Truh tơ dur mă pêng đei 'măng săt mam, mă-lei 'măng săt mam ei tơpơih kơdih. Na bre sư lĕch hloi tơ 'ngoaih. Linh jang 'lơ̆ng năm ba sư truh tơ trong tơklah, na bre sư tơklah dih băl.

English: And when Peter had come to himself, he said, “Now I know for certain that the Lord has sent His angel, and has delivered me from the hand of Herod and from all the expectation of the Jewish people.”
Bahnar: “Ơ tơpă boih, inh băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh linh jang 'lơ̆ng Sư jur tơdŏng inh đơ̆ng 'bok pơtao Hêrôt păng lu bơngai Juđê wă pơlôch inh.”

English: So, when he had considered this, he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered together praying.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư tơchĕng boih, sư năm tơ hnam Mari mĕ Yôhan. Yôhan noh đe kư̆m anăn sư Markôs. Tơ ei đei lơ bơngai oei akŭm krao khan.

English: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a girl named Rhoda came to answer.
Bahnar: Sư truh tơ hnam boih na sư dơdŭ 'măng. Đơ̆ng ei na đei minh 'nu adruh wă năm pơih 'măng.

English: When she recognized Peter’s voice, because of her gladness she did not open the gate, but ran in and announced that Peter stood before the gate.
Bahnar: Na adruh ei kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Pêtrôs, sư hiôk jơhngơ̆m sư tơpă jing pă yĕng pơih 'măng dơ̆ng. Duch adruh ei anăn sư Rơđa, sư năm tơkan khan kơ buăl sư tơ lăm hnam ei dơ̆ng.

English: But they said to her, “You are beside yourself!” Yet she kept insisting that it was so. So they said, “It is his angel.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu buăl sư lăm hnam ei ưh kơ lui. Lu sư khan kơ duch adruh ei khan: “Băt ih wơnh boih ih âu.” Mă-lei duch adruh ei khan tơpă. Na lu buăl sư khan: “Đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă wei-lăng sư đĕch, ưh kơ 'blep kơ Pêtrôs kơlĕ.”

English: Now Peter continued knocking; and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astonished.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs oei dơdŭ 'măng khŏm khŏm, na đe năm pơih 'măng, na 'blep kơ Pêtrôs tơpă. Đĭ-đăng lu sư sơleng kơ đon ưh kơ băt tơchĕng thoi yơ dơ̆ng. Lu sư pơma re đơđơu đơđao.

English: But motioning to them with his hand to keep silent, he declared to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he said, “Go, tell these things to James and to the brethren.” And he departed and went to another place.
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs yơ̆r ti khă lu sư pơma, na oei thĕng huay pă pơma boih. Na Pêtrôs roi kơ lu bơngai oei lăm hnam ei kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơlĕch sư. Pêtrôs athei lu bơngai oei lăm hnam ei năm khan kơ 'bok Yakơ păng lu bơngai lui wă roi tơdrong sư lĕch. Đang kơ sư roi tơdrong ei Pêtrôs jăk oei tơ nai dơ̆ng.

English: Then, as soon as it was day, there was no small stir among the soldiers about what had become of Peter.
Bahnar: Truh pơgê dơning lu linh hli kơ Pêtrôs lĕch boih. Lu sư krao pơret dih băl wă chă Pêtrôs.

English: But when Herod had searched for him and not found him, he examined the guards and commanded that they should be put to death. And he went down from Judea to Caesarea, and stayed there.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hêrôt athei lu linh chă mă 'bôh, mă lu linh chă ưh kơ 'bôh ôh. Na pơtao Hêrôt rôp linh ei sek tơlang. Đơ̆ng noh đei nơ̆r pơtao Hêrôt athei tơduă linh bôl sư pơlôch mă linh gak ưh kơ 'lơ'lŏ ei. Klaih kơ noh pơtao Hêrôt năm đơ̆ng char Juđê tơ Pơlei Sêsarê. Tơ noh sư wă oei đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n.

English: Now Herod had been very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon; but they came to him with one accord, and having made Blastus the king’s personal aide their friend, they asked for peace, because their country was supplied with food by the king’s country.
Bahnar: Pơtao Hêrôt đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih sư oei ơh kơ lu bơngai Pơlei Tirơ păng lu Pơlei Siđôn. Na lu bơngai ei năm tơ sư. Lu sư pơlung Blastơ tơgŭm lu sư na sư khan wă tơgŭm mơ̆n. Sư bơngai wei-lăng hnam pơtao Hêrôt. Lu sư wă kơ Hêrôt hiôk păng sư yua kơ lu sư wă năm răt tơmam sa ling-lang đơ̆ng dêh pơtao Hêrôt pơgơ̆r, yua kơ tơmam sa lăm pơlei sư ưh kơ gan mah.

English: So on a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat on his throne and gave an oration to them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Hêrôt pơkă kơ lu sư năr wă kơ lu sư gơh năm tơ sư. Na truh năr pơkă ei Hêrôt hrŭk ao pơtao sư păng sư oei tơ tang-dŏ 'lơ̆ng rŏ sư. Sư pơma kơ lu kon pơlei pơla.

English: And the people kept shouting, “The voice of a god and not of a man!”
Bahnar: Na lu kon pơlei pơla ôr pơret drơ̆ng tơwih sư: “Nơ̆r âu yang pơma, ưh kơ sĭ bơngai pơma ôh.”

English: Then immediately an angel of the Lord struck him, because he did not give glory to God. And he was eaten by worms and died.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang pơm hloi kơ pơtao Hêrôt đei tơdrong jĭ, kơlih kơ sư ưh kơ ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh. Sư lăp đon kơ đe ư-ang kơ sư khan yang. Na sư lôch kơ hơmơng sa.

English: But the word of God grew and multiplied.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kơplah ei đe bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, rai đunh rai jơ̆p păng đei lơ bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem when they had fulfilled their ministry, and they also took with them John whose surname was Mark.
Bahnar: Gah bre 'Barna'ba păng Sôl dơ̆ng, bre sư ăn jên kơ kră pơgơ̆r lu bơngai lui boih, na bre sư đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem brŏk tơ Pơlei Antiôs. Bre sư kư̆m anhăk ba minh 'nu bơngai măt sư 'bar anăn, Yôhan Markôs.

English: Now in the church that was at Antioch there were certain prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon who was called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch, and Saul.
Bahnar: Lăm lu bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Antiôs đei lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei păng lu bơngai bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Anăn lu sư: 'Barna'ba, Simiôn mă đe kư̆m anăn Niger, Lusiu đơ̆ng Pơlei Siren, Sôl păng Manahen. Manahen đe rong sư hơdai 'bok kuan tih Hêrôt hơtai sư oei iĕ sơ̆.

English: As they ministered to the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, “Now separate to Me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
Bahnar: Minh năr ei, lu sư ơ̆t kơ por, yua kơ sư wă krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm ăn kơ Inh bre 'Barna'ba păng Sôl wă kơ bre sư gơh jang kiơ̆ kơ Inh ăn kơ bre sư.”

English: Then, having fasted and prayed, and laid hands on them, they sent them away.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei ơ̆t kơ por wă krao khan. Đơ̆ng 'noh lu sư pel kơ̆l bre sư, wơh hloi bre sư năm bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bre 'Barna'ba păng Pôl năm bơtho tơ bŏl Chiprơ

English: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia, and from there they sailed to Cyprus.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng wơh bre sư năm na bre sư năm hloi tơ Pơlei Sêlusi. Đơ̆ng noh na bre sư tŏk thŏng-nan năm tơ bŏl đak đe anăn Chiprơ.

English: And when they arrived in Salamis, they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. They also had John as their assistant.
Bahnar: Bre sư truh tơ Pơlei Salêmin dêh Chiprơ ei boih, bre sư bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ lu hnam akŭm đe Juđê. Yôhan mă đe kư̆m anăn Markôs sư kư̆m năm hơdai păng bre sư wă tơgŭm bre sư mơ̆n.

English: Now when they had gone through the island to Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew whose name was Bar-Jesus
Bahnar: Lu sư năm jơ̆p kơ bŏl đak Chiprơ ei, truh tơ Pơlei Papôih. Tơ pơlei ei lu sư tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai pơjâu Juđê. Sư khan 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư pơma khan lê̆ hơdrol mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn kơ sư ôh. Anăn bơngai pơjâu ei 'Barjasu.

English: who was with the proconsul, Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. This man called for Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m pơm buăl păng 'bok kuan tih dêh Chiprơ. 'Bok kuan tih ei, anăn sư Sêjus Pôlus, sư bơngai hơgei. Sư krao 'Barna'ba păng Sôl năm bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ sư.

English: But Elymas the sorcerer (for so his name is translated) withstood them, seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai pơjâu ei, Êlimas, Êlimas anăn sư lăm nơ̆r Grĕk, sư tang găn bre Sôl păng 'Barna'ba wă kơ 'bok kuan tih ưh kơ lui kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then Saul, who also is called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked intently at him
Bahnar: Đe kư̆m anăn Sôl, noh Pôl. Na Pôl 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng. Pôl lăng bơngai pơjâu ei pơnhên khan hloi: “E bơngai plơ̆ plĕch hơlĕnh kơ đe ling-lang. E kon yang Satan, tang găn tơdrong 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang. Inh wă bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt mă-lei e khan inh hơlĕnh. Ưh kơ trŏ inh hơlĕnh ôh, e hơlĕnh kơ tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: and said, “O full of all deceit and all fraud, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, will you not cease perverting the straight ways of the Lord?
Bahnar: Đe kư̆m anăn Sôl, noh Pôl. Na Pôl 'bĕnh kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng. Pôl lăng bơngai pơjâu ei pơnhên khan hloi: “E bơngai plơ̆ plĕch hơlĕnh kơ đe ling-lang. E kon yang Satan, tang găn tơdrong 'lơ̆ng Kră Yang. Inh wă bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt mă-lei e khan inh hơlĕnh. Ưh kơ trŏ inh hơlĕnh ôh, e hơlĕnh kơ tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And now, indeed, the hand of the Lord is upon you, and you shall be blind, not seeing the sun for a time.” And immediately a dark mist fell on him, and he went around seeking someone to lead him by the hand.
Bahnar: Na dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei gô phak e. E gô tol măt minh yuh, ưh kơ 'bôh hơdah.” Na bơngai pơjâu ei tol măt hloi. Sư hơwơi chă hơbơ̆ đe wă kơ đe tơgŭm dui ba sư.

English: Then the proconsul believed, when he saw what had been done, being astonished at the teaching of the Lord.
Bahnar: 'Bok kuan tih wei dêh char ei, sư 'bôh tơdrong hlĭch thoi noh na sư lui hloi kơ Kră Yang Yêsu. Sư mơ̆ng hlĭch tơpă tơdrong lu bơngai bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now when Paul and his party set sail from Paphos, they came to Perga in Pamphylia; and John, departing from them, returned to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Pơlei Papôih Pôl păng lu buăl sư tŏk thŏng-nan năm tơ Pơlei Perga lăm dêh Pamphili. Mă-lei Markôs achăng lê̆ bre buăl sư brŏk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem dơ̆ng.

English: But when they departed from Perga, they came to Antioch in Pisidia, and went into the synagogue on the Sabbath day and sat down.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Pơlei Perga bre sư năm tơ Pơlei Antiôs lăm dêh char Pisidi. Năr pơdơh bre sư năm mơ̆t tơ hnam akŭm đe Juđê na lu sư akŭm lăm ei.

English: And after the reading of the Law and the Prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying, “Men and brethren, if you have any word of exhortation for the people, say on.”
Bahnar: Đang kơ đe đŏk hla bơar tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă păng tơdrong bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei boih, na lu kră wei-lăng lăm hnam akŭm lu đe Juđê khan kơ bre sư: “Ơ bre 'nhŏng oh, tơdah biĕm đei tơdrong wă bơtho kơ kon pơlei pơla, bơtho bĕ.”

English: Then Paul stood up, and motioning with his hand said, “Men of Israel, and you who fear God, listen
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Pôl iung yơ̆r ti păng khan: “Ơ lu bơngai Isơrael păng lu bơngai tơmoi năm kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, apinh iĕm mơ̆ng inh bĕ.

English: The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm He brought them out of it.
Bahnar: Inh roi gah tơdrong lu bơngai Isơrael. Lu bơngai Isơrael kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih lu 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆. Na hơtai lu sư oei tơ dêh Êyiptơ thoi lĕ kơ tơmoi đĕch, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư rai đunh rai lơ tơpă. Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm hăm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư kơdih na Sư tơlĕch lu sư đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ.

English: Now for a time of about forty years He put up with their ways in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Kơplah puăn-jĭt sơnăm lu bơngai Isơrael pơm lơ tơdrong ưh kơ chu kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ char glă. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat kơ lu sư tơpă.

English: And when He had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, He distributed their land to them by allotment.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng hơdrol sơ̆ lu bơngai Isơrael oei chang gô Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ lu sư teh đak Kanaan ei dang oei pă puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm 'mơ̆i na truh. Na truh boih puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlôch pơrăm tơpơh khŭl bơngai ei na teh đak lu đe ei 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư đei lu kră sek tơlang kơdih sư truh tơ 'bok Samuel, bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.

English: “After that He gave them judges for about four hundred and fifty years, until Samuel the prophet.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng hơdrol sơ̆ lu bơngai Isơrael oei chang gô Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ lu sư teh đak Kanaan ei dang oei pă puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm 'mơ̆i na truh. Na truh boih puăn-hrĕng pơđăm-jĭt sơnăm, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlôch pơrăm tơpơh khŭl bơngai ei na teh đak lu đe ei 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư đei lu kră sek tơlang kơdih sư truh tơ 'bok Samuel, bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.

English: And afterward they asked for a king; so God gave them Saul the son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin, for forty years.
Bahnar: “Đơ̆ng noh lu bơngai Isơrael apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư đei minh 'nu bơngai wă pơm pơtao lu sư. Na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư 'bok Sôl pơm pơtao lu sư. Sôl ei sư kon 'bok Kis, sư bơngai đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung 'bok Bênjamin. Sư pơgơ̆r puăn-jĭt sơnăm.

English: And when He had removed him, He raised up for them David as king, to whom also He gave testimony and said, ‘I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after My own heart, who will do all My will.’
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơlĕch 'bok pơtao Sôl, tơplih Đawit dơ̆ng pơm pơtao lu sư. Na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ kơ Đawit thoi âu: ‘Inh lăp đon păng Đawit kon 'bok Jesê, sư gô pơm kiơ̆ kơ Inh wă ling-lang.’

English: From this man’s seed, according to the promise, God raised up for Israel a Savior—Jesus
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Yêsu Kon Sâu Đawit wă dŏng pơklaih lu bơngai Isơrael, kiơ̆ kơ Sư pơkă sơ̆.

English: after John had first preached, before His coming, the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
Bahnar: Hơdrol kơ Yêsu wă truh Yôhan bơtho kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael athei sư tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch na pơm 'batem hloi.

English: And as John was finishing his course, he said, ‘Who do you think I am? I am not He. But behold, there comes One after me, the sandals of whose feet I am not worthy to loose.’
Bahnar: Lăp Yôhan pơm wă jê̆ keh tôm tơdrong jang sư boih, na sư khan: ‘Iĕm ngêh kơ inh bu? Ưh kơ sĭ iĕm chang gô inh ôh, iĕm chang gô Bơngai wă truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh kơnh. Sư 'Bok tih tơpă. Dah Sư athei inh yaih ăn tơlei chơkhŏ Sư, inh kư̆m ưh kơ hơnhŏ mơ̆n, mă ưh kơ pơ̆n ngơk lăng Sư ôh.’

English: “Men and brethren, sons of the family of Abraham, and those among you who fear God, to you the word of this salvation has been sent.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh adrĕch adrung kon sâu Abraham păng lu bơngai tơmoi năm kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n dang ei tơdrong dŏng pơklaih.

English: For those who dwell in Jerusalem, and their rulers, because they did not know Him, nor even the voices of the Prophets which are read every Sabbath, have fulfilled them in condemning Him.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pơlei Jêrusalem păng lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Juđê, lu sư ưh kơ kơnăl kơ Yêsu 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih ôh. Rim năr pơdơh Sa'bat lu sư kơtơ̆ng đe đŏk sơ̆p hla bơar lu bơngai khan lê̆ hơdrol gah Yêsu sơ̆. Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ hlôh ôh. Lu sư pơma jâu wă pơlôch Yêsu đĕch, na 'blep thoi lu bơngai khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ tơpă.

English: And though they found no cause for death in Him, they asked Pilate that He should be put to death.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bơngai bu 'bôh tơdrong Yêsu pơm kơnê̆ ôh. Lu sư kư̆ kơ jâu đĕch. Lu sư apinh Pilat pơlôch Sư tăm.

English: Now when they had fulfilled all that was written concerning Him, they took Him down from the tree and laid Him in a tomb.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm kơ Yêsu dôm tơdrong pơkă lê̆ hơdrol lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đang boih na đe tơjur akâu Sư đơ̆ng 'long pơglang na 'măn akâu Sư tơ bơsat.

English: But God raised Him from the dead.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Sư đơ̆ng lôch.

English: He was seen for many days by those who came up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are His witnesses to the people.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu tơ'bôh akâu Sư tơ lu buăl Sư đunh năr mơ̆n. Lu buăl Sư ei năm hơdai juăt păng Yêsu ling-lang hơdrol kơ Sư tam mă lôch sơ̆, đơ̆ng dêh char Galilê truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Na dang ei lu buăl Sư ei bơtho tơdrong Yêsu kơ lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: And we declare to you glad tidings—that promise which was made to the fathers.
Bahnar: Nhi năm tơ âu wă bơtho ăn kơ iĕm Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng. Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ lu kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆ khan wă ăn Kon Sư pơgơ̆r bơ̆n, dang ei Sư ăn kơ lu bơ̆n kon sâu lu sư 'bôh tơdrong noh boih. Truh boih tơdrong noh yua kơ Sư tơiung arih Yêsu đơ̆ng lôch. 'Noh thoi đe chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Tơdrong Hơriso, Tơdrong Hơri mă 'bar: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: ‘Ih boih Kon Inh, đơ̆ng năr âu Inh wă ăn kơ Ih pơgơ̆r.’

English: God has fulfilled this for us their children, in that He has raised up Jesus. As it is also written in the second Psalm: ‘You are My Son, Today I have begotten You.’
Bahnar: Nhi năm tơ âu wă bơtho ăn kơ iĕm Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng. Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ lu kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆ khan wă ăn Kon Sư pơgơ̆r bơ̆n, dang ei Sư ăn kơ lu bơ̆n kon sâu lu sư 'bôh tơdrong noh boih. Truh boih tơdrong noh yua kơ Sư tơiung arih Yêsu đơ̆ng lôch. 'Noh thoi đe chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Tơdrong Hơriso, Tơdrong Hơri mă 'bar: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: ‘Ih boih Kon Inh, đơ̆ng năr âu Inh wă ăn kơ Ih pơgơ̆r.’

English: And that He raised Him from the dead, no more to return to corruption, He has spoken thus: ‘I will give you the sure mercies of David.’
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi âu gah tơdrong Sư tơiung Kon Sư đơ̆ng lôch pă đei lôch dơ̆ng: ‘Inh gô ăn kơ Ih tơdrong 'lơ̆ng; thoi Inh pơkă kơ Đawit sơ̆, Inh gô ăn tơpă.’

English: Therefore He also says in another Psalm: ‘You will not allow Your Holy One to see corruption.’
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei chih tơ âu tơ nai dơ̆ng: ‘Ih ưh kơ ăn akâu Inh mă Kon 'lơ̆ng Ih jing ôm ôh.’

English: “For David, after he had served his own generation by the will of God, fell asleep, was buried with his fathers, and saw corruption
Bahnar: Gah Đawit, lăp sư oei arih sư pơm kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă. Na sư lôch, đe 'bŭ akâu sư hơdai păng lu 'bok sư, akâu sư jing ôm.

English: but He whom God raised up saw no corruption.
Bahnar: Mă-lei akâu Yêsu ưh kơ jing ôm ôh yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Sư đơ̆ng lôch.

English: Therefore let it be known to you, brethren, that through this Man is preached to you the forgiveness of sins
Bahnar: Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, inh wă kơ iĕm băt tơpă tơdrong âu: Yua kơ Yêsu na iĕm gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: and by Him everyone who believes is justified from all things from which you could not be justified by the law of Moses.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Môis đĕch, bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Mă-lei dah bơ̆n lui kơ Yêsu, bơ̆n gơh klaih đĭ đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch bơ̆n.

English: Beware therefore, lest what has been spoken in the prophets come upon you
Bahnar: Na iĕm kơchăng bĕ, hli kơ nơ̆r bơngai khan lê̆ hơdrol gô 'blep kơ iĕm tơpă. Sư khan thoi âu sơ̆

English: ‘Behold, you despisers, Marvel and perish! For I work a work in your days, A work which you will by no means believe, Though one were to declare it to you.’ ”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: ‘Ơ lu iĕm bơngai che bơle kơ Inh, iĕm lăng, iĕm gô sơleng kơ đon, pă tam băt kơnh iĕm lôch. Inh pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang lăm chăl iĕm arih, đe gô roi kơ iĕm tơdrong noh, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă lui.’ ”

English: So when the Jews went out of the synagogue, the Gentiles begged that these words might be preached to them the next Sabbath.
Bahnar: Lăp bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba lĕch đơ̆ng hnam akŭm đe Juđê ei, đe apinh bre sư năm năr pơdơh đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng wă bơtho tơdrong noh dơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: Now when the congregation had broken up, many of the Jews and devout proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas, who, speaking to them, persuaded them to continue in the grace of God.
Bahnar: Lăp lu kon pơlei pơla brŏk đơ̆ng hnam akŭm tơ hnam sư kơdih kơdih, kư̆m đei lơ bơngai Juđê păng lơ bơngai mă ưh kơ khŭl Juđê kư̆m pơlei noh mơ̆n mă lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl, lu sư yak hơdai bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba. Na bre sư bơtho rah rok trong. Hơtai sư oei yak hơdai sư bơtho thoi âu: “'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat kơ bơ̆n tơpă na bĕ bơ̆n kư̆ lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu mă kơjăp đĕch.”

English: On the next Sabbath almost the whole city came together to hear the word of God.
Bahnar: Năr pơdơh đơ̆ng rŏng đĭ-đăng pơlei năm akŭm tơ hnam akŭm đe Juđê dơ̆ng wă mơ̆ng bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with envy; and contradicting and blaspheming, they opposed the things spoken by Paul.
Bahnar: Lăp đe Juđê 'bôh lơ bơngai năm akŭm tơpă, lu sư 'nhĕng. Lu sư pơjăm Pôl păng che bơle kơ sư, jâu sư khan bơngai kơnê̆.

English: Then Paul and Barnabas grew bold and said, “It was necessary that the word of God should be spoken to you first; but since you reject it, and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba pơma tơwih kơ lu sư kư̆m nuih tơpă mơ̆n. Bre sư khan thoi âu: “Nhi bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ lu iĕm bơngai Juđê hơdrol 'mơ̆i ră mă trŏ. Mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Iĕm ưh kơ chu thoi noh iĕm ưh kơ đei arih păng Sư ling-lang ôh ning-mônh, lei nhi lê̆ kơ bơtho iĕm đĕch. Nhi bơtho pôm lu bơngai nai.

English: For so the Lord has commanded us: ‘I have set you as a light to the Gentiles, That you should be for salvation to the ends of the earth.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang pơkă kơ nhôn sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Inh rơih ih pơm ŭnh pơchrang hơdah kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai, wă kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.’ ”

English: Now when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad and glorified the word of the Lord. And as many as had been appointed to eternal life believed.
Bahnar: Pôl pơma thoi noh boih, na lu bơngai lăm noh mơ̆n mă ưh kơ bơngai Juđê, lu sư kơtơ̆ng thoi noh jơhngơ̆m lu sư chơt hiôk tơpă. Lu sư khan: “Nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei hiôk 'lơ̆ng tơpă iih?” Na lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih wă kơ sư arih ling-lang, lu sư lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: And the word of the Lord was being spread throughout all the region.
Bahnar: Lu sư bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang jơ̆p kơ tơring Antiôs ei.

English: Now it happened in Iconium that they went together to the synagogue of the Jews, and so spoke that a great multitude both of the Jews and of the Greeks believed.
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Ikôni bre sư kư̆m mơ̆t tơ hnam akŭm đe Juđê bơtho đe mơ̆n. Bre sư bơtho hơgei tơpă na lơ bơngai Juđê păng lơ bơngai nai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brethren.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê mơ'nah ưh kơ wă lui kơ Yêsu. Sư pơhlŭ lu bơngai nai mă ưh kơ khŭl sư wă kơ sư areh kơ lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu.

English: Therefore they stayed there a long time, speaking boldly in the Lord, who was bearing witness to the word of His grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
Bahnar: Bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba oei tơ pơlei ei kư̆m đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n. Kră Yang tơgŭm bre sư bơtho kư̆m nuih tơpă. Kră Yang ăn kơ bre sư pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang wă kơ đe băt kơ bre sư bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă, wă pơklaih kon bơngai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.

English: But the multitude of the city was divided: part sided with the Jews, and part with the apostles.
Bahnar: Lăm kon pơlei pơla lu mơ'nah oei kiơ̆ gah đe Juđê, mơ'nah oei kiơ̆ gah jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu Krist.

English: And when a violent attempt was made by both the Gentiles and Jews, with their rulers, to abuse and stone them
Bahnar: Na bơngai Juđê păng bơngai nai, lu mơ'nah pôm đon păng lu yŏng sư, lu mơ'nah ưh mơ̆n. Lu bơngai pôm đon păng yŏng sư ei, sư wă klơ̆m bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba păng tơmo.

English: they became aware of it and fled to Lystra and Derbe, cities of Lycaonia, and to the surrounding region.
Bahnar: Lăp bre sư kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, bre sư kơdâu jăk tơ dêh char Likanê. Tơ ei bre sư chă bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng tơ Pơlei Litrơ, Pơlei Dibơ păng lu pơlei tơring kiơ̆ ei mơ̆n.

English: And they were preaching the gospel there.
Bahnar: Lăp bre sư kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, bre sư kơdâu jăk tơ dêh char Likanê. Tơ ei bre sư chă bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng tơ Pơlei Litrơ, Pơlei Dibơ păng lu pơlei tơring kiơ̆ ei mơ̆n.

English: And in Lystra a certain man without strength in his feet was sitting, a cripple from his mother’s womb, who had never walked.
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Litrơ đei minh 'nu bơngai jơ̆ng jo, đơ̆ng đe tơpŭ kơ sư sơ̆ ưh kơ gơh yak.

English: This man heard Paul speaking. Paul, observing him intently and seeing that he had faith to be healed
Bahnar: Bơngai jo ei mơ̆ng Pôl bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng, Pôl lăng muh măt sư, băt kơ sư wă lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na gơh klaih kơ jĭ.

English: said with a loud voice, “Stand up straight on your feet!” And he leaped and walked.
Bahnar: Na Pôl pơma re khan kơ sư: “Ih iung bĕ, dơ̆ng mă tơpăt.” Na bơngai jo ei iung yak hloi.

English: Now when the people saw what Paul had done, they raised their voices, saying in the Lycaonian language, “The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!”
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla 'bôh Pôl pơm thoi noh na lu sư pơma 'bơ̆r re lăm nơ̆r Likanê sư thoi âu: “Âu nhen yang jur jing bơngai.”

English: And Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul, Hermes, because he was the chief speaker.
Bahnar: Lu sư ngêh kơ 'Barna'ba yang Jupitê. Na lu sư ngêh kơ Pôl yang Merkuwơ, yua kơ Pôl ling-lang pơma kơ bre sư, thoi đe jô̆ yang Merkuwơ hơgei pơma.

English: Then the priest of Zeus, whose temple was in front of their city, brought oxen and garlands to the gates, intending to sacrifice with the multitudes.
Bahnar: Bơngai pơm yang kơ yang Jupitê đei hnam yang tơ jih pơlei. Sư anhăk ba rơmo păng pơkao, sư 'măn 'bơ̆t 'măng dur pơlei. Sư hơdai păng kon pơlei pơla wă soi sơmah kơ bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba.

English: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard this, they tore their clothes and ran in among the multitude, crying out
Bahnar: Lăp bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba kơtơ̆ng lu sư wă soi sơmah kơ bre sư, na bre sư hek ao sư kơdih kơlih kơ bre sư lăng tơdrong 'noh glăi tơpă. Na bre sư kơdâu hloi tơkan 'bơ̆t anê̆ đe tơpôl lơ, bre sư khan thoi âu

English: and saying, “Men, why are you doing these things? We also are men with the same nature as you, and preach to you that you should turn from these useless things to the living God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and all things that are in them
Bahnar: “Ơ bre, iĕm wă pơm kiơ? Nhi kư̆m kon bơngai lei-lăi thoi iĕm mơ̆n. Nhi wă bơtho kơ iĕm Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng, wă kơ iĕm tŭk lê̆ dôm lu yang iĕm pơm kơkuh noh mă ưh kơ yua kiơ, na iĕm lui kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch. 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang. Sư pơjing plĕnh teh, đak dơsĭ păng đĭ-đăng sem tơmam oei lăm ala teh đak.

English: who in bygone generations allowed all nations to walk in their own ways.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai pơm kiơ̆ kơ lu sư wă.

English: Nevertheless He did not leave Himself without witness, in that He did good, gave us rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling our hearts with food and gladness.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm dôm tơdrong Sư mơnat wă kơ iĕm băt kơ Sư oei arih. Sư ăn kơ iĕm đak 'mi đơ̆ng plĕnh, trŏ kơ bơyan đei 'ba lơ, đei tơmam sŏng sa mah rơkah rơkai. Păng Sư ăn kơ iĕm đei jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk.”

English: And with these sayings they could scarcely restrain the multitudes from sacrificing to them.
Bahnar: Bre Pôl pơma thoi noh na lu sư tŭk lê̆ dôm tơdrong lu sư wă soi sơmah kơ bre Pôl noh. Mă-lei lu sư kư̆m oei wă soi sơmah ră mơ̆n. Yua kơ bre Pôl khan kơ lu sư, na lu sư lê̆ dơ̆ng.

English: Then Jews from Antioch and Iconium came there; and having persuaded the multitudes, they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, supposing him to be dead.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh lu bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng Pơlei Antiôs păng Pơlei Ikôni năm tơ ei păng pơhlŭ lu kon pơlei pơla. Lu sư klơ̆m Pôl păng tơmo. Lu sư ngêh kơ Pôl lôch boih na lu sư dui hor Pôl tơ jih pơlei.

English: However, when the disciples gathered around him, he rose up and went into the city. And the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng noh lu bơngai lui năm truh tơ ei oei lăng tăp dăr kơ Pôl. Pôl sư iung hloi năm mơ̆t tơ pơlei dơ̆ng. Năr dơning bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba năm tơ Pơlei Dibơ.

English: And when they had preached the gospel to that city and made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch
Bahnar: Bre sư bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng tơ Pơlei Dibơ ei, đei lơ bơngai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu. Đơ̆ng noh na bre sư brŏk tơ Pơlei Litrơ, Pơlei Ikôni păng Pơlei Antiôs.

English: strengthening the souls of the disciples, exhorting them to continue in the faith, and saying, “We must through many tribulations enter the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Tơ rim pơlei ei bre sư bơtho khan kơ lu bơngai lui, wă kơ lu sư lui mă kơjăp. Bre sư khan bơ̆n athei đei lơ tơdrong pơmat-tat adrol 'mơ̆i na gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: So when they had appointed elders in every church, and prayed with fasting, they commended them to the Lord in whom they had believed.
Bahnar: Tơ rim pơlei bre sư kư̆m rơih ăn kơ lu sư wă kơ đei lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui. Na bre sư ơ̆t kơ por krao khan, na bre sư krao khan apinh Kră Yang tơgŭm đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kră ei yua kơ lu sư lui kơ Kră Yang.

English: And after they had passed through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh bre sư năm yak brih apŭng Pisidi truh tơ apŭng Pamphili.

English: Now when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.
Bahnar: Bre sư bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng tơ Pơlei Perga. Đơ̆ng noh bre sư năm tơ Pơlei Atali.

English: From there they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work which they had completed.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Pơlei Atali bre sư tŏk thŏng-nan năm tơ Pơlei Antiôs lăm dêh char Siri. Tơ pơlei ei sơ̆ đe krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm bre sư năm bơtho tơdrong Sư. Bre sư năm bơtho đang boih na brŏk tơ pơlei ei dơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: Now when they had come and gathered the church together, they reported all that God had done with them, and that He had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Lăp truh tơ pơlei ei boih, bre sư krao akŭm bơngai lui. Bre sư roi đĭ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm bre sư păng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl Juđê lui kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And certain men came down from Judea and taught the brethren, “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved.”
Bahnar: Đei bơngai đơ̆ng dêh char Juđê năm tơ Pơlei Antiôs bơtho lu bơngai lui khan: “Bơngai bu ưh kơ chu kăt tơdra akar sư kơdih kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Môis pơkă sơ̆, lei ưh kơ gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.”

English: Therefore, when Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and dispute with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas and certain others of them should go up to Jerusalem, to the apostles and elders, about this question.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ lu sư bơtho thoi noh, na bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba pơjah pơjăng tơpă păng lu sư. Na lu bơngai lui wă kơ bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba păng 'bar pêng 'nu dơ̆ng đơ̆ng Pơlei Antiôs năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem wă tơ'bơ̆p lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu păng lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui, pơđâu păng sư gah tơdrong kăt akar noh.

English: So, being sent on their way by the church, they passed through Phoenicia and Samaria, describing the conversion of the Gentiles; and they caused great joy to all the brethren.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui tơgŭm lu sư wă kơ gơh năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Na lu sư năm drong tơ dêh char Phênisi păng dêh char Samari roi kơ bơngai lui tơdrong lu bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ khŭl Juđê lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu boih. Lăp lu bơngai lui kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, jơhngơ̆m lu sư chơt hiôk tơpă.

English: And when they had come to Jerusalem, they were received by the church and the apostles and the elders; and they reported all things that God had done with them.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu păng lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lui chơt hiôk tơpă yua kơ 'bôh lu sư. Lu sư ră roi đĭ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu sư pơm.

English: But some of the sect of the Pharisees who believed rose up, saying, “It is necessary to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei kư̆m đei bơngai lui kơ Yêsu đơ̆ng khŭl đe Pharisi iung pơma thoi âu: “Lu bơngai tơmoi lui kơ Yêsu ei, lu sư athei chu kăt tơdra akar kơdih păng kiơ̆ dôm lu tơdrong juăt Môis pơkă.”

English: Now the apostles and elders came together to consider this matter.
Bahnar: Lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu păng lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui akŭm wă pơđâu gah tơdrong noh.

English: And when there had been much dispute, Peter rose up and said to them: “Men and brethren, you know that a good while ago God chose among us, that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the word of the gospel and believe.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơđâu kư̆m đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n. Klaih kơ noh Pêtrôs iung pơma thoi âu: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, iĕm kư̆m băt tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih inh đơ̆ng lu iĕm sơ̆, wă kơ inh năm bơtho lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl bơ̆n wă kơ sư gơh kơtơ̆ng Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng na lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: So God, who knows the heart, acknowledged them by giving them the Holy Spirit, just as He did to us
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei băt jơhngơ̆m đon kon bơngai na Sư ăn kơ lu bơngai tơmoi ei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng kư̆m thoi Sư ăn kơ bơ̆n. Thoi noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n băt Sư wă kơ lu bơngai tơmoi ei mơ̆n.

English: and made no distinction between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat kơ bơ̆n păng lu bơngai tơmoi lei-lăi đĕch. Sư pơklaih tơdrong yoch lu sư yua kơ lu sư lui kơ Yêsu.

English: Now therefore, why do you test God by putting a yoke on the neck of the disciples which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ kiơ iĕm wă pơlong 'Bok Kei-Dei? Iĕm wă kơ lu bơngai tơmoi mă lui ei pŭ tơdrong anat kơ răk dôm lu tơdrong Môis pơkă. Mă-lei tơdrong 'noh lu 'bok kơdră bơ̆n pŭ ưh kơ kĕ ôh păng bơ̆n kư̆m ưh kơ kĕ mơ̆n.

English: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved in the same manner as they.”
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt bơ̆n klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch yua kơ Kră Yang Yêsu 'mêm mơnat đĕch păng lu bơngai tơmoi kư̆m lei-lăi mơ̆n.”

English: Then all the multitude kept silent and listened to Barnabas and Paul declaring how many miracles and wonders God had worked through them among the Gentiles.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư kơtơ̆ng Pêtrôs pơma thoi noh, lu sư pă đei drơ̆ng tơwih dơ̆ng. Pôm bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba đĕch roi gah tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm bre sư pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh mơyang 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl Juđê.

English: And after they had become silent, James answered, saying, “Men and brethren, listen to me
Bahnar: Lăp bre sư pơma đang boih, Yakơ iung pơma thoi âu dơ̆ng: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, apinh iĕm mơ̆ng inh bĕ.

English: Simon has declared how God at the first visited the Gentiles to take out of them a people for His name.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs roi tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ lu bơngai tơmoi hơdrol sơ̆ wă rơih lu bơngai tơmoi na lu bơngai tơmoi lu mơ'nah lui kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.

English: And with this the words of the prophets agree, just as it is written
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'blep kơ bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ chih tơ sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu

English: ‘After this I will return And will rebuild the tabernacle of David, which has fallen down; I will rebuild its ruins, And I will set it up
Bahnar: ‘Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh dơ̆ng Inh gô ăn kơ adrĕch adrung Đawit pơgơ̆r dơ̆ng. Dang ei thoi lĕ kơ hnam sư oei hiah, Inh wă pơm ming dơ̆ng

English: So that the rest of mankind may seek the LORD, Even all the Gentiles who are called by My name, Says the LORD who does all these things.’
Bahnar: wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak lui kơ Inh, wă khan đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl lu Juđê, Inh wă kơ lu sư mơ̆n.

English: “Known to God from eternity are all His works.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi noh, Sư pơm 'blep tơdrong noh mơ̆n. Sư tơbăt kơ đe tơdrong noh đơ̆ng blŭng-a sơ̆.’

English: Therefore I judge that we should not trouble those from among the Gentiles who are turning to God
Bahnar: Na inh tơchĕng thoi âu: Bơ̆n 'nĕ pơgŏ lu bơngai tơmoi mă lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hŏ.

English: but that we write to them to abstain from things polluted by idols, from sexual immorality, from things strangled, and from blood.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơ̆n chih kơ sư kơthơ athei sư 'nĕ kơ sa tơmam đe sơmah kơ yang kơnê̆ yua kơ bơ̆n rơgoh boih. Bơ̆n 'nĕ ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă. 'Nĕ kơ sa pham dôm sem bơ̆n rong păng sem bri. Hơdrol kơ wă pơm tơmam sa bơ̆n athei kăt dah 'bet tŭk lê̆ pham sư.

English: For Moses has had throughout many generations those who preach him in every city, being read in the synagogues every Sabbath.”
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong juăt Môis pơkă, lu bơngai Juđê bơtho tơdrong noh tơ rim pơlei mă đơ̆ng sơ̆. Lu sư đŏk sơ̆p hla bơar Môis tơ hnam akŭm rim kơ năr pơdơh.”

English: Then it pleased the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas, namely, Judas who was also named Barsabas, and Silas, leading men among the brethren.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu, lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui păng đĭ-đăng bơngai lui mơ̆n, lu sư wă rơih lu bơngai năm tơ Pơlei Antiôs hơdai bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba. Lu sư rơih minh 'nu bơngai đei 'bar anăn, Juđa 'Barsa'ba păng minh 'nu dơ̆ng, Silas. Bre sư ei lu bơngai lui lăp đon 'biơ̆ lăm lu bơngai lui.

English: They wrote this letter by them: The apostles, the elders, and the brethren, To the brethren who are of the Gentiles in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia: Greetings.
Bahnar: Lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu hăm lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui ăn kơ lu sư chĕp hla kơthơ. Hla kơthơ ei chih thoi âu: “Nhôn lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu păng lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui, bơ̆n 'nhŏng oh. Nhôn hmach bơnê kơ đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm lăm kon tơmoi lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu iĕm mă oei tơ Pơlei Antiôs, dêh char Siri păng dêh char Salisia.

English: Since we have heard that some who went out from us have troubled you with words, unsettling your souls, saying, “You must be circumcised and keep the law” —to whom we gave no such commandment
Bahnar: Nhôn kơtơ̆ng ang lu bơngai đơ̆ng nhôn năm bơtho iĕm khan athei iĕm kăt tơdra akar păng răk dôm lu tơdrong juăt Môis pơkă. Đơ̆ng sơ̆ nhôn ưh kơ athei iĕm pơm thoi noh ôh, na dang ei iĕm hơwơ̆l boih. Lu bơngai athei iĕm răk dôm tơdrong juăt Môis pơkă noh, lu sư năm bơtho kơdih đĕch. Nhôn ưh kơ wơh sư ôh.

English: it seemed good to us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul
Bahnar: Na nhôn akŭm pơđâu na rơih 'bar 'nu bơngai nhôn wơh năm tơ iĕm. Bre sư năm hloi hơdai 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba. Bre sư bơ̆n 'mêm tơpă.

English: men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba adrin tơpă bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu Krist, ưh kơ hli kơ lôch ôh.

English: We have therefore sent Judas and Silas, who will also report the same things by word of mouth.
Bahnar: Na nhôn wơh ăn kơ iĕm Juđa păng Silas. Bre sư gô khan kơ iĕm tơdrong bơtho âu mơ̆n.

English: For it seemed good to the Holy Spirit, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng păng nhôn ưh kơ wă athei iĕm pơm lu tơdrong anat, mă-lei iĕm athei kiơ̆ lu tơdrong âu đĕch
