English: that you abstain from things offered to idols, from blood, from things strangled, and from sexual immorality. If you keep yourselves from these, you will do well. Farewell.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ kơ sa tơmam đe sơmah kơ yang kơnê̆ yua kơ bơ̆n rơgoh boih. 'Nĕ kơ sa pham dôm sem bơ̆n rong dah sem bri. Hơdrol kơ wă pơm tơmam sa bơ̆n athei kăt dah 'bet tŭk lê̆ pham sư 'noh; păng 'nĕ ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă. Yah iĕm pơm kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r pơkă lăm kơthơ âu lei trŏ tơpă. Oei kơ iĕm mă 'lơ̆ng.”

English: So when they were sent off, they came to Antioch; and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the letter.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai năm ăn kơthơ ei đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem truh tơ Pơlei Antiôs. Lăp lu sư truh boih, lu sư krao akŭm đĭ-đăng bơngai lui păng ăn kơ lu sư kơthơ ei hloi.

English: When they had read it, they rejoiced over its encouragement.
Bahnar: Na lu sư đŏk lăng kơthơ ei, jơhngơ̆m lu sư chơt hiôk tơpă yua kơ kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh.

English: Now Judas and Silas, themselves being prophets also, exhorted and strengthened the brethren with many words.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ bre Juđa păng Silas bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bre sư bơtho kư̆m đunh mơ̆n wă kơ lu sư chơt hiôk lăm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă kơ lu sư lui mă kơjăp.

English: And after they had stayed there for a time, they were sent back with greetings from the brethren to the apostles.
Bahnar: Bre sư oei tơ Pơlei Antiôs kư̆m đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n. Klaih kơ noh lu bơngai lui pơjao tơdrong bơnê kơ bre sư. Na bre sư brŏk tơ lu bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: However, it seemed good to Silas to remain there.
Bahnar: Bre sư oei tơ Pơlei Antiôs kư̆m đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n. Klaih kơ noh lu bơngai lui pơjao tơdrong bơnê kơ bre sư. Na bre sư brŏk tơ lu bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Paul and Barnabas also remained in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
Bahnar: Bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba oei tơ Pơlei Antiôs kư̆m đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n. Bre sư đei lu bơngai nai dơ̆ng hơdai chă bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ ei.

English: Then after some days Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us now go back and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord, and see how they are doing.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m đunh mơ̆n đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh dơ̆ng, Pôl khan kơ 'Barna'ba thoi âu: “Ơ 'Barna'ba, bĕ ba năm hơpong kơ 'nhŏng oh bơ̆n tơ rim pơlei đêl ba bơtho sơ̆ bĕ, đunh boih, ưh kơ băt sư lơliơ dang ei.”

English: Now Barnabas was determined to take with them John called Mark.
Bahnar: Na 'Barna'ba khan: “Lei ba anhăk ba Markôs.”

English: But Paul insisted that they should not take with them the one who had departed from them in Pamphylia, and had not gone with them to the work.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pôl tơchĕng khan: “Ưh kơ trŏ kơ anhăk ba sư, yua kơ sư achăng lê̆ ba tơ dêh char Pamphili sơ̆ jing pă đei kiơ̆ ba bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei nai.”

English: Then the contention became so sharp that they parted from one another. And so Barnabas took Mark and sailed to Cyprus
Bahnar: Na bre Pôl păng 'Barna'ba pơjah pơjăng tơdrong noh khŏm khŏm na truh tơ bre sư tơklah dih băl. Đơ̆ng noh na 'Barna'ba anhăk Markôs tŏk thŏng-nan năm tơ dêh char Chiprơ.

English: but Paul chose Silas and departed, being commended by the brethren to the grace of God.
Bahnar: Na Pôl anhăk Silas năm hơdai păng sư. Na lu bơngai lui krao khan apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng bre sư.

English: Then he came to Derbe and Lystra. And behold, a certain disciple was there, named Timothy, the son of a certain Jewish woman who believed, but his father was Greek.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh bre Pôl păng Silas năm tơ Pơlei Dibơ păng năm tơ Pơlei Litrơ. Tơ Pơlei Litrơ ei đei lơ bơngai lui păng đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Timôthê. Mĕ sư bơngai Juđê kư̆m lui mơ̆n, 'bă sư bơngai Grĕk.

English: He was well spoken of by the brethren who were at Lystra and Iconium.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Litrơ păng Pơlei Ikôni jô̆ Timôthê bơngai 'lơ̆ng.

English: Paul wanted to have him go on with him. And he took him and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in that region, for they all knew that his father was Greek.
Bahnar: Pôl wă kơ Timôthê năm hơdai păng sư bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na sư kăt tơdra akar Timôthê wă kơ lu bơngai Juđê oei tơ tơring ei huay kơ ơh klai, yua kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđê ei băt kơ 'bă sư bơngai Grĕk.

English: And as they went through the cities, they delivered to them the decrees to keep, which were determined by the apostles and elders at Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na đe Pôl năm jơ̆p pơlei. Sư ră roi tơdrong lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu păng lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem ată lăm kơthơ ei ki. Lu đe Pôl bơtho khan lu sư kiơ̆ lu tơdrong ată tơpăt.

English: So the churches were strengthened in the faith, and increased in number daily.
Bahnar: Na rim pơlei, lu bơngai lui rai đunh rai lơ rai kơjăp rai pran lui kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now when they had gone through Phrygia and the region of Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to preach the word in Asia.
Bahnar: Lu đe Pôl yak brih apŭng Phiji păng dêh char Galati yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ưh kơ ăn kơ lu sư bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ dêh char Asi.

English: After they had come to Mysia, they tried to go into Bithynia, but the Spirit did not permit them.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ jih apŭng Misi ei lu sư wă mơ̆t tơ dêh char Bithini, mă-lei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng đơ̆ng Kră Yang Yêsu ưh kơ ăn lu sư mơ̆t tơ ei ôh.

English: So passing by Mysia, they came down to Troas.
Bahnar: Na lu sư năm găn apŭng Misi truh tơ Pơlei Trôs.

English: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night. A man of Macedonia stood and pleaded with him, saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.”
Bahnar: Truh tơ Pơlei Trôs boih Pôl tep kơmăng sư apo 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng dêh char Masêđôn pơma kơ sư khan: “Apinh ih năm tơ dêh char Masêđôn tơgŭm lu nhôn 'biơ̆.”

English: Now after he had seen the vision, immediately we sought to go to Macedonia, concluding that the Lord had called us to preach the gospel to them.
Bahnar: Pôl apo 'bôh thoi noh, sư hơđơ̆r đơ̆ng tep khan hloi kơ nhôn hơmet tơmam yak năm tơ dêh char Masêđôn, yua kơ nhôn băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei krao nhôn bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng Sư tơ char Masêđôn boih.

English: Therefore, sailing from Troas, we ran a straight course to Samothrace, and the next day came to Neapolis
Bahnar: Na nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan đơ̆ng Pơlei Trôs năm tơpăt tơ bŏl đak đe anăn bŏl Samôtras. Năr dơning dơ̆ng nhôn năm truh tơ Pơlei Nêapôlis, lăm dêh char Masêđôn.

English: and from there to Philippi, which is the foremost city of that part of Macedonia, a colony. And we were staying in that city for some days.
Bahnar: Tơ ei nhôn jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan năm tơ Pơlei Philip. Pơlei Philip ei tih tơpă hloh kơ lu pơlei nai tơring ei. Tơ Pơlei Philip ei đei lơ bơngai Rôm oei. Nhôn oei tơ pơlei ei kư̆m đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n.

English: And on the Sabbath day we went out of the city to the riverside, where prayer was customarily made; and we sat down and spoke to the women who met there.
Bahnar: Truh năr pơdơh nhôn năm tơ jih pơlei ei, cheng đak krong. Tơ ei đei anih đe juăt kơ akŭm krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na nhôn bơtho lu bơngai drŏ-kăn năm akŭm tơ ei.

English: Now a certain woman named Lydia heard us. She was a seller of purple from the city of Thyatira, who worshiped God. The Lord opened her heart to heed the things spoken by Paul.
Bahnar: Lăm lu drŏ-kăn oei mơ̆ng nhôn ei đei minh 'nu anăn sư Liđa. Sư bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei Thiatir. Sư bơngai juăt kơ mơdro tĕch che jơk păng sư lui kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng sơ̆. Na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư lui kơ nơ̆r Pôl bơtho.

English: And when she and her household were baptized, she begged us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come to my house and stay.” So she persuaded us.
Bahnar: Na yă Liđa păng đĭ-đăng hnam dơnŏ sư iŏk 'batem. Sư khan kơ nhôn: “Yah iĕm băt tơchĕng inh lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu boih, inh apinh iĕm tŏk 'bĭch tơ hnam inh.” Sư pơtơm 'bĭch tơ hnam sư na nhôn tŏk 'bĭch pơdơh tơ hnam sư hloi.

English: Now it happened, as we went to prayer, that a certain slave girl possessed with a spirit of divination met us, who brought her masters much profit by fortune-telling.
Bahnar: Minh năr ei hơtai nhôn năm tơ anih akŭm krao khan nhôn tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai adruh sư đĭch đe. Sư bơngai yang mơ̆t pơm kơ sư wơnh. Na yang kơnê̆ ăn kơ sư pơm pơjâu khan lê̆ hơdrol. Lu yŏng đĭch ei yua jên đơ̆ng đĭch sư chă pơma khan kơ đe na đe ăn kơ bơngai adruh yang mơ̆t ei, na lu yŏng sư jing mơdrŏng.

English: This girl followed Paul and us, and cried out, saying, “These men are the servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to us the way of salvation.”
Bahnar: Adruh ei năm kiơ̆ nhôn đe Pôl, sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Lu bơngai âu jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang tih hloh. Lu sư bơtho ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.”

English: And this she did for many days. But Paul, greatly annoyed, turned and said to the spirit, “I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her.” And he came out that very hour.
Bahnar: Adruh ei kiơ̆ nhôn rim năr khŏm khŏm, truh tơ Pôl sư pă kĕ ĕnh boih. Na Pôl hue lăng adruh ei păng khan kơ yang kơnê̆: “Inh yua anăn Yêsu Krist, inh athei e lĕch đơ̆ng bơngai adruh âu.” Na yang kơnê̆ ei lĕch hloi.

English: But when her masters saw that their hope of profit was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace to the authorities.
Bahnar: Thoi noh yŏng sư 'bôh ưh pă yua đơ̆ng sư boih, na jên lu sư kư̆m ưh pă lơ boih, lu sư rôp hloi bre Pôl păng Silas, anhăk ba bre sư tơ kră pơlei tơ tŏk-bŏk kơchơ.

English: And they brought them to the magistrates, and said, “These men, being Jews, exceedingly trouble our city
Bahnar: Lu sư ăn kơ linh wei 'bơ̆t anăp lu kră pơlei na khan thoi âu: “Bơngai âu pơm rŭng răng kơnê̆ tơ pơlei bơ̆n. Bre sư bơngai Juđê.

English: and they teach customs which are not lawful for us, being Romans, to receive or observe.”
Bahnar: Bre sư bơtho tơdrong juăt ưh kơ trŏ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n. Bơ̆n bơngai Rôm ưh kơ gơh kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt sư noh ôh.”

English: Then the multitude rose up together against them; and the magistrates tore off their clothes and commanded them to be beaten with rods.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla kư̆m jâu bre sư mơ̆n. Thoi noh na lu kră pơgơ̆r hek tŭk ao bre sư, athei hloi lu linh teh bre sư.

English: And when they had laid many stripes on them, they threw them into prison, commanding the jailer to keep them securely.
Bahnar: Lu linh teh bre sư teh dêh tơpă, klaih kơ noh tah bre sư lăm hnam phak. Lu kră pơlei athei kră wei-lăng hnam phak gak mă kơchăng.

English: Having received such a charge, he put them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na kră wei-lăng hnam phak ei tah bre sư tơ lăm tŏk-bŏk hnam phak păng dơlŏng jơ̆ng bre sư mơ̆n.

English: But at midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them.
Bahnar: Dang mơjĭt-'bar jơ tŏk-bŏk măng bre Pôl păng Silas oei krao khan păng hơri bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Đĭ-đăng tơduă lu sư bơngai phak mơ̆ng bre sư ngăl.

English: Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened and everyone’s chains were loosed.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t ei teh pơpơ̆ hloi kơkiơ̆ng. Hơyuh teh ei pơpơ̆ truh tơ hnam ei mah kyĭng kiơ̆ng. 'Măng tơpơih đĭ, glang mam tơyaih đĭ đơ̆ng lu bơngai phak lăm ei.

English: And the keeper of the prison, awaking from sleep and seeing the prison doors open, supposing the prisoners had fled, drew his sword and was about to kill himself.
Bahnar: Na kră wei-lăng hnam phak ei iung đơ̆ng tep 'bôh 'măng tơpơih đĭ, na sư ngêh lu bơngai phak kơdâu jăk đĭ boih. Na sư toh anglop đao wă 'bet pơlôch kơdih akâu ră.

English: But Paul called with a loud voice, saying, “Do yourself no harm, for we are all here.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pôl pơma pơret khan kơ sư: “Ih 'nĕ pơrăm kơdih akâu, nhôn oei tôm lăm âu, ưh kơ đei bu hiong ôh.”

English: Then he called for a light, ran in, and fell down trembling before Paul and Silas.
Bahnar: Na kră wei-lăng hnam phak ei athei đe tơ̆k kơ sư ŭnh wă kơ hơdah, na sư tơluh năm tơ đe ei, sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng 'bơ̆t anăp bre Pôl păng Silas. Jơhngơ̆m 'bok wei-lăng ei hli tơrơ tơpă.

English: And he brought them out and said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”
Bahnar: Na sư tơlĕch bre Pôl păng Silas tơ 'ngoaih păng jet bre sư: “Ơ bre 'bok, pơm liơ inh gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch?”

English: So they said, “Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved, you and your household.”
Bahnar: Na bre Pôl khan kơ sư: “Ih lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist na ih gơh klaih, ih păng hnam dơnŏ ih kư̆m klaih lei-lăi mơ̆n.”

English: Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house.
Bahnar: Na bre Pôl păng Silas bơtho tơdrong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ sư păng đĭ-đăng hnam dơnŏ sư.

English: And he took them the same hour of the night and washed their stripes. And immediately he and all his family were baptized.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t ei oei kơmăng ră mơ̆n, mă-lei kră wei-lăng hnam phak ei ôp 'nhao rơka jĭ bre Pôl păng Silas. Klaih kơ noh sư păng hnam dơnŏ sư iŏk 'batem hloi.

English: Now when he had brought them into his house, he set food before them; and he rejoiced, having believed in God with all his household.
Bahnar: Sư atŏk bre Pôl păng Silas tơ hnam sư, ăn tơmam sŏng sa kơ bre sư. Jơhngơ̆m sư păng hnam dơnŏ sư chơt hiôk yua kơ lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei boih.

English: And when it was day, the magistrates sent the officers, saying, “Let those men go.”
Bahnar: Pơgê dơning lu kră pơlei wơh lu yŏng linh wă tơlĕch bre Pôl păng Silas.

English: So the keeper of the prison reported these words to Paul, saying, “The magistrates have sent to let you go. Now therefore depart, and go in peace.”
Bahnar: Kră wei-lăng hnam phak ei pơtruh kơ Pôl khan: “Lu kră pơlei khan kơ inh, athei inh pơtruh kơ biĕm nơ̆r lu sư khan ưh pă wă phak biĕm boih. Na dang ei ăn biĕm lĕch đơ̆ng hnam phak boih, năm kơ biĕm mă 'lơ̆ng bĕ.”

English: But Paul said to them, “They have beaten us openly, uncondemned Romans, and have thrown us into prison. And now do they put us out secretly? No indeed! Let them come themselves and get us out.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pôl khan kơ lu yŏng linh thoi âu: “Nhi bơngai Rôm lei-lăi thoi iĕm mơ̆n. Mă-lei lu kră pơlei năr brei sư tam mă sek tơlang tơdrong nhi, athei lu linh pơjĭ nhi hloi, 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei pơla tăm. Na đơ̆ng noh sư tah nhi lăm hnam phak. Na dang ei sư tơlĕch nhi ưh kơ đei roi kơ đe. Sư pơm thoi noh ưh kơ trŏ ôh. Na dang ei nhi athei lu kră pơlei năm tơ âu pơma tơdrong tơlĕch nhi âu.”

English: And the officers told these words to the magistrates, and they were afraid when they heard that they were Romans.
Bahnar: Lu yŏng linh pơtruh nơ̆r noh tơ kră pơlei. Na lu kră pơlei kơtơ̆ng bre sư bơngai Rôm, lu sư hli yua kơ pơm ưh kơ lăp kơ bre sư brei.

English: Then they came and pleaded with them and brought them out, and asked them to depart from the city.
Bahnar: Na lu kră pơlei năm tơ bre Pôl păng Silas na lu sư khan: “Nhôn apinh biĕm 'nĕ jô̆ yo. Na dang ei lu nhôn tơlĕch biĕm đơ̆ng hnam phak boih na nhôn apinh biĕm jăk đơ̆ng pơlei âu.”

English: So they went out of the prison and entered the house of Lydia; and when they had seen the brethren, they encouraged them and departed.
Bahnar: Na bre Pôl păng Silas đơ̆ng hnam phak ei năm tơ hnam yă Liđa hơpong kơ lu bơngai lui. Bre sư bơtho khan kơ lu sư wă kơ sư lui mă kơjăp đei jơhngơ̆m chơt hiôk. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh bre sư jăk đơ̆ng pơlei ei.

English: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews.
Bahnar: Bre Pôl păng Silas năm drong tơ Pơlei Amphi păng Pơlei Apơlê, na truh tơ Pơlei Têsalônik. Tơ ei đei hnam akŭm đe Juđê.

English: Then Paul, as his custom was, went in to them, and for three Sabbaths reasoned with them from the Scriptures
Bahnar: Tơ rim pơlei Pôl năm akŭm tơ hnam akŭm đe Juđê mơ̆n păng Pơlei Têsalônik lei-lăi mơ̆n. Sư akŭm păng đe rim năr pơdơh lăm pêng 'măng giĕng. Sư bơtho đơ̆ng lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei păng pơjah hăm lu sư.

English: explaining and demonstrating that the Christ had to suffer and rise again from the dead, and saying, “This Jesus whom I preach to you is the Christ.”
Bahnar: Sư tơblang tơdrong lu bơngai khan lê̆ hơdrol gah 'Bok Krist khan 'Bok Krist kơplah Sư oei ala teh Sư wă lôch iung arih dơ̆ng. Sư khan: “Inh bơtho ăn kơ iĕm tơdrong Yêsu. Yêsu boih 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n.”

English: And some of them were persuaded; and a great multitude of the devout Greeks, and not a few of the leading women, joined Paul and Silas.
Bahnar: Lăm lu bơngai Juđê đei lu mơ'nah lui kơ tơdrong Pôl bơtho na lu sư pôm đon păng bre Pôl păng Silas. Lơ bơngai Grĕk mă lui kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng sơ̆ păng lơ bơngai drŏ-kăn mă đei đon kư̆m lui kơ Yêsu mơ̆n.

English: But the Jews who were not persuaded, becoming envious, took some of the evil men from the marketplace, and gathering a mob, set all the city in an uproar and attacked the house of Jason, and sought to bring them out to the people.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê mơ'nah ưh kơ lui, lu sư 'nhĕng bre Pôl păng Silas. Na lu sư năm krao pơhlŭ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ đe. Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ ei lăm pơlei sư mơ̆n na lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆ kơ đe ei pơtrŭt lu kon pơlei pơla năm bơwang hnam Jason wă chă bre Pôl păng Silas, wă dui anhăk ba tơ'bơ̆p 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei pơla.

English: But when they did not find them, they dragged Jason and some brethren to the rulers of the city, crying out, “These who have turned the world upside down have come here too.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư chă bre Pôl păng Silas ưh kơ 'bôh. Thoi noh na sư rôp anhăk Jason păng lu bơngai lui nai mơ̆n, anhăk lu sư tơ kră pơlei. Sư pơma pơret khan kơ lu đe Jason ei khan: “Lu khŭl bơngai âu pơm kơnê̆ jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Dang ei lu sư năm tơ pơlei bơ̆n âu boih păng Jason âu ăn kơ lu sư oei tơ hnam sư. Đĭ-đăng lu sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt pơtao bơ̆n ôh. Lu sư khan sư đei minh 'nu pơtao nai, anăn Sư Yêsu.”

English: Jason has harbored them, and these are all acting contrary to the decrees of Caesar, saying there is another king—Jesus.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư chă bre Pôl păng Silas ưh kơ 'bôh. Thoi noh na sư rôp anhăk Jason păng lu bơngai lui nai mơ̆n, anhăk lu sư tơ kră pơlei. Sư pơma pơret khan kơ lu đe Jason ei khan: “Lu khŭl bơngai âu pơm kơnê̆ jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Dang ei lu sư năm tơ pơlei bơ̆n âu boih păng Jason âu ăn kơ lu sư oei tơ hnam sư. Đĭ-đăng lu sư ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt pơtao bơ̆n ôh. Lu sư khan sư đei minh 'nu pơtao nai, anăn Sư Yêsu.”

English: And they troubled the crowd and the rulers of the city when they heard these things.
Bahnar: Lăp lu kon pơlei pơla păng lu kră pơlei kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, lu sư pơma re đơđơu đơđao mao.

English: So when they had taken security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.
Bahnar: Lu kră pơlei athei Jason păng lu buăl bơngai lui, lu sư duh jên na gơh tơlĕch lu sư. Na lu sư chu duh kơ lu kră pơlei jên na kră pơlei achăng lê̆ lu sư.

English: Then the brethren immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Berea. When they arrived, they went into the synagogue of the Jews.
Bahnar: Truh 'năr mơ̆t boih, lu bơngai lui athei bre Pôl păng Silas năm tơ Pơlei Bêrê. Lăp truh tơ pơlei ei na bre sư năm akŭm tơ hnam akŭm bơngai Juđê.

English: These were more fair-minded than those in Thessalonica, in that they received the word with all readiness, and searched the Scriptures daily to find out whether these things were so.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pơlei Bêrê ưh kơ sĭ thoi bơngai Pơlei Têsalônik ôh. Lu sư wă mơ̆ng kơchăng tơpă. Rim năr lu sư lăng sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ băt tơdrong Pôl bơtho tơpă dah ưh.

English: Therefore many of them believed, and also not a few of the Greeks, prominent women as well as men.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lăm lu bơngai Juđê tơ ei đei lơ bơngai lui kơ Yêsu. Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai drŏ-kăn sư bơngai Grĕk, sư hơgei păng mơdrŏng păng lơ bơngai Grĕk drŏ-nglo kư̆m lui mơ̆n.

English: But when the Jews from Thessalonica learned that the word of God was preached by Paul at Berea, they came there also and stirred up the crowds.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng Pơlei Têsalônik kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong Pôl bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Bêrê, na lu sư năm tơ ei pơhlŭ lu kon pơlei pơla wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ bre sư.

English: Then immediately the brethren sent Paul away, to go to the sea; but both Silas and Timothy remained there.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai lui athei hloi Pôl năm tơ jih đak dơsĭ. Na bre Silas păng Timôthê oei kơtă 'bơ̆t Pơlei Bêrê ei, ưh kơ năm ôh.

English: So those who conducted Paul brought him to Athens; and receiving a command for Silas and Timothy to come to him with all speed, they departed.
Bahnar: Đei lu bơngai lui năm ba Pôl truh tơ Pơlei Aten. Na đơ̆ng noh lu bơngai lui ei brŏk dơ̆ng tơ Pơlei Bêrê, pơtruh nơ̆r Pôl athei bre Silas păng Timôthê năm hloi tơ sư.

English: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was provoked within him when he saw that the city was given over to idols.
Bahnar: Hơtai Pôl oei chang gô bre Silas păng Timôthê tơ Pơlei Aten ei, sư sơ'ngon dêh yua kơ sư 'bôh Pơlei Aten ei lơ pơm rup yang tơpă.

English: Therefore he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and with the Gentile worshipers, and in the marketplace daily with those who happened to be there.
Bahnar: Na Pôl bơtho lu bơngai Juđê păng lu bơngai nai mă lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ hnam akŭm bơngai Juđê wă kơ lu sư lui kơ Yêsu. Pôl kư̆m bơtho lu kon pơlei pơla tơ kơchơ mơ̆n.

English: Then certain Epicurean and Stoic philosophers encountered him. And some said, “What does this babbler want to say?” Others said, “He seems to be a proclaimer of foreign gods,” because he preached to them Jesus and the resurrection.
Bahnar: Đei lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong Êpikur păng lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong Sơtôk kư̆m pơjah păng Pôl mơ̆n. Đei bơngai mơ'nah khan kơ Pôl: “Bơngai 'bơ̆r đon kư̆ kă đĕch âu. Sư wă pơma tơdrong kiơ ră âu? Bơ̆n ưh kơ hlôh ôh iih?” Đei mơ'nah khan dơ̆ng: “Rŏ lăng sư bơtho tơdrong lu yang đe nai đĕch âu.” Lu sư pơma khan kơ Pôl thoi noh yua kơ Pôl bơtho sư gah tơdrong Yêsu lôch iung arih dơ̆ng.

English: And they took him and brought him to the Areopagus, saying, “May we know what this new doctrine is of which you speak?
Bahnar: Na lu sư anhăk Pôl truh tơ kră pơlei tơ kông Arêpa. Kông ei kơtă lăm pơlei sư hloi. Păng nơ̆r sư khan: “Nhôn wă kơ băt gah tơdrong 'nao ih bơtho.

English: For you are bringing some strange things to our ears. Therefore we want to know what these things mean.”
Bahnar: Nhôn đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei ưh tam kơtơ̆ng tơdrong ih bơtho âu ôh, na nhôn wă kơ băt dang ei.”

English: For all the Athenians and the foreigners who were there spent their time in nothing else but either to tell or to hear some new thing.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma thoi noh yua kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Pơlei Aten păng lu bơngai tơmoi oei tơ pơlei ei mơ̆n, lu sư ling-lang wă răp mơ̆ng tơdrong 'nao đe bơtho, mơ'nah bơtho tơdrong kiơ, mơ'nah bơtho tơdrong kiơ.

English: Then Paul stood in the midst of the Areopagus and said, “Men of Athens, I perceive that in all things you are very religious
Bahnar: Pôl dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp kră pơlei tơ kông Arêpa păng khan thoi âu: “Ơ Pơlei Aten, inh 'bôh iĕm kơkuh kơ rup yang lơ tơpă.

English: for as I was passing through and considering the objects of your worship, I even found an altar with this inscription: TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Therefore, the One whom you worship without knowing, Him I proclaim to you
Bahnar: Hơtai inh brŏk năm chă lăng pơlei iĕm, inh 'bôh lu anih iĕm kơkuh kơ yang păng inh 'bôh minh anih iĕm chih thoi âu: ‘Anih âu bơ̆n kơkuh kơ yang bơ̆n ưh tam kơnăl.’ Yang iĕm kơkuh noh iĕm khan ưh tam kơnăl, mă yang noh boih inh bơtho kơ iĕm dang ei.

English: “God, who made the world and everything in it, since He is Lord of heaven and earth, does not dwell in temples made with hands.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh teh păng đĭ-đăng sem tơmam oei lăm teh đak. Sư pơgơ̆r plĕnh teh, na Sư ưh kơ oei lăm hnam bơngai pơm ôh.

English: Nor is He worshiped with men’s hands, as though He needed anything, since He gives to all life, breath, and all things.
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ kăl kơ bơ̆n tơgŭm Sư ôh yua kơ Sư boih ăn kơ bơ̆n arih păng ăn kơ bơ̆n đĭ-đăng tơmam bơ̆n kăl yua.

English: And He has made from one blood every nation of men to dwell on all the face of the earth, and has determined their preappointed times and the boundaries of their dwellings
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing đơ̆ng minh 'nu bơngai, mă-lei Sư pơjing kơ đĭ-đăng khŭl bơngai wă kơ bơngai bơ̆n oei jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Sư ată khŭl bơngai mơ'nah pơgơ̆r đunh dang yơ. Teh đak bơ̆n oei Sư kư̆m asong mơ̆n.

English: so that they should seek the Lord, in the hope that they might grope for Him and find Him, though He is not far from each one of us
Bahnar: “'Bok Kei-Dei pơm thoi noh wă kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gơh chă Sư păng lui kơ Sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ataih đơ̆ng bơ̆n ôh.

English: for in Him we live and move and have our being, as also some of your own poets have said, ‘For we are also His offspring.’
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'bok thây iĕm kư̆m chih mơ̆n sơ̆ khan: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơ̆n gơh arih gơh bơ̆jang.’ 'Bok thây iĕm kư̆m chih thoi âu: ‘Bơ̆n kư̆m kon 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.’

English: Therefore, since we are the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Divine Nature is like gold or silver or stone, something shaped by art and man’s devising.
Bahnar: “Iĕm pơm rup yang phŏ păng maih, dah hu, dah păng tơmo. Iĕm pơm rup yang kiơ̆ kơ iĕm tơchĕng đon iĕm kơdih đĕch. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing bơ̆n kon Sư, na bơ̆n 'nĕ tơchĕng 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi lĕ rup yang đĕch ôh.

English: Truly, these times of ignorance God overlooked, but now commands all men everywhere to repent
Bahnar: Sơ̆ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ jô̆ kơ kon bơngai yua kơ kon bơngai ưh kơ băt kơ Sư. Mă-lei dang ei Sư athei đĭ-đăng bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak tơbral dôm tơdrong yoch sư kơdih

English: because He has appointed a day on which He will judge the world in righteousness by the Man whom He has ordained. He has given assurance of this to all by raising Him from the dead.”
Bahnar: yua kơ Sư pơkă năr boih wă kơ sek tơlang tơpăt kơ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Sư rơih minh 'nu bơngai wă sek tơlang tơgŭm 'Bă Sư boih. Bơngai sek tơlang ei, anăn Sư Yêsu Krist. 'Bă Sư ăn kơ Sư lôch iung arih wă tơbăt kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Yêsu gô sek tơlang kon bơngai tơpă.”

English: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked, while others said, “We will hear you again on this matter.”
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai Aten kơtơ̆ng Pôl bơtho thoi noh gah bơngai lôch iung arih noh, lu mơ'nah hiĕk kơ sư. Mă-lei đei lu mơ'nah khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Gô layơ dơ̆ng nhôn mơ̆ng ih bơtho tơdrong âu.”

English: So Paul departed from among them.
Bahnar: Na Pôl lĕch hloi đơ̆ng anih sư bơtho ei tơ 'ngoaih.

English: After these things Paul departed from Athens and went to Corinth.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh Pôl năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Aten truh tơ Pơlei Kôrintô.

English: And he found a certain Jew named Aquila, born in Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla (because Claudius had commanded all the Jews to depart from Rome); and he came to them.
Bahnar: Tơ ei sư tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai Juđê anăn sư Akila. Bơngai ei mĕ sư tơpŭ sư tơ dêh char Pôntơ. Sư păng akăn sư, anăn sư Prisil, 'nao jăk đơ̆ng dêh char Itali yua kơ pơtao Klôt athei đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđê jăk đơ̆ng lăm Pơlei Rôm.

English: So, because he was of the same trade, he stayed with them and worked; for by occupation they were tentmakers.
Bahnar: Bre sư bơ̆jang tơdrong pơm hnam tua-la-tăng na Pôl năm oei hloi tơ hnam bre sư, jang hơdai păng sư yua kơ Pôl juăt kơ jang tơdrong noh mơ̆n. Pôl kư̆m bơtho rah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And he reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath, and persuaded both Jews and Greeks.
Bahnar: Rim năr pơdơh Pôl năm akŭm tơ hnam akŭm bơngai Juđê bơtho lu bơngai Juđê păng lu bơngai Grĕk wă kơ đĭ-đăng lu sư păng Juđê lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: When Silas and Timothy had come from Macedonia, Paul was compelled by the Spirit, and testified to the Jews that Jesus is the Christ.
Bahnar: Lăp bre Silas păng Timôthê truh tơ Pơlei Kôrintô đơ̆ng dêh char Masêđôn, na Pôl lê̆ tơdrong pơm hnam tua-la-tăng iŏk gah tơdrong bơtho sư dơ̆ng, bơtho lu bơngai Juđê khan Yêsu boih 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n.

English: But when they opposed him and blasphemed, he shook his garments and said to them, “Your blood be upon your own heads; I am clean. From now on I will go to the Gentiles.”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Juđê areh kơ Pôl păng che bơle kơ sư. Na Pôl sơpuih 'bruih tơ ao sư kơdih păng khan: “Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei phak iĕm ning-mônh măk ai iĕm boih hŏ, yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ lui kơ Yêsu. Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp inh năm bơtho lu bơngai nai đĕch boih, inh pă wă boih bơtho khŭl Juđê bơ̆n pơlei âu.”

English: And he departed from there and entered the house of a certain man named Justus, one who worshiped God, whose house was next door to the synagogue.
Bahnar: Pôl ưh pă bơtho boih lu bơngai Juđê ei. Na sư năm bơtho tơ hnam minh 'nu bơngai ưh kơ khŭl Juđê, anăn sư Titơ Jơtơ. Bơngai ei lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng sơ̆. Hnam sư jê̆ hnam akŭm bơngai Juđê.

English: Then Crispus, the ruler of the synagogue, believed on the Lord with all his household. And many of the Corinthians, hearing, believed and were baptized.
Bahnar: Kripơ kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm bơngai Juđê, sư tam mă lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu na đơ̆ng Pôl bơtho sư, na sư păng đĭ-đăng hnam dơnŏ sư kư̆m lui mơ̆n. Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai nai dơ̆ng lăm Pơlei Kôrintô mơ̆ng Pôl bơtho lu sư, na lu sư lui hloi kơ Kră Yang Yêsu păng iŏk 'batem.

English: Now the Lord spoke to Paul in the night by a vision, “Do not be afraid, but speak, and do not keep silent
Bahnar: Minh măng ei Pôl apo 'bôh Kră Yang Yêsu pơma păng sư khan: “Ih 'nĕ kơ hli păng ih 'nĕ kơ tŭk tơdrong jang ih. Ih kư̆ bơtho ling-lang đĕch.

English: for I am with you, and no one will attack you to hurt you; for I have many people in this city.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Inh oei hơdai păng ih ling-lang ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơrăm ih ôh, yua kơ đei lơ bơngai lăm pơlei âu gô lui kơ Inh.”

English: And he continued there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them.
Bahnar: Pôl oei tơ Pơlei Kôrintô ei minh sơnăm minh puăt bơtho kon pơlei pơla tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: When Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him to the judgment seat
Bahnar: Lăp Galiôn tŏk pơm kră pơgơ̆r tơ dêh char Grĕk, lu bơngai Juđê pơđâu băl pôm đon na lu sư năm rôp Pôl anhăk sư tơ anih lu kră sek tơlang.

English: saying, “This fellow persuades men to worship God contrary to the law.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê khan kơ 'bok Galiôn thoi âu: “Bơngai âu athei đe lui kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ trŏ thoi tơdrong juăt bơ̆n, na ih athei phak sư.”

English: And when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews, “If it were a matter of wrongdoing or wicked crimes, O Jews, there would be reason why I should bear with you.
Bahnar: Pôl 'nao wă pơma khan kơ lu sư ră, na Galiôn găn 'bơ̆r Pôl pơma. Sư wă kơ akâu sư kơdih đĕch pơma. Na Galiôn pơma dŏng Pôl. Sư khan kơ lu bơngai Juđê thoi âu: “Tơdah bơngai âu pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ lei inh chu mơ̆ng lu iĕm.

English: But if it is a question of words and names and your own law, look to it yourselves; for I do not want to be a judge of such matters.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong âu gah nơ̆r sư bơtho đĕch, na dang ei gô mơ̆ng tơdrong juăt iĕm kơdih đĕch. Iĕm athei sek tơlang kơdih, inh ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng iĕm dơ̆ng.”

English: And he drove them from the judgment seat.
Bahnar: Na Galiôn athei lu linh sư pơpuh lu bơngai Juđê mă jâu Pôl đơ̆ng hnam sek tơlang ei.

English: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. But Gallio took no notice of these things.
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei pơla ưh kơ khŭl Juđê rôp minh 'nu lăm khŭl Juđê ei anăn sư Sôten. Sư kră hnam akŭm bơngai Juđê. Lu sư teh hloi Sôten 'bơ̆t anăp lu kră sek tơlang. Na Galiôn sư ưh kơ tang găn ôh.

English: So Paul still remained a good while. Then he took leave of the brethren and sailed for Syria, and Priscilla and Aquila were with him. He had his hair cut off at Cenchrea, for he had taken a vow.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Pôl oei tơ Pơlei Kôrintô kư̆m đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n. Klaih kơ noh sư tơklah đơ̆ng bơngai lui wă năm tơ dêh char Siri. Bre Prisil păng Akila kư̆m kiơ̆ hơdai păng sư mơ̆n. Lu sư năm tơ Pơlei Sankrê. Tơ ei Pôl yuă sŏk. Đunh boih sư ưh kơ yuă sŏk yua kơ sư pơkă hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơdrong kiơ kiơ. Dang ei sư pơm đang tơdrong sư pơkă noh na sư gơh yuă sŏk dơ̆ng.

English: And he came to Ephesus, and left them there; but he himself entered the synagogue and reasoned with the Jews.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu sư tŏk thŏng-nan năm tơ Pơlei Êphêsô. Truh tơ Pơlei Êphêsô boih, bre Prisil păng Akila, bre sư oei hloi tơ ei. Pôl năm akŭm tơ hnam akŭm bơngai Juđê tơ Pơlei Êphêsô bơtho păng pơjah hăm lu bơngai Juđê.

English: When they asked him to stay a longer time with them, he did not consent
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê ei apinh Pôl oei păng lu sư khŏm khŏm mă-lei Pôl ưh kơ chu sư.

English: but took leave of them, saying, “I must by all means keep this coming feast in Jerusalem; but I will return again to you, God willing.” And he sailed from Ephesus.
Bahnar: Lăp Pôl wă năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Êphêsô sư khan kơ lu sư: “Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ inh wih bơtho iĕm lei inh gô brŏk bơtho iĕm.” Klaih kơ noh na Pôl tŏk thŏng-nan năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Êphêsô năm truh tơ Pơlei Sêsarê. Đơ̆ng noh sư năm hloi tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem hơpong kơ lu bơngai lui tơ ei. Klaih kơ noh sư năm truh tơ Pơlei Antiôs lăm dêh char Siri.

English: And when he had landed at Caesarea, and gone up and greeted the church, he went down to Antioch.
Bahnar: Lăp Pôl wă năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Êphêsô sư khan kơ lu sư: “Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ inh wih bơtho iĕm lei inh gô brŏk bơtho iĕm.” Klaih kơ noh na Pôl tŏk thŏng-nan năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Êphêsô năm truh tơ Pơlei Sêsarê. Đơ̆ng noh sư năm hloi tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem hơpong kơ lu bơngai lui tơ ei. Klaih kơ noh sư năm truh tơ Pơlei Antiôs lăm dêh char Siri.

English: After he had spent some time there, he departed and went over the region of Galatia and Phrygia in order, strengthening all the disciples.
Bahnar: Sư oei tơ ei kư̆m đunh năr 'biơ̆ mơ̆n. Đơ̆ng noh sư năm tơ dêh char Galati păng dêh char Phiji bơtho păng tơgŭm lu bơngai lui athei lu sư lui mă kơjăp.

English: Now a certain Jew named Apollos, born at Alexandria, an eloquent man and mighty in the Scriptures, came to Ephesus.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai Juđê, anăn sư Apôlê. Mĕ sư tơpŭ kơ sư tơ Pơlei Aleksandrê. Sư bơngai 'bơ̆r đon bơtho hơgei tơpă păng hlôh đĭ dôm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spoke and taught accurately the things of the Lord, though he knew only the baptism of John.
Bahnar: Sư pơhrăm tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu boih păng jơhngơ̆m sư wă tơpă gah bơtho tơdrong Yêsu. Sư bơtho tơdrong Yêsu kư̆m trŏ mơ̆n mă-lei sư băt ưh tam mă tôm ôh. Sư bơtho tơdrong 'batem, sư bơtho kiơ̆ kơ Yôhan đĕch; sư tam mă băt tơdrong 'batem hăm anăn Kră Yang Yêsu Krist.

English: So he began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Aquila and Priscilla heard him, they took him aside and explained to him the way of God more accurately.
Bahnar: Apôlê năm tơ Pơlei Êphêsô bơtho tơ hnam akŭm bơngai Juđê. Sư bơtho kư̆m nuih tơpă mơ̆n. Lăp Prisil păng Akila mơ̆ng sư bơtho bre sư anhăk ba sư truh tơ hnam bre sư. Bre sư bơtho ăn kơ Apôlê tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ sư hlôh băt tôm 'biơ̆.

English: And when he desired to cross to Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him; and when he arrived, he greatly helped those who had believed through grace
Bahnar: Apôlê kư̆m wă năm tơ dêh char Grĕk mơ̆n. Na lu bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Êphêsô tơgŭm sư chih kơ sư kơthơ wă chĕp ba ăn kơ lu buăl lui tơ dêh char Grĕk, apinh lu bơngai lui ei sơng iŏk sư. Lăp Apôlê truh tơ char Grĕk boih, Apôlê bơtho tơgŭm tơpă kơ lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat ăn lui kơ Yêsu boih.

English: And it happened, while Apollos was at Corinth, that Paul, having passed through the upper regions, came to Ephesus. And finding some disciples
Bahnar: Hơtai Apôlê oei tơ Pơlei Kôrintô tơ dêh char Grĕk, Pôl năm tơ Pơlei Êphêsô. Sư năm trong kông, na truh tơ Pơlei Êphêsô ei boih sư tơ'bơ̆p bơngai lui kơ Yêsu.

English: he said to them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed?” So they said to him, “We have not so much as heard whether there is a Holy Spirit.”
Bahnar: Pôl jet lu bơngai lui ei thoi âu: “Lăp iĕm lui na hăm đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur oei hăm lu iĕm?” Na lu bơngai lui khan: “Nhôn ưh tam mă băt Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng lơliơ.”

English: And he said to them, “Into what then were you baptized?” So they said, “Into John’s baptism.”
Bahnar: Pôl jet lu sư dơ̆ng: “Đe pơm kơ iĕm 'batem ayơ?” Lu sư khan: “Đe pơm kơ nhôn 'batem kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Yôhan bơtho.”

English: Then Paul said, “John indeed baptized with a baptism of repentance, saying to the people that they should believe on Him who would come after him, that is, on Christ Jesus.”
Bahnar: Pôl khan gah tơdrong Yôhan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Yôhan pơm 'batem kơ lu bơngai tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch păng sư bơtho lu bơngai Isơrael athei lu sư lui kơ minh 'nu 'Bok gô truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ sư, wă khan Yêsu.”

English: When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pôl tơ'bơ̆p ei kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na sư iŏk 'batem hăm anăn Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: And when Paul had laid hands on them, the Holy Spirit came upon them, and they spoke with tongues and prophesied.
Bahnar: Pôl pel kơ̆l lu sư, na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur oei hăm lu sư. Lu sư pơma hloi nơ̆r hlĭch păng bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now the men were about twelve in all.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lui ei dang mơjĭt-'bar 'nu.

English: And he went into the synagogue and spoke boldly for three months, reasoning and persuading concerning the things of the kingdom of God.
Bahnar: Kơplah pêng khei Pôl bơtho tơ hnam akŭm bơngai Juđê tơ Pơlei Êphêsô. Sư bơtho đe nuih tơpă. Sư pơjah păng lu đe ei, sư bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n thoi yơ.

English: But when some were hardened and did not believe, but spoke evil of the Way before the multitude, he departed from them and withdrew the disciples, reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu mơ'nah ưh kơ chu lui. Na lu sư pơma kơnê̆ gah tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai akŭm. Na Pôl đơ̆ng lu sư năm akŭm tơ nai. Lu bơngai lui kư̆m akŭm kiơ̆ Pôl mơ̆n. Na rim năr sư bơtho păng pơjah tơ hnam trưng Tiranơ.

English: And this continued for two years, so that all who dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus, both Jews and Greeks.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'bar sơnăm sư bơtho tơ hnam trưng ei, na đĭ-đăng bơngai oei tơ dêh char Asi mă bơngai Juđê mă lu bơngai nai, kư̆m kơtơ̆ng tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu mơ̆n.

English: Now God worked unusual miracles by the hands of Paul
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Pôl pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang hlĭch tơpă.

English: so that even handkerchiefs or aprons were brought from his body to the sick, and the diseases left them and the evil spirits went out of them.
Bahnar: Bơngai lui iŏk che mu-suar păng kơn đêl Pôl yua kơdih, pơchĕp kơ đe jĭ jăn, na tơdrong jĭ lu sư klaih păng lu yang kơnê̆ lĕch đĭ đơ̆ng akâu lu sư.

English: Then some of the itinerant Jewish exorcists took it upon themselves to call the name of the Lord Jesus over those who had evil spirits, saying, “We exorcise you by the Jesus whom Paul preaches.”
Bahnar: Tơ ei kư̆m đei lu bơngai Juđê năm jơ̆p-jang tơ lu bơngai ưh kơ lui, mă sư kư̆m ưh kơ lui mơ̆n, wă pơpuh yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng akâu đe. Sư wă pơm thoi Pôl na lu sư hơdai yua anăn Kră Yang Yêsu wă pơpuh. Đei tơpơh 'nu kon tơdăm Sewơ pơm thoi noh. Sewơ pơm 'bok soi tih bơngai Juđê. Lu sư khan kơ yang kơnê̆ thoi âu: “Pôl bơtho tơdrong Yêsu, na inh yua anăn Yêsu, inh athei e lĕch đơ̆ng bơngai âu.”

English: Also there were seven sons of Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, who did so.
Bahnar: Tơ ei kư̆m đei lu bơngai Juđê năm jơ̆p-jang tơ lu bơngai ưh kơ lui, mă sư kư̆m ưh kơ lui mơ̆n, wă pơpuh yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng akâu đe. Sư wă pơm thoi Pôl na lu sư hơdai yua anăn Kră Yang Yêsu wă pơpuh. Đei tơpơh 'nu kon tơdăm Sewơ pơm thoi noh. Sewơ pơm 'bok soi tih bơngai Juđê. Lu sư khan kơ yang kơnê̆ thoi âu: “Pôl bơtho tơdrong Yêsu, na inh yua anăn Yêsu, inh athei e lĕch đơ̆ng bơngai âu.”

English: And the evil spirit answered and said, “Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are you?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai yang kơnê̆ ei khan kơ lu sư: “Inh băt kơ Yêsu păng inh băt kơ Pôl; mă lu iĕm âu inh ưh kơ băt ôh. Iĕm bu?”

English: Then the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, overpowered them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.
Bahnar: Na bơngai yang mơ̆t ei hơloh teh hloi lu đe ei jĭ tơpă. Na lu sư kơdâu tơklah đơ̆ng hnam bơngai yang mơ̆t ei, yua kơ jei bơngai yang mơ̆t ei boih. Ao lu sư tơhek đĭ păng akâu lu sư 'blơ̆n 'blăn pơ'ngeh.

English: This became known both to all Jews and Greeks dwelling in Ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Juđê păng bơngai nai oei tơ Pơlei Êphêsô kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh lu sư hli tơpă na ư-ang kơ Kră Yang Yêsu.

English: And many who had believed came confessing and telling their deeds.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na đei lu bơngai lui ưh kơjăp năm tơ Pôl. Lu sư ră roi kơ Pôl tơdrong yoch lu sư năm tơ pơjâu.

English: Also, many of those who had practiced magic brought their books together and burned them in the sight of all. And they counted up the value of them, and it totaled fifty thousand pieces of silver.
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai pơm pơjâu nai dơ̆ng, lu sư năm tơ Pôl chĕp ba sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong pơjâu sư, na soh lê̆ sơ̆p hla bơar ei 'bơ̆t anăp lu kon pơlei pơla hloi. Đe jô̆ jên răt hla bơar ei sơ̆ đei pơđăm-jĭt rơbâu jên hu.

English: So the word of the Lord grew mightily and prevailed.
Bahnar: Thoi noh đe 'bôh tơdrong Kră Yang tơlĕch mơsêh mơyang sư kơtang tơpă, na lơ bơngai kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh na lui hloi kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist.

English: When these things were accomplished, Paul purposed in the Spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying, “After I have been there, I must also see Rome.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh dơ̆ng Pôl khan wă năm tơ dêh char Masêđôn păng dêh char Grĕk, klaih kơ noh wă năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem dơ̆ng, yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng athei sư năm. Sư khan đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh kư̆m khan wă năm tơ Pơlei Rôm mơ̆n.

English: So he sent into Macedonia two of those who ministered to him, Timothy and Erastus, but he himself stayed in Asia for a time.
Bahnar: Na sư wơh 'bar 'nu buăl sư Timôthê păng Êrat năm tơ dêh char Masêđôn hơdrol kơ sư. Na đơ̆ng ei Pôl oei tơ char Asi đunh 'biơ̆ dơ̆ng.

English: And about that time there arose a great commotion about the Way.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei đei tơdrong truh kơ lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu tơ Pơlei Êphêsô.

English: For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, who made silver shrines of Diana, brought no small profit to the craftsmen.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai pơm tơmam hu, anăn sư Đêmêtrơs, oei tơ Pơlei Êphêsô. Sư pơm hnam yang iĕ păng hu lei-lăi kơ hnam yang tih mơ̆n yang Dian. Sư pơm tĕch hnam ei lơ tơpă păng đei lơ jên, hăm lu bơngai jang kơ sư sa jên kư̆m lơ.

English: He called them together with the workers of similar occupation, and said: “Men, you know that we have our prosperity by this trade.
Bahnar: Đêmêtrơs krao akŭm đĭ lu bơngai jang kơ sư păng lu bơngai nai jang tơdrong lei-lăi thoi lu sư mơ̆n. Sư khan: “Ơ đe 'nhŏng oh, iĕm băt boih bơ̆n sa jên lơ âu dang ei yua kơ tơdrong jang bơ̆n đei lơi tơpă.

English: Moreover you see and hear that not only at Ephesus, but throughout almost all Asia, this Paul has persuaded and turned away many people, saying that they are not gods which are made with hands.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm 'bôh păng kơtơ̆ng tơdrong Pôl pơm. Sư pơgŏ đe lui ưh kơ trŏ, sư khan lu yang bơngai pơm ưh kơ sĭ yang tơpă ôh, yang pơm đĕch. Na đei lơ bơngai tơpă lui kơ sư bơtho tơ Pơlei Êphêsô păng wă jê̆ jơ̆p tơ dêh char Asi mơ̆n.

English: So not only is this trade of ours in danger of falling into disrepute, but also the temple of the great goddess Diana may be despised and her magnificence destroyed, whom all Asia and the world worship.”
Bahnar: Na bơ̆n athei kơchăng hli kơ đe jô̆ kơ tơdrong jang bơ̆n ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng păng hnam kơkuh kơ yang Dian bơ̆n, yang tih tơpă ră, kơnh đe khan jing ưh kơ gĭt. Dang ei đĭ-đăng bơngai dêh char Asi păng jơ̆p kơ teh đak lui kơkuh kơ yang Dian, yang tih tơpă. Na ning-mônh hli kơ đe ưh pă ư-ang kơ yang Dian bơ̆n dơ̆ng.”

English: Now when they heard this, they were full of wrath and cried out, saying, “Great is Diana of the Ephesians!”
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư kơtơ̆ng thoi noh lu sư areh kơ Pôl tơpă. Lu sư pơma re thoi âu: “Ư-ang kơ yang Dian yang khŭl bơngai Êphêsô.”

English: So the whole city was filled with confusion, and rushed into the theater with one accord, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, Macedonians, Paul’s travel companions.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, lu sư kư̆m hil areh mơ̆n. Na sư krao pơret dih băl wă kơ đe pơlei năm tơkan tơ sư. Na lu sư năm rôp 'bar 'nu buăl Pôl, anăn bre sư Guơs păng Aritak. Bre sư bơngai đơ̆ng dêh char Masêđôn. Lu kon pơlei pơla chông ba bre sư tơ hnam akŭm đe kon pơlei juăt sek tơlang tơdrong bơngai.

English: And when Paul wanted to go in to the people, the disciples would not allow him.
Bahnar: Pôl wă năm pơma 'bơ̆t anăp đe kon pơlei pơla ră mă-lei lu bơngai lui gah bơ̆n ưh kơ ăn.

English: Then some of the officials of Asia, who were his friends, sent to him pleading that he would not venture into the theater.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei 'bar pêng 'nu kră pơgơ̆r dêh char Asi buăl juăt Pôl. Lu sư pơtruh kơ Pôl khan: “Ih 'nĕ kơ mơ̆t lăm hnam akŭm đe noh.”

English: Some therefore cried one thing and some another, for the assembly was confused, and most of them did not know why they had come together.
Bahnar: Lăm hnam đe ei đe pơma đơđơu đơđao mao. Đei lu mơ'nah pơma re tơdrong 'nâu, lu mơ'nah tơdrong nai, yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ băt akŭm tơdrong kiơ.

English: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude, the Jews putting him forward. And Alexander motioned with his hand, and wanted to make his defense to the people.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê tơ pơlei ei mơ̆n, sư athei minh 'nu bơngai bôl sư, Aleksandrê, năm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei pơla wă pơma dŏng lu sư. Na lu bơngai Êphêsô mơ'nah ngêh kơ Aleksandrê boih bơngai đe wă sek tơlang. Na Aleksandrê yơ̆r ti sư wă kơ đe thĕng huay pă pơma. Sư wă pơma dŏng lu bơngai Juđê ră.

English: But when they found out that he was a Jew, all with one voice cried out for about two hours, “Great is Diana of the Ephesians!”
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai Pơlei Êphêsô kơnăl kơ sư bơngai Juđê mơ̆n, na lu sư rai pơma re khan: “Ư-ang kơ yang Dian yang khŭl bơngai Êphêsô bơ̆n.” Lu sư pơma ư-ang kơ yang sư thoi noh khŏm khŏm lăm 'bar jơ.

English: And when the city clerk had quieted the crowd, he said: “Men of Ephesus, what man is there who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is temple guardian of the great goddess Diana, and of the image which fell down from Zeus?
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng 'bar jơ ei truh tơ minh 'nu kră pơlei mah khă lu kon pơlei pơla pơma. Sư khan: “Ơ lu bơngai Êphêsô, đĭ-đăng bơngai băt Pơlei Êphêsô wei-lăng hnam yang Dian yang tih tơpă păng wei-lăng yang tơmo Dian huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh.

English: Therefore, since these things cannot be denied, you ought to be quiet and do nothing rashly.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu khan kơ bơ̆n hơlĕnh ôh. Tơdrong noh tơpă yơh, na dang ei iĕm thĕng bĕ. 'Nĕ pơm tơdrong kư̆ kă kơ lu bơngai âu dơ̆ng.

English: For you have brought these men here who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of your goddess.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai âu ưh kơ đei tơtông klĕ tơmam đơ̆ng hnam yang ôh păng ưh kơ đei pơma kơnê̆ kơ yang bơ̆n, mă-lei iĕm khŏm chông ba sư tơ âu.

English: Therefore, if Demetrius and his fellow craftsmen have a case against anyone, the courts are open and there are proconsuls. Let them bring charges against one another.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n đei lu kră sek tơlang păng hnam sek tơlang mơ̆n. Tơdah Đêmêtrơs păng lu bơngai jang kơ sư wă jâu bu, lu sư athei năm tơ lu kră sek tơlang.

English: But if you have any other inquiry to make, it shall be determined in the lawful assembly.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah iĕm wă pơma apinh tơdrong nai dơ̆ng, iĕm athei gô trŏ năr lu kră pơgơ̆r krao akŭm iĕm.

English: For we are in danger of being called in question for today’s uproar, there being no reason which we may give to account for this disorderly gathering.”
Bahnar: Bơ̆n akŭm năr âu kư̆ kă đĕch, ưh kơ trŏ năr sư pơkă ôh. Na bơ̆n hli kơ lu kră pơgơ̆r ngêh kơ bơ̆n jâu sư khan bơ̆n wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư. Dah lu sư jâu bơ̆n tơpă, bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh drơ̆ng sư thoi yơ.”

English: After the uproar had ceased, Paul called the disciples to himself, embraced them, and departed to go to Macedonia.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơdrong noh tôch boih, Pôl krao akŭm lu bơngai lui păng pơma pơlung lu sư wă kơ jơhngơ̆m lu sư chơt hiôk, kơlih kơ Pôl wă tơklah đơ̆ng lu sư năm tơ dêh char Masêđôn.

English: Now when he had gone over that region and encouraged them with many words, he came to Greece
Bahnar: Sư năm jơ̆p tơ dêh char Masêđôn ei bơtho tơgŭm tơpă kơ lu bơngai lui wă kơ lu sư lui mă kơjăp. Klaih kơ noh sư năm tơ dêh char Grĕk dơ̆ng.

English: and stayed three months. And when the Jews plotted against him as he was about to sail to Syria, he decided to return through Macedonia.
Bahnar: Pôl oei tơ ei pêng khei. Klaih kơ noh sư wă năm tơ dêh char Siri ră, na sư kơtơ̆ng lu bơngai Juđê wă rôp pơrăm lê̆ sư. Thoi noh na sư brŏk trong đêl sư năm hơdrol ei dơ̆ng, gah trong dêh char Masêđôn.

English: And Sopater of Berea accompanied him to Asia—also Aristarchus and Secundus of the Thessalonians, and Gaius of Derbe, and Timothy, and Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai âu kư̆m năm kiơ̆ sư mơ̆n, lu anăn sư: Sôpatê kon Piru, sư đơ̆ng Pơlei Bêrê; bre Aritak păng Sêkônđa đơ̆ng Pơlei Têsalônik; Guơs đơ̆ng Pơlei Dibơ; Timôthê đơ̆ng Pơlei Litrơ; păng bre Tisĭk, Trôphĭm đơ̆ng dêh char Asi.

English: These men, going ahead, waited for us at Troas.
Bahnar: Anăn inh Luka oei păng Pôl tơ Pơlei Philip. Na lu đe noh hei sư năm tơ Pơlei Trôs hơdrol kơ nhi boih na lu sư chang gô nhi Pôl tơ ei.

English: But we sailed away from Philippi after the Days of Unleavened Bread, and in five days joined them at Troas, where we stayed seven days.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei đe pơm giĕng bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đe sa 'Bĕng Mi Ưh Kơ Đei 'Buih Pông. Hlôi đe sa giĕng ei đang boih, nhi năm đơ̆ng Pơlei đe Philip tŏk thŏng-nan năm tơ Pơlei Trôs. Pơđăm năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'noh na nhi truh tơ Pơlei Trôs păng tơ'bơ̆p hloi lu bôl nhi năm năr hơdrol ki. Nhôn oei tơ Pơlei Trôs ei minh 'măng giĕng hloi.

English: Now on the first day of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul, ready to depart the next day, spoke to them and continued his message until midnight.
Bahnar: Kơsơ̆ năr mă mônh lăm giĕng nhôn akŭm wă kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng sŏng sa hơpong dih băl. Na Pôl bơtho lu bơngai akŭm ei tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư bơtho đunh tơpă khŏm khŏm truh tơ mơjĭt-'bar jơ kơmăng, yua kơ sư wă tơklah dih băl năr dơning na nhôn athei ngôi hơpong dih băl mă hrăp.

English: There were many lamps in the upper room where they were gathered together.
Bahnar: Nhôn akŭm tơ anih hnam gah kơpal. Lăm ei đei ŭnh kơđeng lơ.

English: And in a window sat a certain young man named Eutychus, who was sinking into a deep sleep. He was overcome by sleep; and as Paul continued speaking, he fell down from the third story and was taken up dead.
Bahnar: Lăm nhôn akŭm ei đei minh 'nu bơngai tơdăm, anăn sư Ơtik, sư tơoei 'bơ̆t 'măng-'mŏk. Hơtai Pôl oei bơtho khŏm khŏm na bơngai tơdăm ei sư pă kĕ kral boih na sư kơkôi khŏm khŏm jing tep hiơt hloi tơpă. Na sư huŏng đơ̆ng hnam ei tơ teh, đơ̆ng hnam anih pêng tơ̆ng tơ kơpal ti. Lu bơngai ei thar jur tơiung hloi sư ră, mă-lei sư lôch hloi boih.

English: But Paul went down, fell on him, and embracing him said, “Do not trouble yourselves, for his life is in him.”
Bahnar: Mă Pôl kư̆m hơdai wang jur đơ̆ng hnam ei thar năm tơ bơngai tơdăm ei, brom 'bơ̆t klak sư hăm krôp sư, khan hloi kơ lu bơngai lui: “Iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư arih dơ̆ng.”

English: Now when he had come up, had broken bread and eaten, and talked a long while, even till daybreak, he departed.
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng noh Pôl tŏk tơ hnam kơpal ti dơ̆ng, nhôn sa et wă 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ Yêsu. Na đơ̆ng noh nhôn sŏng sa hloi. Pôl pơma dơnuh păng lu bơngai lui khŏm khŏm truh tơ 'năr lĕch. Klaih kơ noh nhôn tơklah dih băl đơ̆ng tơduă lu sư.

English: And they brought the young man in alive, and they were not a little comforted.
Bahnar: Na bơngai tơdăm ei arih 'lơ̆ng thoi đêl dơ̆ng, na lu bơngai lui năm ba truh tơ hnam sư, lu sư hiôk hơiă tơpă yua kơ sư oei arih.

English: Then we went ahead to the ship and sailed to Assos, there intending to take Paul on board; for so he had given orders, intending himself to go on foot.
Bahnar: Pôl năm tơ Pơlei Asôs năm jơ̆ng hoh. Truh Pơlei Asôs boih sư wă tŏk thŏng-nan năm hơdai nhôn. Na sư khan kơ nhôn athei nhôn năm tơ sư ei trong đak na nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan đơ̆ng Pơlei Trôs năm tơ Pơlei Asôs, wă kơ tơ'bơ̆p sư.

English: And when he met us at Assos, we took him on board and came to Mitylene.
Bahnar: Lăp truh tơ Pơlei Asôs boih na Pôl tŏk thŏng-nan năm hơdai nhôn tơ Pơlei Mitilen.

English: We sailed from there, and the next day came opposite Chios. The following day we arrived at Samos and stayed at Trogyllium. The next day we came to Miletus.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Pơlei Mitilen ei nhôn oei hao kơpal thŏng-nan đĕch ưh kơ jur ôh. Năr dơning dơ̆ng nhôn truh tơ bŏl đak đe anăn bŏl Chiôs, na nhôn năm brih kiơ̆ bŏl ei. Năr dơmônh dơ̆ng nhôn truh tơ bŏl đak đe anăn Samôs. Năr đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng nhôn truh tơ Pơlei Milê.

English: For Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus, so that he would not have to spend time in Asia; for he was hurrying to be at Jerusalem, if possible, on the Day of Pentecost.
Bahnar: Pôl ưh kơ 'maih năm tơ Pơlei Êphêsô hli kơ hiong năr tơ dêh char Asi ei, yua kơ sư hăt wă năm jah truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem hơdrol kơ Năr Giĕng Pangtơkôt.

English: From Miletus he sent to Ephesus and called for the elders of the church.
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Milê Pôl đei wơh đe năm pơtruh nơ̆r sư tơ lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui tơ Pơlei Êphêsô athei lu sư năm hơpong tơ sư tơ Pơlei Milê.

English: And when they had come to him, he said to them: “You know, from the first day that I came to Asia, in what manner I always lived among you
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Milê boih Pôl khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm băt kơ inh bơngai thoi yơ đơ̆ng inh 'nao truh tơ dêh char Asi sơ̆ mă khơ̆ tơ bơ̆n tơklah dih băl.

English: serving the Lord with all humility, with many tears and trials which happened to me by the plotting of the Jews
Bahnar: Iĕm băt thoi yơ inh pơm đĭch đam 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆jang tơdrong sư. Inh ưh kơ pơ̆n pơang akâu kơdih ôh. Inh 'bôh đe ưh kơ lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu inh kư̆m nhơ̆m hmoi ơh kơdih akâu inh mơ̆n. Na lu bơngai Juđê kư̆m wă rôp pơrăm lê̆ inh.

English: how I kept back nothing that was helpful, but proclaimed it to you, and taught you publicly and from house to house
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m băt mơ̆n inh bơtho ăn kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong wă tơgŭm iĕm. Inh ưh kơ hli bơtho dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bơ̆t anăp đe akŭm lơ, dah inh bơtho tơ rim hnam dơnŏ lu iĕm.

English: testifying to Jews, and also to Greeks, repentance toward God and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Inh bơtho bơngai Juđê hăm bơngai nai lei-lăi đĕch mơ̆n, khan kơ sư athei tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch sư, na brŏk tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng lui kơ Kră Yang bơ̆n Yêsu Krist.

English: And see, now I go bound in the spirit to Jerusalem, not knowing the things that will happen to me there
Bahnar: “Na dang ei inh năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem yua kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng athei inh năm. Inh ưh kơ băt ôh inh wă đei tơdrong kiơ tơ ei kơnh.

English: except that the Holy Spirit testifies in every city, saying that chains and tribulations await me.
Bahnar: Tơ rim pơlei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơma kơ inh khan lăp inh truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem inh gô đei tơdrong pơmat đe rôp tah inh tơ hnam phak.

English: But none of these things move me; nor do I count my life dear to myself, so that I may finish my race with joy, and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus, to testify to the gospel of the grace of God.
Bahnar: Mă đe pơlôch inh kư̆m bưh, kư̆ mă inh gơh jang mă keh tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu pơjao ăn kơ inh sơ̆. Tơdrong jang noh wă khan bơtho tơdrong 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat kơ bơ̆n, ăn kơ lu bơ̆n klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch, đơ̆ng ti yang kơnê̆.

English: “And indeed, now I know that you all, among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God, will see my face no more.
Bahnar: “Sơ̆ inh năm tơ rim lu iĕm, bơtho ăn kơ đĭ-đăng iĕm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r iĕm thoi yơ. Na dang ei inh băt kơ iĕm ưh kơ đei layơ wă 'bôh akâu inh tơ ala teh âu dơ̆ng.

English: Therefore I testify to you this day that I am innocent of the blood of all men.
Bahnar: Na inh wă khan tơpă kơ lu iĕm dang ei: Tơdah 'Bok Kei-Dei phak iĕm ning-mônh, măk ai lu iĕm hŏ, yua kơ inh ưh kơ hli na bơtho iĕm tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: For I have not shunned to declare to you the whole counsel of God.
Bahnar: Na inh wă khan tơpă kơ lu iĕm dang ei: Tơdah 'Bok Kei-Dei phak iĕm ning-mônh, măk ai lu iĕm hŏ, yua kơ inh ưh kơ hli na bơtho iĕm tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Therefore take heed to yourselves and to all the flock, among which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to shepherd the church of God which He purchased with His own blood.
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei kơchăng akâu kơdih hăm wei-lăng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lui. Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ iĕm wei-lăng bơngai lui kư̆m thoi lĕ bơngai wei-lăng triu sư. Lu bơngai lui, sư kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua Kon pôm Sư Yêsu lôch tuh pham tang kon bơngai yoch.

English: For I know this, that after my departure savage wolves will come in among you, not sparing the flock.
Bahnar: Inh băt đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh tơklah đơ̆ng lu iĕm, lu bơngai kơnê̆ pă jor wă năm tơ iĕm, wă pơhlŭ lu bơngai lui achăng lê̆ Kră Yang Yêsu. Lu sư thoi lĕ kŏ-so wă rôp sa triu.

English: Also from among yourselves men will rise up, speaking perverse things, to draw away the disciples after themselves.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm kơdih kư̆m gô đei bơngai bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ tơpăt wă kơ lu bơngai lui tơklah dih băl păng kiơ̆ sư.

English: Therefore watch, and remember that for three years I did not cease to warn everyone night and day with tears.
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei kơchăng. Iĕm 'nĕ kơ hiơt kơplah măng năr inh bơtho iĕm lăm pêng sơnăm sơ̆. Inh kư̆m nhơ̆m hmoi ơh yua kơ iĕm, hli kơ iĕm lui ưh kơjăp.

English: “So now, brethren, I commend you to God and to the word of His grace, which is able to build you up and give you an inheritance among all those who are sanctified.
Bahnar: “Na dang ei inh apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng lu iĕm. Iĕm pơhrăm Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng sư na iĕm gô lui kơ Sư kơjăp. 'Bok Kei-Dei gô ăn kơ iĕm đei jơhngơ̆m pran, hăm Sư kư̆m ăn kơ iĕm dôm tơdrong hiôk 'lơ̆ng kư̆m thoi Sư ăn kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai mă Sư jô̆ 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: I have coveted no one’s silver or gold or apparel.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ 'nhĕng jên đe dah hơbĕn ao đe ôh.

English: Yes, you yourselves know that these hands have provided for my necessities, and for those who were with me.
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m băt mơ̆n inh bơ̆jang păng ti đĕch wă 'me sa akâu inh kơdih hăm lu bôl buăl inh mơ̆n.

English: I have shown you in every way, by laboring like this, that you must support the weak. And remember the words of the Lord Jesus, that He said, ‘It is more blessed to give than to receive.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh lăm tôm tơdrong inh tơ'bôh kơ iĕm bơ̆n athei jang gleh 'mơ̆i na gơh đei tơmam 'me rong akâu kơdih hăm athei đei đon tơdŏng mơnat kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hoh. Bơ̆n 'nĕ hiơt mă âu nơ̆r Kră Yang Yêsu khan pơkă kơ bơ̆n hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘Tơdah đe tơgŭm bơ̆n, jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n kư̆m hiôk mơ̆n; dah bơ̆n tơgŭm đe, jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n hiôk hloh loi.’ ”

English: And when he had said these things, he knelt down and prayed with them all.
Bahnar: Hlôi Pôl pơma đang boih, Pôl păng đĭ-đăng lu sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng, na Pôl krao khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then they all wept freely, and fell on Paul’s neck and kissed him
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi, chŭm tơkuăr Pôl hloi.

English: Now it came to pass, that when we had departed from them and set sail, running a straight course we came to Cos, the following day to Rhodes, and from there to Patara.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh nhôn tơklah dih băl đơ̆ng lu sư. Nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan wă năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Nhôn năm tơpăt hloi truh tơ bŏl đak đe anăn bŏl Kôs. Năr dơning dơ̆ng nhôn truh tơ Pơlei Rôt. Đơ̆ng noh nhôn năm tơ Pơlei Patara.

English: And finding a ship sailing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard and set sail.
Bahnar: Tơ ei nhôn chă đei minh pôm thŏng-nan nai dơ̆ng wă năm tơ dêh char Phênisi. Na nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan ei năm hloi. Nhôn wă jê̆ truh bŏl Chiprơ na nhôn tơmang 'bôh bŏl ei, nhôn năm brih gah gơal bŏl ei bŏl Chiprơ. Nhôn năm yoh hloi tơ dêh char Siri. Truh tơ Pơlei Tirơ ei boih lăm dêh char Siri nhôn jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan, yua kơ đe wă tơjur tơmam đơ̆ng thŏng-nan ei.

English: When we had sighted Cyprus, we passed it on the left, sailed to Syria, and landed at Tyre; for there the ship was to unload her cargo.
Bahnar: Tơ ei nhôn chă đei minh pôm thŏng-nan nai dơ̆ng wă năm tơ dêh char Phênisi. Na nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan ei năm hloi. Nhôn wă jê̆ truh bŏl Chiprơ na nhôn tơmang 'bôh bŏl ei, nhôn năm brih gah gơal bŏl ei bŏl Chiprơ. Nhôn năm yoh hloi tơ dêh char Siri. Truh tơ Pơlei Tirơ ei boih lăm dêh char Siri nhôn jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan, yua kơ đe wă tơjur tơmam đơ̆ng thŏng-nan ei.

English: And finding disciples, we stayed there seven days. They told Paul through the Spirit not to go up to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Tơ ei nhôn chă lu bơngai lui na nhôn oei păng lu sư minh 'măng giĕng. Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơbăt ăn kơ lu sư Pôl gô đei tơdrong pơmat na lu sư pơma khă Pôl athei lê̆ kơ năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: When we had come to the end of those days, we departed and went on our way; and they all accompanied us, with wives and children, till we were out of the city. And we knelt down on the shore and prayed.
Bahnar: Trŏ năr nhôn wă năm boih na nhôn năm tơ thŏng-nan. Đĭ-đăng lu sư hăm kon akăn sư năm hơdai păng nhôn lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei ei; truh tơ jih đak dơsĭ, nhôn sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: When we had taken our leave of one another, we boarded the ship, and they returned home.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh nhôn tơklah dih băl. Nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan, na lu sư brŏk tơ hnam sư dơ̆ng.

English: And when we had finished our voyage from Tyre, we came to Ptolemais, greeted the brethren, and stayed with them one day.
Bahnar: Na nhôn năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Tirơ ei truh tơ Pơlei Pôtôlêmơs. Truh tơ ei boih nhôn jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan năm hơpong tơ lu 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui tơ ei. Nhôn oei hăm sư minh năr.

English: On the next day we who were Paul’s companions departed and came to Caesarea, and entered the house of Philip the evangelist, who was one of the seven, and stayed with him.
Bahnar: Năr dơning dơ̆ng nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Pôtôlêmơs truh tơ Pơlei Sêsarê. Nhôn jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan năm tơ hnam Philip bơngai bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist. Nhôn oei hơdai hăm sư. Sư lăm tơpơh 'nu bơngai mă lu bơngai lui rơih đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem sơ̆ wă wei-lăng lu bơngai asong tơmam kơ đe.

English: Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied.
Bahnar: Philip đei puăn 'nu kon drŏ-kăn oei adruh. Lu adruh ei bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And as we stayed many days, a certain prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.
Bahnar: Nhôn oei tơ hnam Philip 'bar pêng năr boih đei minh 'nu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư đơ̆ng dêh char Juđê năm tơ Pơlei Sêsarê. Anăn sư Abus.

English: When he had come to us, he took Paul’s belt, bound his own hands and feet, and said, “Thus says the Holy Spirit, ‘So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man who owns this belt, and deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles.’ ”
Bahnar: Abus sư năm hơpong tơ nhôn hăm hloch iŏk tơlei tơ̆n Pôl chô̆ hloi jơ̆ng ti sư kơdih. Sư khan: “Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơbăt kơ inh thoi âu: ‘Thoi inh chô̆ jơ̆ng ti inh kơdih âu, lu bơngai Juđê tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem gô chô̆ jơ̆ng ti ih hăm jao ih tơ bơngai nai dêh đe tơmoi.’ ”

English: Now when we heard these things, both we and those from that place pleaded with him not to go up to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Nhôn păng pơlei ei kơtơ̆ng Abus pơma thoi noh na nhôn khan kơ Pôl: “Nhôn găn ih ưh kơ ăn ih năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem ôh.”

English: Then Paul answered, “What do you mean by weeping and breaking my heart? For I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.”
Bahnar: Na Pôl khan: “Kơlih kơ kiơ iĕm nhơ̆m hmoi păng lung inh tŭk tơdrong jang inh? Mă lu sư tah inh lăm hnam phak, mă lu sư pơlôch inh, kư̆m bưh, akâu inh kơdih wă pơrơ̆ng năm yua kơ inh jang tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu Krist.”

English: So when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, “The will of the Lord be done.”
Bahnar: Na nhôn khan: “Ih pơma thoi noh nhôn ưh pă gơh tang găn ih dơ̆ng ôh na nhôn gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch.”

English: And after those days we packed and went up to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh nhôn hơmet tơmam năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Also some of the disciples from Caesarea went with us and brought with them a certain Mnason of Cyprus, an early disciple, with whom we were to lodge.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei lu bơngai lui đơ̆ng Pơlei Sêsarê năm hơdai hăm nhôn mơ̆n. Lu sư wă năm ba nhôn tơ hnam Masôn. Masôn sư bơngai đơ̆ng dêh char Chiprơ, lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu đơ̆ng hơdrol sơ̆ hloi. Nhôn wă năm oei tơ hnam sư.

English: And when we had come to Jerusalem, the brethren received us gladly.
Bahnar: Lăp nhôn truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem boih, lu 'nhŏng oh bơngai lui sơng iŏk lu nhôn, jơhngơ̆m lu sư hiôk chơt tơpă.

English: On the following day Paul went in with us to James, and all the elders were present.
Bahnar: Na dơning dơ̆ng Pôl năm hơpong tơ Yakơ. Nhôn kư̆m năm kiơ̆ hơdai sư mơ̆n. Lu kră wei-lăng bơngai lui kư̆m hơdai wang năm akŭm tơ ei.

English: When he had greeted them, he told in detail those things which God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry.
Bahnar: Pôl kơkuh kơ lu sư păng ră roi kơ lu sư dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl Juđê kơlih kơ tơdrong jang Pôl.

English: And when they heard it, they glorified the Lord. And they said to him, “You see, brother, how many myriads of Jews there are who have believed, and they are all zealous for the law
Bahnar: Hlôi sư pơma đang boih na lu sư khan bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Klaih kơ noh lu sư khan kơ Pôl: “Ơ oh, ih băt boih đei dôm rơbâu 'nu bơngai Juđê lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu boih. Đĭ-đăng lu sư adrin kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Môis ngăl.

English: but they have been informed about you that you teach all the Jews who are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses, saying that they ought not to circumcise their children nor to walk according to the customs.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơtơ̆ng đe jô̆ kơ ih bơtho lu bơngai Juđê tơ dêh đe tơmoi khan ih athei lu sư tŭk đĭ tơdrong juăt Môis păng tŭk tơdrong kăt tơdra akar lu kon sư păng tŭk đĭ dôm tơdrong juăt Juđê mơ̆n.

English: What then? The assembly must certainly meet, for they will hear that you have come.
Bahnar: Na dang ei ih wă pơm thoi yơ? Rŏ kơnh dơning pă jor lu bơngai Juđê băt kơ ih truh tơ âu boih.

English: Therefore do what we tell you: We have four men who have taken a vow.
Bahnar: “Nhôn wă kơ ih pơm thoi âu: Tơ âu đei puăn 'nu bơngai wă pơm keh tơdrong sư pơkă hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Take them and be purified with them, and pay their expenses so that they may shave their heads, and that all may know that those things of which they were informed concerning you are nothing, but that you yourself also walk orderly and keep the law.
Bahnar: Na ih athei tơgŭm lu sư hŏ păng pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt wă kơ rơgoh thoi lu sư mơ̆n. Păng ih kư̆m athei apah lu sư jên wă răt tơmam pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Klaih kơ noh ih apah đe yuă kơ lu sư sŏk 'ngôch kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt Môis. Ih pơm thoi noh na đĭ-đăng bơngai băt kơ ih ưh kơ athei lu bơngai Juđê tŭk tơdrong juăt Môis ôh; păng lu sư băt kơ ih kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Môis mơ̆n.

English: But concerning the Gentiles who believe, we have written and decided that they should observe no such thing, except that they should keep themselves from things offered to idols, from blood, from things strangled, and from sexual immorality.”
Bahnar: Gah lu khŭl tơmoi nai lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu, nhôn chih bơtho kơ lu sư boih khan kơ lu sư kơ̆m kơ sa tơmam đe pơyơ̆r kơ yang kơnê̆, kơ̆m kơ sa pham dôm sem bơ̆n rong dah sem bri; hơdrol kơ bơ̆n wă pơm tơmam sa bơ̆n athei kăt dah 'bet tŭk lê̆ pham sư; păng 'nĕ kơ ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă.”

English: Then Paul took the men, and the next day, having been purified with them, entered the temple to announce the expiration of the days of purification, at which time an offering should be made for each one of them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Pôl chu tơgŭm puăn 'nu bơngai ei. Năr dơning Pôl păng puăn 'nu bơngai ei pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt wă kơ rơgoh. Đơ̆ng noh sư mơ̆t tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm pơma dơnuh păng đe 'bok soi gah tơdrong giĕng lu sư wă kơtĕch layơ. Gô đang kơ giĕng 'mơ̆i, na 'bok soi wă soi sơmah kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ rim 'nu lu sư.

English: Now when the seven days were almost ended, the Jews from Asia, seeing him in the temple, stirred up the whole crowd and laid hands on him
Bahnar: Lăp wă jê̆ tôm tơpơh năr giĕng ei boih, lu bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng dêh char Asi 'bôh Pôl lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Lu sư pơhlŭ lu kon pơlei pơla tơ ei hơdai hil kơ Pôl, na rôp Pôl hloi.

English: crying out, “Men of Israel, help! This is the man who teaches all men everywhere against the people, the law, and this place; and furthermore he also brought Greeks into the temple and has defiled this holy place.”
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ơ bơngai Isơrael, tơgŭm nhôn 'biơ̆ bĕ. Bơngai âu boih năm jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak bơtho athei đe hil areh kơ bơngai Isơrael bơ̆n, athei đe tŭk lê̆ tơdrong juăt Môis păng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm âu. Na dang ei sư kư̆m anhăk ba bơngai tơmoi khŭl nai lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm âu, na pơm kơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei âu đơ̆ng 'lơ̆ng jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach.”

English: (For they had previously seen Trophimus the Ephesian with him in the city, whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple.)
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma thoi noh yua kơ hơdrol lu sư 'bôh Trôphĭm, bơngai tơmoi đơ̆ng Pơlei Êphêsô năm hơdai păng Pôl lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem ei, na lu sư ngêh kơ Pôl anhăk Trôphĭm mơ̆t lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm.

English: And all the city was disturbed; and the people ran together, seized Paul, and dragged him out of the temple; and immediately the doors were shut.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng Pơlei Jêrusalem đơđơu đơđao mao. Lu kon pơlei kơdâu năm tơ ei na rôp dui anhăk Pôl tơ 'ngoaih hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, na đe tang 'măng hnam ei hloi.

English: Now as they were seeking to kill him, news came to the commander of the garrison that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.
Bahnar: Na lu kon pơlei pơla wă pơlôch hloi Pôl ră, mă-lei đei minh 'nu bơngai năm pơtruh tơ 'bok tih linh khan: “Đĭ-đăng lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem dang ei đơđơu đơđao mao.”

English: He immediately took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. And when they saw the commander and the soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.
Bahnar: Na 'bok tih linh ei krao hloi 'bok phŏ iĕ 'biơ̆ kơ sư păng lu linh sư mơ̆n năm tơkan hloi tơ lu đe tơpôl lơ ei. Lăp lu kon pơlei pơla 'bôh 'bok tih linh păng lu linh sư, na lu kon pơlei pơla huay pă teh Pôl dơ̆ng.

English: Then the commander came near and took him, and commanded him to be bound with two chains; and he asked who he was and what he had done.
Bahnar: 'Bok tih linh năm tơ Pôl athei hloi lu linh rôp chô̆ sư hăm tơlei glang mam 'bar dăng. Na đơ̆ng noh sư jet: “Anăn sư bu 'nâu? Sư pơm tơdrong kiơ?”

English: And some among the multitude cried one thing and some another. So when he could not ascertain the truth because of the tumult, he commanded him to be taken into the barracks.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma re, mơ'nah khan sư pơm tơdrong 'nâu, lu mơ'nah khan pơm tơdrong nai. Kơlih kơ 'bơ̆r bơngai tơpôl pơma na jing đơđơu đơđao mao, 'bok tih linh ưh kơ băt Pôl pơm tơdrong kiơ. Na sư athei lu linh sư anhăk Pôl mơ̆t tơ kơđông sư.

English: When he reached the stairs, he had to be carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the mob.
Bahnar: Lăp lu linh anhăk Pôl truh tơ kung kơđông sư boih, na lu linh hiŏng pôk anhăk Pôl mă kơjung yua kơ kon pơlei pơla druh rôp wă pơlôch Pôl.

English: For the multitude of the people followed after, crying out, “Away with him!”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei pơla druh lu linh anhăk Pôl ei pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Pơlôch sư hŏ. Pơlôch sư hŏ.”

English: Then as Paul was about to be led into the barracks, he said to the commander, “May I speak to you?” He replied, “Can you speak Greek?
Bahnar: Lăp lu linh wă tơmơ̆t sư lăm kơđông, na Pôl jet 'bok tih linh ei thoi âu: “Inh hăm gơh pơma dơnuh păng ih ưh, 'bok?” Na 'bok tih linh khan kơ sư: “Ô ih kư̆m gơh pơma nơ̆r Grĕk hă?

English: Are you not the Egyptian who some time ago stirred up a rebellion and led the four thousand assassins out into the wilderness?”
Bahnar: Inh ngêh kơ ih bơngai Êyiptơ chă pơhlŭ đe iung tơblah lu kră pơgơ̆r sơ̆, anhăk puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai kơnê̆ tơ char glă.”

English: But Paul said, “I am a Jew from Tarsus, in Cilicia, a citizen of no mean city; and I implore you, permit me to speak to the people.”
Bahnar: Pôl khan: “Ưh ôh. Inh bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng Pơlei Tarsơ lăm dêh char Salisia. Pơlei Tarsơ kư̆m tih mơ̆n. Apinh ih asong inh pơma kơ lu kon pơlei pơla.”

English: “Brethren and fathers, hear my defense before you now.”
Bahnar: “Ơ lu mih ma 'nhŏng oh, apinh lu iĕm mơ̆ng inh 'biơ̆ bĕ. Inh wă pơma tơdrong đêl iĕm jô̆ kơ inh athei iĕm tŭk lê̆ tơdrong juăt Môis, inh athei iĕm tơpă dah ưh.”

English: And when they heard that he spoke to them in the Hebrew language, they kept all the more silent. Then he said
Bahnar: Lu sư kơtơ̆ng Pôl pơma nơ̆r Juđê lu sư thĕng tơpă. Pôl khan

English: “I am indeed a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, taught according to the strictness of our fathers’ law, and was zealous toward God as you all are today.
Bahnar: “Inh 'nâu bơngai Juđê tơpă. Mĕ inh tơpŭ kơ inh sơ̆ tơ Pơlei Tarsơ dêh char Salisia. Hơtai inh oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆ inh oei tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem âu. Inh năm hŏk pơhrăm tơ 'bok thây Gemel. Inh pơhrăm tôm tơdrong juăt lu 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆. Inh hăt kơ kiơ̆ tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m lei-lăi thoi lĕ kơ đĭ-đăng lu iĕm dang ei mơ̆n.

English: I persecuted this Way to the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women
Bahnar: Sơ̆ inh areh kơ lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu, truh tơ inh rôp pơlôch lu sư. Inh rôp lu bơngai kiơ̆ Yêsu mă drŏ-nglo mă drŏ-kăn, tah hloi lu sư tơ hnam phak.

English: as also the high priest bears me witness, and all the council of the elders, from whom I also received letters to the brethren, and went to Damascus to bring in chains even those who were there to Jerusalem to be punished.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơm hăm lu bơngai kră sek tơlang, lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Juđê băt kơ inh pơm thoi noh tơpă sơ̆. Lu sư boih chih ăn kơ inh kơthơ wă pơtruh kơ lu 'nhŏng oh bơngai Juđê tơ Pơlei Đamas. Na inh năm tơ Pơlei Đamas wă rôp lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu, chô̆ lu sư chông ba năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem wă phak lu sư.

English: “Now it happened, as I journeyed and came near Damascus at about noon, suddenly a great light from heaven shone around me.
Bahnar: “Lăp 'năr dơ̆ng, hơtai inh oei năm rok trong wă jê̆ truh tơ Pơlei Đamas boih inh 'bôh hloi ŭnh pơchrang rang hơdah tơpă, đơ̆ng plĕnh pơchrang tăp dăr kơ inh.

English: And I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me?’
Bahnar: Inh huŏng hơtat hloi đơ̆ng kơdŭ aseh hăm kơtơ̆ng hloi nơ̆r pơma kơ inh thoi âu: ‘Ơ Sôl, Inh pơm kiơ kơ ih na ih pơm kơnê̆ kơ Inh?’

English: So I answered, ‘Who are You, Lord?’ And He said to me, ‘I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you are persecuting.’
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ Sư: ‘Ơ 'Bok, anăn Ih bu?’ Sư khan: ‘Inh Yêsu đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret mă ih areh kơ Inh.’

English: “And those who were with me indeed saw the light and were afraid, but they did not hear the voice of Him who spoke to me.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai năm hơdai hăm inh hơtai ei, sư 'bôh gah ŭnh pơchrang hơdah đĕch, gah nơ̆r Yêsu pơma kơ inh lu sư ưh kơtơ̆ng ôh.

English: So I said, ‘What shall I do, Lord?’ And the Lord said to me, ‘Arise and go into Damascus, and there you will be told all things which are appointed for you to do.’
Bahnar: Na inh jet Yêsu: ‘Ơ Kră Yang, Ih wă kơ inh pơm kiơ dang ei?’ Kră Yang Yêsu khan kơ inh thoi âu: ‘Ih iung bĕ, năm tơ Pơlei Đamas. Tơ ei đe gô khan kơ ih, Inh wă ăn kơ ih jang tơdrong kiơ kơnh.’

English: And since I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of those who were with me, I came into Damascus.
Bahnar: Hơtai ei pêng năr dơ̆ng, măt inh bơbul ưh kơ 'bôh hơdah kơlih kơ ŭnh pơchrang rang hơdah tơpă tơ inh hei. Na lu bôl inh năm hơdai hăm inh rôp ti chông ba inh truh tơ Pơlei Đamas.

English: “Then a certain Ananias, a devout man according to the law, having a good testimony with all the Jews who dwelt there
Bahnar: “Tơ Pơlei Đamas ei đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Anania. Sư ling-lang pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n. Đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđê lăm Pơlei Đamas băt kơ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng.

English: came to me; and he stood and said to me, ‘Brother Saul, receive your sight.’ And at that same hour I looked up at him.
Bahnar: Anania năm hơpong tơ inh. Na sư dơ̆ng jê̆ inh păng khan kơ inh: ‘Ơ 'nhŏng, dang ei ih gơh 'bôh hơdah dơ̆ng.’ Na inh gơh 'bôh hơdah hloi. Na inh 'bôh sư oei 'bơ̆t jê̆ inh.

English: Then he said, ‘The God of our fathers has chosen you that you should know His will, and see the Just One, and hear the voice of His mouth.
Bahnar: Anania khan kơ inh: ‘Lu kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆ lui kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Bok Kei-Dei boih rơih iŏk ih, wă kơ ih băt dôm tơdrong Sư pơm, Sư wă kơ ih 'bôh Kon 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Sư păng kơtơ̆ng Kon Sư pơma.

English: For you will be His witness to all men of what you have seen and heard.
Bahnar: Sư rơih ih wă kơ ih ră roi kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai gah tơdrong ih 'bôh Yêsu boih, hăm tơdrong ih kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Sư pơma.

English: And now why are you waiting? Arise and be baptized, and wash away your sins, calling on the name of the Lord.’
Bahnar: Na dang ei ih gô kiơ? Ih iung wăi, năm iŏk 'batem, krao khan kơ Yêsu wă kơ ih klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.’

English: “Now it happened, when I returned to Jerusalem and was praying in the temple, that I was in a trance
Bahnar: “Inh brŏk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Hơtai inh oei krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, inh 'bôh Kră Yang Yêsu nhên tơpă. Sư khan kơ inh: ‘Ih dah lĕch đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem mă tĕnh bĕ. Lu kon pơlei pơla ưh kơ wă lui kơ tơdrong ih bơtho gah Inh.’

English: and saw Him saying to me, ‘Make haste and get out of Jerusalem quickly, for they will not receive your testimony concerning Me.’
Bahnar: “Inh brŏk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Hơtai inh oei krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, inh 'bôh Kră Yang Yêsu nhên tơpă. Sư khan kơ inh: ‘Ih dah lĕch đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem mă tĕnh bĕ. Lu kon pơlei pơla ưh kơ wă lui kơ tơdrong ih bơtho gah Inh.’

English: So I said, ‘Lord, they know that in every synagogue I imprisoned and beat those who believe on You.
