Bahnar: Inh khan kơ Sư: ‘Ơ Kră Yang, inh tơchĕng lu sư kư̆m wă lui mơ̆n yua kơ lu sư băt boih kơ inh năm jơ̆p-jang tơ lu hnam akŭm sơ̆ rôp tah lu bơngai lui kơ Ih lăm hnam phak hăm teh lu sư.

English: And when the blood of Your martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by consenting to his death, and guarding the clothes of those who were killing him.’
Bahnar: Hơtai đe pơlôch Êtien, bơngai bơtho Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng Ih, inh kư̆m tơ ei mơ̆n; inh wă kơ đe pơlôch Êtien păng inh wei-lăng ao lu bơngai pơlôch sư.’

English: Then He said to me, ‘Depart, for I will send you far from here to the Gentiles.’ ”
Bahnar: Na Kră Yang Yêsu khan kơ inh: ‘Năm bĕ. Inh wơh ih năm bơtho lu đe pơlei ataih, lu bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ sĭ bơngai Juđê.’ ”

English: And they listened to him until this word, and then they raised their voices and said, “Away with such a fellow from the earth, for he is not fit to live!”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê chu mơ̆ng Pôl pơma kơ lu sư tôch 'bơ̆t Yêsu wơh sư năm bơtho pơlei tơmoi. Lu sư kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh na lu sư ơh, pơma re khan: “Pơlôch Pôl bĕ. Sư bơngai kơnê̆, ưh kơ trŏ ăn kơ sư arih ôh.”

English: Then, as they cried out and tore off their clothes and threw dust into the air
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma re, lu sư hơwơ̆t ao lu sư hăm săi teh pơnŭk.

English: the commander ordered him to be brought into the barracks, and said that he should be examined under scourging, so that he might know why they shouted so against him.
Bahnar: Na 'bok tih linh athei lu linh sư tơmơ̆t Pôl lăm kơđông. 'Bok tih linh athei lu linh sư teh Pôl wă kơ sư jah roi mă tơpăt kơlih kơ 'bok tih linh ưh tam băt tơdrong kiơ lu bơngai tơpôl lơ areh kơ sư.

English: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said to the centurion who stood by, “Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman, and uncondemned?”
Bahnar: Lu linh chô̆ Pôl wă kơ teh sư. Na Pôl khan kơ 'bok phŏ linh oei 'bơ̆t ei thoi âu: “Iĕm ưh kơ gơh teh inh ôh, yua kơ inh bơngai Rôm lei-lăi thoi iĕm mơ̆n, na lu đe kră tam mă năm sek tơlang tơdrong inh.”

English: When the centurion heard that, he went and told the commander, saying, “Take care what you do, for this man is a Roman.”
Bahnar: 'Bok linh kơtơ̆ng Pôl pơma thoi noh, na sư năm tơ 'bok yŏng sư jet hloi: “Ih wă pơm kiơ kơ bơngai âu, sư bơngai Rôm lah?”

English: Then the commander came and said to him, “Tell me, are you a Roman?” He said, “Yes.”
Bahnar: Na 'bok tih linh ei năm tơ Pôl hăm jet: “Apinh ih roi kơ inh, ih hăm trŏ kơ bơngai Rôm tơpă dah ưh?” Na Pôl khan kơ sư: “Tơpă yơh inh bơngai Rôm.”

English: The commander answered, “With a large sum I obtained this citizenship.” And Paul said, “But I was born a citizen.”
Bahnar: 'Bok tih linh khan: “Inh âu bơngai Rôm yua kơ inh apah kơ đe jên lơ tơpă.” Pôl khan: “Inh bơngai Rôm yua kơ 'bă inh bơngai Rôm mơ̆n.”

English: Then immediately those who were about to examine him withdrew from him; and the commander was also afraid after he found out that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.
Bahnar: Na lu linh mă chô̆ Pôl hăm wă teh sư ei, lu sư weh ataih đơ̆ng Pôl. 'Bok tih linh băt kơ sư bơngai Rôm boih sư kư̆m hli lei-lăi thoi lu 'noh mơ̆n kơlih kơ sư athei lu linh chô̆ Pôl wă teh sư hei.

English: Then Paul, looking earnestly at the council, said, “Men and brethren, I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day.”
Bahnar: Pôl hue lăng lu kră sek tơlang na khan: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei inh pơm tơpăt, na jơhngơ̆m inh ưh kơ hli 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: And the high priest Ananias commanded those who stood by him to strike him on the mouth.
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơm, anăn sư Anania, kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, sư athei lu bơngai oei 'bơ̆t jê̆ Pôl tap Pôl 'bơ̆t kang.

English: Then Paul said to him, “God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! For you sit to judge me according to the law, and do you command me to be struck contrary to the law?”
Bahnar: Pôl pơma kơ 'bok soi tơm ei khan: “Ih athei đe tap inh, na 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tap ih mơ̆n, ih bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh. Ih sek tơlang tơdrong inh kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n ră, mă-lei ih athei đe tap inh; ih pơm thoi noh ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n ôh. 'Noh ih dơ̆ng pơm yoch kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n.”

English: And those who stood by said, “Do you revile God’s high priest?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai oei jê̆ Pôl ei khan kơ Pôl: “Ih pơma hơwĕng kơ bơngai soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lah, 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk sư 'bok soi tơm.”

English: Then Paul said, “I did not know, brethren, that he was the high priest; for it is written, ‘You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people.’ ”
Bahnar: Pôl khan: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, inh ưh kơ băt kơ sư 'bok soi tơm ôh. Inh băt mơ̆n sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei chih athei bơ̆n 'nĕ pơma hơwĕng kơ kră pơgơ̆r lu bơ̆n.”

English: But when Paul perceived that one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the council, “Men and brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee; concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead I am being judged!”
Bahnar: Lăm lu kră sek tơlang, Pôl kơnăl kơ lu sư 'bar khŭl bơngai lui phara, khŭl Sađusê păng khŭl Pharisi. Na Pôl khan: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, inh bơngai Pharisi. 'Bă inh kư̆m bơngai Pharisi lei-lăi mơ̆n. Dang ei iĕm sek tơlang tơdrong inh yua kơ inh lui kơ lu bơngai lôch iung arih ning-mônh.”

English: And when he had said this, a dissension arose between the Pharisees and the Sadducees; and the assembly was divided.
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai khŭl Pharisi păng lu bơngai khŭl Sađusê kơtơ̆ng Pôl pơma thoi noh, na lu sư pơjah dih băl hloi, ưh pă pôm đon ôh.

English: For Sadducees say that there is no resurrection—and no angel or spirit; but the Pharisees confess both.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ lu bơngai Pharisi khan kon bơngai gô iung arih đơ̆ng lôch ning-mônh. Na lu bơngai Sađusê khan ưh. Lu bơngai Pharisi khan đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng păng lu yang nai. Lu bơngai Sađusê khan ưh kơ đei ôh, đei 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch. Yua kơ thoi noh na lu sư pơjah dih băl.

English: Then there arose a loud outcry. And the scribes of the Pharisees’ party arose and protested, saying, “We find no evil in this man; but if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him, let us not fight against God.”
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma re đơđơu đơđao mao. Đei lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt Juđê khŭl Pharisi, lu sư wă kơ jei sư na sư iung pơma dŏng Pôl khan hloi thoi âu: “Bơngai âu ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong kiơ ôh. Rŏ lăng sư đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng pơma khan kơ sư kơlĕ.”

English: Now when there arose a great dissension, the commander, fearing lest Paul might be pulled to pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the barracks.
Bahnar: Lu kră sek tơlang ei pơjah dih băl rai pran truh kơ 'bok tih linh hli kơ lu kră sek tơlang wă pơjĭ Pôl dêh. Na sư athei lu linh sư năm tơ tŏk-bŏk đe wă dui iŏk Pôl đơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk bơngai tơpôl ei wă anhăk Pôl tơ kơđông.

English: But the following night the Lord stood by him and said, “Be of good cheer, Paul; for as you have testified for Me in Jerusalem, so you must also bear witness at Rome.”
Bahnar: Măng kơnh Kră Yang Yêsu dơ̆ng jê̆ Pôl hăm khan kơ Pôl: “Ih 'nĕ kơ hli. Ih bơtho tơdrong Inh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem âu boih, na ih athei bơtho tơdrong Inh tơ Pơlei Rôm dơ̆ng.”

English: And when it was day, some of the Jews banded together and bound themselves under an oath, saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul.
Bahnar: Pơgê dơning dơ̆ng lu bơngai Juđê mơ'nah akŭm pơđâu wă pơlôch Pôl. Lu sư pơma hiap kơdih khan: “Dah bơ̆n sŏng sa nhă đak tam mă pơlôch Pôl, mă bơ̆n lôch kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơrăm.”

English: Now there were more than forty who had formed this conspiracy.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơđâu ei hloh kơ puăn-jĭt 'nu.

English: They came to the chief priests and elders, and said, “We have bound ourselves under a great oath that we will eat nothing until we have killed Paul.
Bahnar: Na lu sư năm tơ 'bok soi tih păng lu kră sek tơlang hăm khan thoi âu: “Tơdah nhôn sŏng sa tam mă pơlôch Pôl, lu nhôn lôch kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơrăm.

English: Now you, therefore, together with the council, suggest to the commander that he be brought down to you tomorrow, as though you were going to make further inquiries concerning him; but we are ready to kill him before he comes near.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei nhôn wă kơ iĕm apinh 'bok tih linh ăn kơ Pôl năm tơ lu iĕm, khan iĕm wă pơma tơdrong Pôl dơ̆ng. Na lăp lu linh năm ba sư oei năm rok trong, na lu nhôn wă răp pơlôch Pôl hloi.”

English: So when Paul’s sister’s son heard of their ambush, he went and entered the barracks and told Paul.
Bahnar: Mon Pôl kơtơ̆ng thoi noh na mon Pôl kơdâu mơ̆t tơ kơđông linh, roi hloi kơ Pôl.

English: Then Paul called one of the centurions to him and said, “Take this young man to the commander, for he has something to tell him.”
Bahnar: Na Pôl krao minh 'nu 'bok phŏ linh păng khan: “Apinh ih năm ba bơngai tơdăm âu tơ 'bok yŏng ih. Sư đei tơdrong wă pơma hăm yŏng ih.”

English: So he took him and brought him to the commander and said, “Paul the prisoner called me to him and asked me to bring this young man to you. He has something to say to you.”
Bahnar: Na 'bok phŏ linh ei năm ba mon Pôl truh tơ 'bok yŏng sư na khan hloi: “Bơngai bơnă, anăn sư Pôl, krao inh na apinh inh năm ba bơngai tơdăm âu tơ ih. Sư đei tơdrong wă pơma hăm ih.”

English: Then the commander took him by the hand, went aside, and asked privately, “What is it that you have to tell me?”
Bahnar: 'Bok tih linh rôp ti mon Pôl chông ba sư tơ nai, na jet sư: “E wă roi kơ inh tơdrong kiơ?”

English: And he said, “The Jews have agreed to ask that you bring Paul down to the council tomorrow, as though they were going to inquire more fully about him.
Bahnar: Mon Pôl khan: “Lu bơngai Juđê wă apinh ih athei ih anhăk mih Pôl tơ lu sư năr dơning. Lu sư khan wă sek tơlang mih Pôl dơ̆ng.

English: But do not yield to them, for more than forty of them lie in wait for him, men who have bound themselves by an oath that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him; and now they are ready, waiting for the promise from you.”
Bahnar: Apinh ih 'nĕ chu kơ lu sư hŏ yua kơ lu sư đei loi puăn-jĭt 'nu bơngai wă răp pơlôch mih Pôl. Đĭ-đăng lu sư ei pơkă dih băl păng hiap akâu sư kơdih khan: ‘Dah bơ̆n sŏng sa nhă đak tam mă pơlôch Pôl lei jah ăn 'Bok Kei-Dei pơrăm bơ̆n đĕch 'lơ̆ng hloh.’ Lu sư hơmet tôm boih. Lu sư oei chang gô ih anhăk mih Pôl năm tơ lu kră sek tơlang đĕch dang ei.”

English: So the commander let the young man depart, and commanded him, “Tell no one that you have revealed these things to me.”
Bahnar: 'Bok tih linh khan kơ sư: “Tơdrong e roi kơ inh 'nâu hei, e lê̆ kơ chă roi kơ đe hŏ.” Na sư athei mon Pôl brŏk.

English: And he called for two centurions, saying, “Prepare two hundred soldiers, seventy horsemen, and two hundred spearmen to go to Caesarea at the third hour of the night
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong noh boih na 'bok tih linh krao hloi 'bar 'nu phŏ sư na khan: “Biĕm krao 'bar-hrĕng 'nu linh năm jơ̆ng hoh, tơpơh-jĭt 'nu linh hao aseh, 'bar-hrĕng 'nu linh chĕp tak. Athei lu sư hơmet bĕ năm tơ Pơlei Sêsarê tơsĭn jơ măng kơnh.

English: and provide mounts to set Paul on, and bring him safely to Felix the governor.”
Bahnar: Mă 'bar 'nu biĕm kư̆m athei đei aseh mơ̆n wă ăn kơ Pôl hao kiơ̆. Biĕm hăm lu linh athei chông ba Pôl truh tơ 'bok kuan tih Phêlik.”

English: He wrote a letter in the following manner
Bahnar: 'Nâu 'bok tih linh chih kơthơ

English: Claudius Lysias, To the most excellent governor Felix: Greetings.
Bahnar: “Anăn inh Klôt Lisia chih kơthơ âu kơ 'bok kuan tih Phêlik. Hmach kơ ih 'bok.

English: This man was seized by the Jews and was about to be killed by them. Coming with the troops I rescued him, having learned that he was a Roman.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê rôp bơngai âu na wă jê̆ pơlôch sư ră mă-lei inh kơtơ̆ng đe khan sư bơngai Rôm na inh hăm lu linh inh tơdŏng sư.

English: And when I wanted to know the reason they accused him, I brought him before their council.
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ băt lu bơngai Juđê jâu sư tơdrong kiơ, na inh chông ba sư tơ lu kră sek tơlang bơngai Juđê.

English: I found out that he was accused concerning questions of their law, but had nothing charged against him deserving of death or chains.
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh 'bôh sư ưh kơ đei tơdrong wă pơlôch dah tah sư lăm hnam phak ôh. Lu bơngai Juđê jâu sư gah tơdrong juăt lu sư đĕch.

English: And when it was told me that the Jews lay in wait for the man, I sent him immediately to you, and also commanded his accusers to state before you the charges against him. Farewell.
Bahnar: Na đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh inh kơtơ̆ng ang lu bơngai Juđê wă răp pơlôch sư, na inh athei hloi lu linh inh năm ba sư tơ ih. Inh athei lu bơngai jâu sư năm tơ ih mơ̆n wă kơ lu sư jâu sư 'bơ̆t anăp ih.”

English: Then the soldiers, as they were commanded, took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai linh chu 'bok yŏng lu sư wơh. Măng âu lu sư năm ba Pôl truh tơ Pơlei Antipatrih.

English: The next day they left the horsemen to go on with him, and returned to the barracks.
Bahnar: Năr dơning dơ̆ng lu bơngai linh mă năm jơ̆ng hoh, lu sư brŏk tơ kơđông lu sư tơ lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem. Na lu bơngai linh hao aseh chông ba Pôl.

English: When they came to Caesarea and had delivered the letter to the governor, they also presented Paul to him.
Bahnar: Truh tơ Pơlei Sêsarê lu sư ăn hla kơthơ kơ 'bok kuan tih Phêlik hăm jao Pôl tơ sư.

English: And when the governor had read it, he asked what province he was from. And when he understood that he was from Cilicia
Bahnar: 'Bok kuan tih đŏk lăng kơthơ ei na jet Pôl: “Ih đơ̆ng dêh char ayơ?” Pôl khan: “Inh đơ̆ng dêh char Salisia.”

English: he said, “I will hear you when your accusers also have come.” And he commanded him to be kept in Herod’s Praetorium.
Bahnar: 'Bok kuan tih khan: “Gô lu bơngai wă jâu ih truh, na inh gô sek tơlang tơdrong ih.” Klaih kơ noh sư athei lu linh sư gak Pôl lăm hnam 'bok kuan tih. Hnam ei đêl pơtao Hêrôt pơm sơ̆.

English: Now after five days Ananias the high priest came down with the elders and a certain orator named Tertullus. These gave evidence to the governor against Paul.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh pơđăm năr, 'bok soi tơm, anăn sư Anania, năm tơ Pơlei Sêsarê. Kư̆m đei lu kră sek tơlang mơ'nah, hăm minh 'nu bơngai pơma tang lu kră sek tơlang, anăn sư Têtulus, năm hơdai hăm sư mơ̆n. Lu sư ei năm 'bơ̆t anăp 'bok kuan tih Phêlik wă pơma jâu Pôl.

English: And when he was called upon, Tertullus began his accusation, saying: “Seeing that through you we enjoy great peace, and prosperity is being brought to this nation by your foresight
Bahnar: 'Bok kuan tih Phêlik athei lu linh tơlĕch Pôl 'bơ̆t anăp sư. Klaih kơ noh Têtulus iung pơma jâu Pôl thoi âu: “Kơkuh kơ ih Phêlik. Yua kơ ih pơgơ̆r hơgei tơpă na đơ̆ng sơ̆ nhôn đei tơdrong hiôk-hian. Yua kơ ih tơgŭm nhôn ling-lang, đei tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ jơ̆p kơ dêh char nhôn, yua kơ đơ̆ng ih tơgŭm ngăl.

English: we accept it always and in all places, most noble Felix, with all thankfulness.
Bahnar: Na nhôn bơnê kơ ih tơpă, ơ Phêlik.

English: Nevertheless, not to be tedious to you any further, I beg you to hear, by your courtesy, a few words from us.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ wă pơma đunh ôh, kơnh hiong kơ jơ ih, na dang ei inh apinh ih mơ̆ng inh pơma 'biơ̆ bĕ, ih lĕ 'bok.

English: For we have found this man a plague, a creator of dissension among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes.
Bahnar: Bơngai 'nâu sư pơm kơnê̆ ling-lang. Sư pơhlŭ lu bơngai Juđê tơhil băl jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Sư pơm kră pơgơ̆r lu đe Nasaret.

English: He even tried to profane the temple, and we seized him, and wanted to judge him according to our law.
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m wă pơm kơnê̆ ră kơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, mă-lei nhôn rôp sư. Nhôn wă sek tơlang sư kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt nhôn kơdih ră

English: But the commander Lysias came by and with great violence took him out of our hands
Bahnar: na 'bok tih linh, anăn sư Lisia păng lu linh sư mơ̆n năm tơgar rôp iŏk sư âu đơ̆ng nhôn.

English: commanding his accusers to come to you. By examining him yourself you may ascertain all these things of which we accuse him.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Lisia athei lu bơngai wă jâu Pôl năm tơ ih. Tơdah ih jet Pôl na ih gô băt đơ̆ng sư, sư pơm tơpă dôm lu tơdrong nhôn jâu sư ei.”

English: And the Jews also assented, maintaining that these things were so.
Bahnar: Đang kơ Têtulus pơma, lu bơngai Juđê oei lăm hnam sek tơlang ei kư̆m pơma jâu kơ Pôl mơ̆n. Lu sư khan: “Tơdrong Têtulus pơma noh trŏ tơpă.”

English: Then Paul, after the governor had nodded to him to speak, answered: “Inasmuch as I know that you have been for many years a judge of this nation, I do the more cheerfully answer for myself
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Phêlik athei Pôl pơma. Pôl khan thoi âu: “Inh băt kơ ih sek tơlang lăm dêh char âu đunh sơnăm boih, na inh ưh kơ hli pơma dŏng akâu kơdih.

English: because you may ascertain that it is no more than twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem to worship.
Bahnar: Tơdah ih wă jet tơdrong inh, ih gô băt ưh tam mă đunh ôh, 'nao lăp mơjĭt-'bar năr đĕch hơdrol kơ năr âu inh năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem wă kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă ră.

English: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with anyone nor inciting the crowd, either in the synagogues or in the city.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Juđê ưh kơ 'bôh inh pơjah hăm bu ôh. Lu sư ưh kơ 'bôh inh pơhlŭ kon pơlei pơla tơhil băl lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm ôh, dah lăm lu hnam akŭm nai, dah lăm anih nai dơ̆ng lăm pơlei lei-lăi mơ̆n.

English: Nor can they prove the things of which they now accuse me.
Bahnar: Lu sư jâu inh, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ đei 'bôh inh pơm kơnê̆ tơdrong kiơ ôh.

English: But this I confess to you, that according to the Way which they call a sect, so I worship the God of my fathers, believing all things which are written in the Law and in the Prophets.
Bahnar: Mă-lei pôm lu tơdrong âu inh pơm tơpă: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ lu 'bok kơdră nhôn lui kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Inh kư̆m lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n kiơ̆ kơ Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng Sư. Lu bơngai Juđê khan tơdrong 'noh ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơpă ôh. Mă-lei inh lui kơ đĭ-đăng dôm tơdrong chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong juăt Môis hăm lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.

English: I have hope in God, which they themselves also accept, that there will be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and the unjust.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơiung arih đĭ-đăng bơngai đơ̆ng lôch ning-mônh, mă lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng mă lu bơngai kơnê̆. Lu bơngai jâu inh âu kư̆m lui thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: This being so, I myself always strive to have a conscience without offense toward God and men.
Bahnar: Inh ling-lang adrin wă kơ đei jơhngơ̆m 'lơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm kon bơngai.

English: “Now after many years I came to bring alms and offerings to my nation
Bahnar: “Kơplah 'bar pêng sơnăm inh ưh kơ brŏk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Na ki inh brŏk wă kơ chĕp ba jên đe mơnat ăn kơ lu bơngai Juđê nhôn. Inh kư̆m wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơmam.

English: in the midst of which some Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, neither with a mob nor with tumult.
Bahnar: Inh năm tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt Môis wă kơ rơgoh hăm wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang tơmam. Hơtai ei đei lu bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng dêh char Asi 'bôh inh lăm ei. Mă-lei ưh kơ đei bơngai lơ hơdai hăm inh ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơdrong areh dih băl.

English: They ought to have been here before you to object if they had anything against me.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê mă 'bôh inh ei sư khan đei tơdrong wă jâu inh, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ 'bôh năm 'bơ̆t anăp ih wă jâu inh.

English: Or else let those who are here themselves say if they found any wrongdoing in me while I stood before the council
Bahnar: Dang ei ih ăn lu kră sek tơlang tơ âu đĕch roi kơ ih sư sek tơlang inh ki tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem inh đei tơdrong kơnê̆ kiơ hăm lu sư.

English: unless it is for this one statement which I cried out, standing among them, ‘Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged by you this day.’ ”
Bahnar: Pôm tơdrong âu inh pơma 'bơ̆t anăp lu kră sek tơlang, inh khan thoi âu: ‘Iĕm sek tơlang tơdrong inh năr âu yua kơ inh lui kơ lu bơngai lôch iung arih ning-mônh.’ Pôm tơdrong âu đĕch inh khan kơ sư na liơ lu sư gơh jâu inh tơdrong noh đĕch?”

English: But when Felix heard these things, having more accurate knowledge of the Way, he adjourned the proceedings and said, “When Lysias the commander comes down, I will make a decision on your case.”
Bahnar: 'Bok kuan tih Phêlik kư̆m băt lơ tơpă gah tơdrong lui kiơ̆ kơ Yêsu. Na năr ei sư kuă kơ sek tơlang dơ̆ng. Sư khan: “'Bok tih linh Lisia truh tơ âu, inh gô sek tơlang mă tôch 'mơ̆i tơdrong lu iĕm âu.”

English: So he commanded the centurion to keep Paul and to let him have liberty, and told him not to forbid any of his friends to provide for or visit him.
Bahnar: Phêlik athei linh sư gak Pôl, mă-lei ăn kơ Pôl rơhơi 'biơ̆ mơ̆n păng ăn lu bôl buăl sư năm tơdŏng mơnat dôm tơdrong Pôl wă.

English: And after some days, when Felix came with his wife Drusilla, who was Jewish, he sent for Paul and heard him concerning the faith in Christ.
Bahnar: Đunh 'biơ̆ dang 'bar pêng năr đơ̆ng noh 'bok kuan tih Phêlik năm tơ ei dơ̆ng. Akăn sư kư̆m năm hơdai hăm sư mơ̆n. Anăn sư Drusil. Sư bơngai Juđê. Phêlik krao Pôl năm tơ sư. Na bre sư mơ̆ng Pôl bơtho gah tơdrong lui kơ Kră Yang Yêsu Krist.

English: Now as he reasoned about righteousness, self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was afraid and answered, “Go away for now; when I have a convenient time I will call for you.”
Bahnar: Pôl bơtho tơdrong bơ̆n athei pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, bơ̆n athei kơchăng kơdih hli kơ pơm tơdrong kơnê̆, hăm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei gô sek tơlang kơ bơ̆n ning-mônh. 'Bok Phêlik kơtơ̆ng Pôl bơtho thoi noh, sư hli, na sư khan kơ Pôl: “Dang ei asong ih brŏk tơ anih ih; gô layơ dơ̆ng inh đei jơ rơwơn na inh krao ih wă mơ̆ng ih bơtho dơ̆ng.”

English: Meanwhile he also hoped that money would be given him by Paul, that he might release him. Therefore he sent for him more often and conversed with him.
Bahnar: Phêlik kư̆m ngêh kơ Pôl wă ăn kơ sư jên na wă tơlĕch sư, na sư krao Pôl kư̆m lơ 'măng mơ̆n na pơma dơnuh hăm sư.

English: But after two years Porcius Festus succeeded Felix; and Felix, wanting to do the Jews a favor, left Paul bound.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh 'bar sơnăm Phêtus tơplih Phêlik pơm kuan tih. Phêlik wă kơ lu bơngai Juđê lăp đon kơ sư, na sư ưh kơ tơlĕch Pôl đơ̆ng hnam phak.

English: Now when Festus had come to the province, after three days he went up from Caesarea to Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Phêtus truh tơ dêh char ei wă pơm kuan tih, sư năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Sêsarê truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Then the high priest and the chief men of the Jews informed him against Paul; and they petitioned him
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem ei đei lu 'bok soi tih hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Juđê roi kơ sư tơdrong lu sư jâu Pôl. Lu sư apinh Phêtus athei lu linh sư chông ba Pôl tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem na lu sư wă răp pơlôch Pôl kơplah oei yak rok trong brŏk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ roi kơ Phêtus ôh tơdrong sư wă pơlôch Pôl.

English: asking a favor against him, that he would summon him to Jerusalem—while they lay in ambush along the road to kill him.
Bahnar: Tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem ei đei lu 'bok soi tih hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Juđê roi kơ sư tơdrong lu sư jâu Pôl. Lu sư apinh Phêtus athei lu linh sư chông ba Pôl tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem na lu sư wă răp pơlôch Pôl kơplah oei yak rok trong brŏk tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ roi kơ Phêtus ôh tơdrong sư wă pơlôch Pôl.

English: But Festus answered that Paul should be kept at Caesarea, and that he himself was going there shortly.
Bahnar: Phêtus khan kơ lu sư: “Nhôn tah Pôl tơ hnam phak tơ Pơlei Sêsarê. Mă inh kư̆m ưh kơ mah đunh mơ̆n oei tơ âu; inh kư̆m dah wă brŏk tơ Pơlei Sêsarê.

English: “Therefore,” he said, “let those who have authority among you go down with me and accuse this man, to see if there is any fault in him.”
Bahnar: Tơdah sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ tơpă lei na lu kră pơgơ̆r iĕm gơh năm hơdai hăm inh tơ Pơlei Sêsarê, na pơma jet sư tơ ei dơ̆ng.”

English: And when he had remained among them more than ten days, he went down to Caesarea. And the next day, sitting on the judgment seat, he commanded Paul to be brought.
Bahnar: Phêtus oei tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem oei pă tơsĭn mơjĭt năr dơ̆ng. Klaih kơ noh sư brŏk tơ Pơlei Sêsarê dơ̆ng. Lu kră bơngai Juđê kư̆m kiơ̆ sư mơ̆n. Na năr dơning lu sư mơ̆t tơ hnam sek tơlang tơ Pơlei Sêsarê, na Phêtus athei lu linh chông ba Pôl mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam sek tơlang ei.

English: When he had come, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood about and laid many serious complaints against Paul, which they could not prove
Bahnar: Lăp Pôl truh tơ hnam ei, lu bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem oei tăp dăr kơ sư, na jâu sư lơ tơdrong kơnê̆ tih tơpă, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ 'bôh Pôl pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ kiơ ôh.

English: while he answered for himself, “Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar have I offended in anything at all.”
Bahnar: Na Pôl pơma dŏng kơdih akâu thoi âu: “Inh ưh kơ pơm kơnê̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơngai Juđê dah hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, dah lăm 'bok pơtao tơm Rôm ôh.”

English: But Festus, wanting to do the Jews a favor, answered Paul and said, “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem and there be judged before me concerning these things?”
Bahnar: Na Phêtus wă kơ lu bơngai Juđê lăp đon kơ sư na sư jet Pôl: “Ih hăm wă năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem na inh sek tơlang ih tơ ei gah lu tơdrong sư jâu ih hei?”

English: So Paul said, “I stand at Caesar’s judgment seat, where I ought to be judged. To the Jews I have done no wrong, as you very well know.
Bahnar: Pôl khan: “Dang ei inh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp ih, ih sek tơlang kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt 'bok pơtao tơm Rôm. Ih sek tơdrong inh tơ âu trŏ boih. Ih kư̆m băt mơ̆n inh ưh kơ pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai Juđê.

English: For if I am an offender, or have committed anything deserving of death, I do not object to dying; but if there is nothing in these things of which these men accuse me, no one can deliver me to them. I appeal to Caesar.”
Bahnar: Tơdah inh pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư lei trŏ kơ inh lôch, inh gơh chu lôch kư̆m bưh. Tơdah lu sư jâu inh ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ lei ưh kơ đei bu gơh jao inh tơ lu sư. Na dang ei inh apinh Sêsar, 'bok pơtao tơm bơngai Rôm đĕch sek tơlang tơdrong inh dang ei.”

English: Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered, “You have appealed to Caesar? To Caesar you shall go!”
Bahnar: Na Phêtus pơma dơnuh hăm lu 'bok phŏ sư. Klaih kơ noh sư khan kơ Pôl: “Ih khan ih wă kơ 'bok pơtao tơm bơngai Rôm sek tơlang tơdrong ih lei kư̆m bưh mơ̆n; inh kư̆m ăn kơ ih năm tơ sư.”

English: And after some days King Agrippa and Bernice came to Caesarea to greet Festus.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh 'bar pêng năr pơtao Agripa hăm oh drŏ-kăn sư, anăn sư ei Bêrênis, năm hơpong tơ Phêtus tơ Pơlei Sêsarê.

English: When they had been there many days, Festus laid Paul’s case before the king, saying: “There is a certain man left a prisoner by Felix
Bahnar: Bre sư oei tơ ei kư̆m đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n na Phêtus roi kơ pơtao Agripa gah tơdrong Pôl thoi âu: “Hơtai Phêlik pơm kuan tih sơ̆ sư tah minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Pôl lăm hnam phak tơ âu. Truh dang ei sư oei lăm hnam phak mơ̆n.

English: about whom the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, when I was in Jerusalem, asking for a judgment against him.
Bahnar: Hơtai inh năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem ki, lu 'bok soi tih hăm lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Juđê roi kơ inh tơdrong lu sư jâu Pôl. Lu sư apinh inh phak hloi Pôl.

English: To them I answered, ‘It is not the custom of the Romans to deliver any man to destruction before the accused meets the accusers face to face, and has opportunity to answer for himself concerning the charge against him.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh khan kơ sư lu bơngai Rôm ưh kơ pơm thoi noh ôh. Tơdah jâu bơngai bu, đe athei jâu bơngai ei 'bơ̆t anăp sư hloi hăm ăn kơ sư pơma dih băl. Tơdah tam mă pơma pơjăng dih băl, ưh kơ gơh phak sư ôh.

English: Therefore when they had come together, without any delay, the next day I sat on the judgment seat and commanded the man to be brought in.
Bahnar: Na lăp lu bơngai Juđê năm truh tơ âu inh wă sek tơlang tơdrong sư âu hloi. Na năr dơning dơ̆ng inh năm hloi tơ hnam sek tơlang hăm athei lu linh chông ba Pôl tơ lăm ei.

English: When the accusers stood up, they brought no accusation against him of such things as I supposed
Bahnar: “Na lu bơngai Juđê iung pơma jâu sư, inh ngêh kơ lu sư wă jâu Pôl tơdrong kơnê̆, na ei tă kơ ưh.

English: but had some questions against him about their own religion and about a certain Jesus, who had died, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.
Bahnar: Lu sư jâu Pôl gah tơdrong lui lu sư đĕch. Lu sư pơjah hăm Pôl gah tơdrong minh 'nu bơngai lôch boih anăn Sư Yêsu. Pôl khan Sư oei arih.

English: And because I was uncertain of such questions, I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these matters.
Bahnar: Inh ưh kơ băt thoi yơ dơ̆ng wă kơ inh gơh băt tôm gah tơdrong âu na inh jet Pôl: ‘Ih hăm wă năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem dah ưh, wă kơ inh sek tơlang tơ ei gah lu tơdrong sư jâu ih hei?’

English: But when Paul appealed to be reserved for the decision of Augustus, I commanded him to be kept till I could send him to Caesar.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pôl khan wă gô 'bok pơtao tơm Rôm đĕch sek tơlang tơdrong sư. Na inh athei lu linh oei gak sư truh tơ inh wă athei sư năm tơ 'bok pơtao tơm Rôm.”

English: Then Agrippa said to Festus, “I also would like to hear the man myself.” “Tomorrow,” he said, “you shall hear him.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Agripa khan kơ Phêtus: “Inh wă mơ̆ng Pôl pơma mơ̆n.” Phêtus khan: “Năr dơning ih gô mơ̆ng sư pơma.”

English: So the next day, when Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and had entered the auditorium with the commanders and the prominent men of the city, at Festus’ command Paul was brought in.
Bahnar: Na năr dơning pơtao Agripa hăm yă Bêrênis yak pơyơh akâu kư̆m wang năm mơ̆t tơ hnam đe juăt kơ akŭm. Lu 'bok tih linh hăm lu bơngai pơm tih mơdrŏng lăm Pơlei Sêsarê ei kư̆m mơ̆t lăm hnam ei mơ̆n. Na Phêtus athei lu linh chông ba Pôl mơ̆t tơ lăm ei.

English: And Festus said: “King Agrippa and all the men who are here present with us, you see this man about whom the whole assembly of the Jews petitioned me, both at Jerusalem and here, crying out that he was not fit to live any longer.
Bahnar: Lăp Pôl truh, Phêtus khan: “Ơ pơtao Agripa hăm đĭ-đăng bơngai akŭm tơ âu, bơngai âu đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Juđê jâu sư 'bơ̆t anăp inh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem hăm tơ pơlei âu mơ̆n. Lu sư pơma hơlen khan ưh kơ trŏ ăn kơ sư arih ôh, athei pơlôch sư đĕch.

English: But when I found that he had committed nothing deserving of death, and that he himself had appealed to Augustus, I decided to send him.
Bahnar: Na inh apinh đĭ-đăng lu bơngai jâu sư hăm inh apinh akâu sư kơdih mă-lei inh ưh kơ 'bôh sư pơm tơdrong kiơ ôh. Thoi noh na inh ưh kơ gơh ăn đe pơlôch sư. Na Pôl apinh wă năm tơ 'bok pơtao tơm Rôm, wă kơ sư sek ăn tơdrong Pôl. Na inh wă ăn kơ sư năm tơ pơtao Rôm.

English: I have nothing certain to write to my lord concerning him. Therefore I have brought him out before you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, so that after the examination has taken place I may have something to write.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m wă chih tơ'bôh kơ 'bok pơtao tơm Rôm hla kơthơ mơ̆n, mă-lei inh ưh kơ băt chih khan kơ sư Pôl pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ kiơ. Ơ pơtao Agripa, inh athei lu linh chông ba sư tơ âu 'bơ̆t anăp ih, hăm 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng lu bơ̆n mơ̆n, wă kơ bơ̆n apinh pơma gah tơdrong sư, na ăn kơ bơ̆n wă mă băt gah lu đe wă jâu sư tơdrong kiơ.

English: Then Agrippa said to Paul, “You are permitted to speak for yourself.” So Paul stretched out his hand and answered for himself
Bahnar: Na pơtao Agripa khan kơ Pôl: “Dang ei ăn kơ ih gơh pơma dŏng akâu ih kơdih.” Na Pôl yơ̆r ti pơma hloi dŏng kơdih akâu

English: “I think myself happy, King Agrippa, because today I shall answer for myself before you concerning all the things of which I am accused by the Jews
Bahnar: “Ơ pơtao Agripa, jơhngơ̆m inh chơt hiôk yua kơ năr âu inh gơh pơma dŏng akâu inh kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp ih, dôm tơdrong lu bơngai Juđê jâu inh âu.

English: especially because you are expert in all customs and questions which have to do with the Jews. Therefore I beg you to hear me patiently.
Bahnar: Jơhngơ̆m inh chơt hiôk yua kơ ih băt đĭ lu tơdrong juăt bơngai Juđê hăm lu tơdrong sư pơjah dih băl, na ih gơh sek tơlang tơpăt tơdrong inh. Na inh apinh ih adrin mơ̆ng inh 'biơ̆ hŏ.

English: “My manner of life from my youth, which was spent from the beginning among my own nation at Jerusalem, all the Jews know.
Bahnar: “Đĭ-đăng bơngai Juđê băt kơ inh arih thoi yơ mă inh oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei, mă tơ dêh char inh, mă tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: They knew me from the first, if they were willing to testify, that according to the strictest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m băt mơ̆n hăm gơh ră roi kơ ih mơ̆n tơdah lu sư wă, đơ̆ng sơ̆ inh kiơ̆ khŭl đe Pharisi. Lăm lu bơngai Juđê khŭl Pharisi boih adrin tơpă wă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt bơngai Juđê.

English: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers.
Bahnar: Iĕm sek tơlang tơdrong inh âu dang ei yua kơ inh lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơiung arih lu bơngai lôch kiơ̆ kơ Sư pơkă hăm lu kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆.

English: To this promise our twelve tribes, earnestly serving God night and day, hope to attain. For this hope’s sake, King Agrippa, I am accused by the Jews.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng mơjĭt-'bar khŭl adrĕch bơngai Juđê bơ̆n chang gô 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơdrong Sư pơkă 'noh. Yua kơ thoi noh lu bơ̆n ling-lang oei kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n. Ơ 'bok pơtao, yua kơ inh kư̆m chang gô tơdrong pơkă 'noh mơ̆n, lu bơngai Juđê jâu inh.

English: Why should it be thought incredible by you that God raises the dead?
Bahnar: Ơ lu bơngai Juđê, yua kơ kiơ lu iĕm ưh kơ tơchĕng lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih kon bơngai đơ̆ng lôch?

English: “Indeed, I myself thought I must do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
Bahnar: “Sơ̆ inh kư̆m wă pơrăm tơpă lu bơngai lui kiơ̆ kơ Yêsu, sư bơngai Pơlei Nasaret.

English: This I also did in Jerusalem, and many of the saints I shut up in prison, having received authority from the chief priests; and when they were put to death, I cast my vote against them.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m pơm thoi noh tơpă tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Lu 'bok soi tih ăn kơ inh năm rôp tah lê̆ lơ lu bơngai mă lui kơ Yêsu lăm hnam phak. Lăp đe khan wă pơlôch lu sư, inh kư̆m wă mơ̆n.

English: And I punished them often in every synagogue and compelled them to blaspheme; and being exceedingly enraged against them, I persecuted them even to foreign cities.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ inh kư̆m ling-lang năm jơ̆p tơ lu hnam akŭm chă teh lu sư wă kơ lu sư achăng lê̆ gah tơdrong lui kơ Yêsu. Inh areh tơpă kơ lu sư na inh kư̆m năm tơ pơlei dêh char nai wă pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu sư.

English: “While thus occupied, as I journeyed to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests
Bahnar: “Thoi noh lu 'bok soi tih ăn kơ inh hla bơar phep chă năm tơ Pơlei Đamas chă pơrăm pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai lui kơ Yêsu tơ ei.

English: at midday, O king, along the road I saw a light from heaven, brighter than the sun, shining around me and those who journeyed with me.
Bahnar: Ơ 'bok pơtao, hơtai ei lăp truh 'năr dơ̆ng, inh oei năm rok trong inh 'bôh hloi ŭnh pơchrang hơdah đơ̆ng plĕnh, pơchrang tăp dăr kơ inh hăm lu bơngai năm hơdai hăm inh. Ŭnh ei mơnhal hloh kơ măt 'năr.

English: And when we all had fallen to the ground, I heard a voice speaking to me and saying in the Hebrew language, ‘Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.’
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh nhôn huŏng hơtat hloi đơ̆ng kơdŭ aseh hăm inh kơtơ̆ng hloi nơ̆r đơ̆ng plĕnh pơma thoi âu, nơ̆r Juđê: ‘Ơ Sôl, Inh pơm kiơ kơ ih, na ih pơm kơnê̆ kơ Inh? Ih pơm kơnê̆ kơ Inh na ih đei tơdrong pơrăm kơdih akâu thoi lĕ kơ rơmo ưh kơ chu, na sư kơtong 'bơm 'long sơnguĕt suĕng tơ'ngla sư puh sư.’

English: So I said, ‘Who are You, Lord?’ And He said, ‘I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting.
Bahnar: Inh apinh Sư: ‘Ơ 'Bok, anăn Ih bu?’ Na Kră Yang Yêsu khan: ‘Inh Yêsu mă ih areh kơ Inh.

English: But rise and stand on your feet; for I have appeared to you for this purpose, to make you a minister and a witness both of the things which you have seen and of the things which I will yet reveal to you.
Bahnar: Ih iung wăi. Inh năm tơ ih wă kơ ih jang tơdrong Inh. Ih athei roi kơ đe tơdrong ih 'bôh Inh năr âu boih. Ih gô 'bôh Inh dơ̆ng hăm kư̆m roi tơdrong ih 'bôh Inh hăm dôm tơdrong Inh tơbăt ăn kơ ih.

English: I will deliver you from the Jewish people, as well as from the Gentiles, to whom I now send you
Bahnar: Inh wơh ih năm bơtho lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ trŏ bơngai Juđê. Hăm Inh gô wei-lăng ih wă kơ lu bơngai Juđê hăm lu bơngai tơmoi ưh kơ pơrăm lê̆ ih.

English: to open their eyes, in order to turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan to God, that they may receive forgiveness of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in Me.’
Bahnar: Inh gô wơh ih wă kơ pơlar măt lu bơngai tơmoi wă kơ lu sư gơh 'bôh Tơdrong 'Nao 'Lơ̆ng, wă kơ lu sư gơh jăk đơ̆ng măng mu, na oei lăm hơdah, wă kơ sư jăk đơ̆ng yang Satan, na năm tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong yoch hăm jô̆ lu sư jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt thoi đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lui kơ Inh.’

English: “Therefore, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision
Bahnar: “Ơ pơtao Agripa, inh pơm kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang Yêsu athei inh ei.

English: but declared first to those in Damascus and in Jerusalem, and throughout all the region of Judea, and then to the Gentiles, that they should repent, turn to God, and do works befitting repentance.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na inh bơtho đe tơ Pơlei Đamas hơdrol, klaih kơ noh inh năm bơtho tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, hăm inh năm bơtho jơ̆p-jang dêh char Juđê păng lu dêh char tơmoi. Inh bơtho athei lu sư tơbral kơdih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch hăm lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, na pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng wă kơ đe băt kơ lu sư tơbral kơdih tơpă.

English: For these reasons the Jews seized me in the temple and tried to kill me.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ inh pơm thoi noh, na lu bơngai Juđê rôp inh lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, na wă pơlôch inh ră.

English: Therefore, having obtained help from God, to this day I stand, witnessing both to small and great, saying no other things than those which the prophets and Moses said would come
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng hăm tơgŭm inh, na dang ei inh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t âu bơtho tơdrong Yêsu. Inh bơtho kơ đĭ-đăng, mă lu bơngai pơm tih, mă lu bơngai iĕ, lei-lăi đĕch. Tơdrong inh bơtho kư̆m lei-lăi thoi Môis hăm thoi lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆.

English: that the Christ would suffer, that He would be the first to rise from the dead, and would proclaim light to the Jewish people and to the Gentiles.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng sơ̆ sư bơtho khan 'Bok Krist khŏm đei tơdrong pơmat na lôch, klaih kơ noh iung arih đơ̆ng lôch hơdrol kơ lu bơ̆n. Na 'Bok Krist bơtho khan kơ lu bơngai Juđê hăm lu bơngai nai khan, dah lui kơ Sư na lu sư gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch.”

English: Now as he thus made his defense, Festus said with a loud voice, “Paul, you are beside yourself! Much learning is driving you mad!”
Bahnar: Pôl pơma dŏng kơdih akâu truh 'bơ̆t âu boih na Phêtus pơma re kơ sư hloi: “Ơ Pôl, ih wơnh tơpă âu. Yua kơ ih hŏk lơ na ih wơnh.”

English: But he said, “I am not mad, most noble Festus, but speak the words of truth and reason.
Bahnar: Pôl khan kơ sư: “Ơ Phêtus, inh ưh kơ wơnh ôh. Inh pơma ưh kơ sĭ thoi bơngai suai sik ôh, inh pơma tơpăt thoi bơngai hơdrăl.

English: For the king, before whom I also speak freely, knows these things; for I am convinced that none of these things escapes his attention, since this thing was not done in a corner.
Bahnar: Inh pơma kơ pơtao Agripa ưh kơ đei anat ôh yua kơ sư băt gah tơdrong inh pơma hei. Sư 'bôh păng kơtơ̆ng lu tơdrong noh tơpă yua kơ đe kơtơ̆ng ang lu tơdrong 'noh jơ̆p-jang boih.

English: King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know that you do believe.”
Bahnar: Ơ 'bok Agripa, ih lui kơ tơdrong lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ adrol sơ̆, inh băt kơ ih lui tơpă.”

English: Then Agrippa said to Paul, “You almost persuade me to become a Christian.”
Bahnar: Agripa khan kơ Pôl: “Ih bơtho thoi noh ih ngêh kơ inh wă lui kơ Yêsu Krist dang ei hloi hă?”

English: And Paul said, “I would to God that not only you, but also all who hear me today, might become both almost and altogether such as I am, except for these chains.”
Bahnar: Pôl khan: “Tơdah ih lui kơ Yêsu Krist hloi dang ei, dah ning-mônh dơ̆ng, kư̆m bưh. Mă-lei inh krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh Sư tơgŭm ih, ơ 'bok pơtao păng đĭ-đăng iĕm mă mơ̆ng inh bơtho năr âu, wă kơ iĕm jing bơngai lui kơ Yêsu kư̆m lei-lăi thoi inh mơ̆n. Mă-lei inh ưh kơ wă đe chô̆ iĕm hăm tơlei glang mam thoi lĕ kơ đe chô̆ inh âu ôh.”

English: When he had said these things, the king stood up, as well as the governor and Bernice and those who sat with them
Bahnar: Đang kơ Pôl pơma thoi noh na pơtao Agripa, yă Bêrênis, hăm 'bok kuan tih Phêtus păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lăm ei iung na lĕch hloi đơ̆ng hnam ei. Lu sư pơma tơkhan dih băl: “Bơngai âu ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong kiơ mă wă pơlôch sư dah tah sư lăm hnam phak ôh iih?”

English: and when they had gone aside, they talked among themselves, saying, “This man is doing nothing deserving of death or chains.”
Bahnar: Đang kơ Pôl pơma thoi noh na pơtao Agripa, yă Bêrênis, hăm 'bok kuan tih Phêtus păng đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lăm ei iung na lĕch hloi đơ̆ng hnam ei. Lu sư pơma tơkhan dih băl: “Bơngai âu ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong kiơ mă wă pơlôch sư dah tah sư lăm hnam phak ôh iih?”

English: And when it was decided that we should sail to Italy, they delivered Paul and some other prisoners to one named Julius, a centurion of the Augustan Regiment.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok tih khan wă athei Pôl năm tơ dêh char Itali wă năm tơ 'bok pơtao tơm Rôm. Inh Luka kư̆m wă năm kiơ̆ hơdai hăm Pôl mơ̆n. Na lu 'bok tih jao Pôl hăm lu bơngai bơnă nai ăn kơ minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Julus. Sư 'bok yŏng linh lăm khŭl linh đe anăn khŭl Ôgut mă-lei sư wei lăp minh grŭp đĕch.

English: So, entering a ship of Adramyttium, we put to sea, meaning to sail along the coasts of Asia. Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica, was with us.
Bahnar: Nhôn tŏk minh pôm thŏng-nan, thŏng-nan ei đơ̆ng Pơlei Adramit ki na wă năm tơ lu pơlei dêh char Asi. Aritak sư bơngai đơ̆ng Pơlei Têsalônik, dêh char Masêđôn kư̆m năm hăm nhôn mơ̆n. Na thŏng-nan nhôn ei năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Sêsarê.

English: And the next day we landed at Sidon. And Julius treated Paul kindly and gave him liberty to go to his friends and receive care.
Bahnar: Na năr dơning nhôn truh tơ Pơlei Siđôn. 'Bok yŏng linh, anăn sư Julus, mơnat kơ Pôl, na ăn kơ sư jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan năm ngôi tơ lu buăl sư tơ pơlei ei. Julus kư̆m ăn kơ buăl Pôl tơgŭm Pôl lu tơdrong sư wă kăl.

English: When we had put to sea from there, we sailed under the shelter of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh nhôn năm dơ̆ng. Yua kơ kial dơhlu hơdrơ̆k, na nhôn năm gah 'ma bŏl đak Chiprơ. Kiơ̆ ei ưh kơ gan đei kial dơhlu thoi hei dơ̆ng ôh.

English: And when we had sailed over the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng 'noh dơ̆ng nhôn năm găn hloi đak dơsĭ brih kơ dêh char Salisia hăm dêh char Pamphili, na truh tơ Pơlei Mira tơ lăm dêh char Lisi.

English: There the centurion found an Alexandrian ship sailing to Italy, and he put us on board.
Bahnar: Lăp truh tơ ei boih, 'bok yŏng linh chă đei minh pôm thŏng-nan nai đơ̆ng Pơlei Aleksandrê wă năm tơ dêh char Itali. Na sư athei lu nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan ei.

English: When we had sailed slowly many days, and arrived with difficulty off Cnidus, the wind not permitting us to proceed, we sailed under the shelter of Crete off Salmone.
Bahnar: Đei kial dơhlu hơdrơ̆k, na kơplah 'bar pêng năr nhôn năm adar adar đĕch. Nhôn năm anat tơpă, na truh tơ Pơlei Kơnat. Nhôn ưh kơ gơh năm tơpăt yua kơ kial dơhlu hơdrơ̆k, na nhôn weh gah 'ngiĕo năm brih gah anih kueng kơdrô̆ đe anăn Sôlêmon tơ bŏl đak đe anăn bŏl đak Kret. Nhôn oei năm gah 'ngiĕo kơ bŏl đak Kret, kiơ̆ ei kial dơhlu dă 'biơ̆.

English: Passing it with difficulty, we came to a place called Fair Havens, near the city of Lasea.
Bahnar: Nhôn năm jê̆ tơ kông ei kư̆m oei đei kial mơ̆n, nhôn wơ̆r anat tơpă, na nhôn truh tơ anih đe anăn anih thŏng-nan gơh dơ̆ng minh 'bôt. Anih ei jê̆ Pơlei Lasê.

English: Now when much time had been spent, and sailing was now dangerous because the Fast was already over, Paul advised them
Bahnar: Nhôn oei tơ ei kư̆m đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n. Năr giĕng đe Juđê đang boih, na kơplah 'noh thŏng-nan năm kơpal đak dơsĭ hơmơt dêh yua kơ kial hơbŭt. Na Pôl khan kơ lu đe ei thoi âu

English: saying, “Men, I perceive that this voyage will end with disaster and much loss, not only of the cargo and ship, but also our lives.”
Bahnar: “Ơ bre, bơ̆n năm đơ̆ng âu dơ̆ng hơmơt dêh hli kơ thŏng-nan hăm lu tơmam lăm thŏng-nan âu gô hiong, bơ̆n gô lôch mơ̆n.”

English: Nevertheless the centurion was more persuaded by the helmsman and the owner of the ship than by the things spoken by Paul.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bok yŏng linh sư ưh kơ chu kơ Pôl pơma ôh, sư chu pôm bơngai wơ̆r thŏng-nan hăm tơ'ngla thŏng-nan ei đĕch.

English: And because the harbor was not suitable to winter in, the majority advised to set sail from there also, if by any means they could reach Phoenix, a harbor of Crete opening toward the southwest and northwest, and winter there.
Bahnar: Nhôn oei tơ anih ei kư̆m ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng ôh yua kơ kial dơhlu hơbŭt tih ei lăm bơyan 'mi, na lu bơngai hao thŏng-nan ei wă năm tơ đak dơsĭ dơ̆ng, wă năm truh tơ Pơlei Phênik. Pơlei Phênik kư̆m tơ bŏl đak ei mơ̆n na tơ ei kial đơ̆ng hơlĕch hăm đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m dơhlu dă 'biơ̆. Lu sư wă oei tơ ei lăp oei hơtai bơyan 'mi.

English: When the south wind blew softly, supposing that they had obtained their desire, putting out to sea, they sailed close by Crete.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh kial dơhlu dă 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng gah gơal, na lu bơngai oei lăm thŏng-nan ei dui atŏk mam pơkơ̆ng thŏng-nan tơ kơpal boih na gơh năm. Nhôn năm jê̆ jih bŏl đak Kret.

English: But not long after, a tempestuous head wind arose, called Euroclydon.
Bahnar: Mă-lei nhôn năm ưh kơ đunh đei hloi kial hơbŭt dơhlu đơ̆ng bŏl đak, đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch.

English: So when the ship was caught, and could not head into the wind, we let her drive.
Bahnar: Kial ei dơhlu anhăk thŏng-nan, nhôn ưh kơ gơh wơ̆r thŏng-nan yua kơ kial dơhlu hơdrơ̆k. Thoi noh na lu nhôn gô mơ̆ng kơ kial dơhlu anhăk thŏng-nan nhôn đĕch.

English: And running under the shelter of an island called Clauda, we secured the skiff with difficulty.
Bahnar: Nhôn brih gah gơal bŏl đak đe anăn bŏl đak Kaođa, na kial dă 'biơ̆. Đơ̆ng ki nhôn dui minh pôm plŭng đơ̆ng rŏng kơ thŏng-nan, na nhôn adrin tơpă wă atŏk plŭng ei tơ kơpal thŏng-nan.

English: When they had taken it on board, they used cables to undergird the ship; and fearing lest they should run aground on the Syrtis Sands, they struck sail and so were driven.
Bahnar: Nhôn atŏk plŭng kơpal thŏng-nan boih, na chô̆ thŏng-nan hăm tơlei lơ dăr gah 'ngoaih kơ thŏng-nan, yua kơ nhôn hli kơ thŏng-nan pơchah. Lu sư hli kơ thŏng-nan năm khŏm khŏm na 'bơm hloi bŏl chuơh tơ jih đak dơsĭ lăm dêh char Libi. Na lu sư yaih tơjur lê̆ che đơ̆ng thŏng-nan, na kial dơhlu kơdrô̆ thŏng-nan đĕch.

English: And because we were exceedingly tempest-tossed, the next day they lightened the ship.
Bahnar: Năr dơning dơ̆ng kial oei hơbŭt khŏm khŏm thoi brei na lu sư iŏk tơmam chơ đơ̆ng thŏng-nan tŭk lê̆ lăm đak dơsĭ.

English: On the third day we threw the ship’s tackle overboard with our own hands.
Bahnar: Năr dơmônh dơ̆ng lu sư yaih tŭk lê̆ lu tơmam yua lăm thŏng-nan hăm ti sư kơdih.

English: Now when neither sun nor stars appeared for many days, and no small tempest beat on us, all hope that we would be saved was finally given up.
Bahnar: Đunh năr tơpă nhôn ưh kơ gơh 'bôh măt 'năr păng ưh kơ 'bôh sơnglŏng. Kial oei dơhlu hơbŭt khŏm khŏm, lu nhôn pă ngêh kơ arih boih.

English: But after long abstinence from food, then Paul stood in the midst of them and said, “Men, you should have listened to me, and not have sailed from Crete and incurred this disaster and loss.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai lăm thŏng-nan ei ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa đunh boih, na Pôl dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư hăm khan: “Ơ bre, dah iĕm chu nơ̆r inh khan kơ bơ̆n ki na bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ năm đơ̆ng bŏl đak Kret ki, lei bơ̆n huay kơ hiong đĭ tơmam bơ̆n.

English: And now I urge you to take heart, for there will be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei inh apinh iĕm 'nĕ pă hli. Đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n ưh kơ đei bu lôch ôh, kơdrô̆ thŏng-nan đĕch gô hiong răm.

English: For there stood by me this night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve
Bahnar: Inh lui kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư kư̆m wei-lăng inh mơ̆n. Măng hei linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei năm tơ inh păng khan: ‘Ơ Pôl, ih 'nĕ pă hli. Ning-mônh ih gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao tơm bơngai Rôm tơpă. 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m mơnat kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai năm hơdai hăm ih mơ̆n na lu sư kư̆m huay kơ lôch.’

English: saying, ‘Do not be afraid, Paul; you must be brought before Caesar; and indeed God has granted you all those who sail with you.’
Bahnar: Inh lui kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư kư̆m wei-lăng inh mơ̆n. Măng hei linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei năm tơ inh păng khan: ‘Ơ Pôl, ih 'nĕ pă hli. Ning-mônh ih gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao tơm bơngai Rôm tơpă. 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m mơnat kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai năm hơdai hăm ih mơ̆n na lu sư kư̆m huay kơ lôch.’

English: Therefore take heart, men, for I believe God that it will be just as it was told me.
Bahnar: Na iĕm 'nĕ pă hli yua kơ inh lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơm kiơ̆ kơ linh jang 'lơ̆ng khan.

English: However, we must run aground on a certain island.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei kial dơhlu thŏng-nan bơ̆n, thŏng-nan bơ̆n gô hơtŭt 'bơm bŏl đak.”

English: Now when the fourteenth night had come, as we were driven up and down in the Adriatic Sea, about midnight the sailors sensed that they were drawing near some land.
Bahnar: Kial oei dơhlu thŏng-nan nhôn tơ đak dơsĭ khŏm khŏm truh mơjĭt-puăn năr. Đe anăn đak dơsĭ ei Adria. Dang mơjĭt-'bar jơ kơmăng 'nei, lu bơngai wei thŏng-nan băt kơ nhôn năm wă jê̆ truh tơ jih đak boih.

English: And they took soundings and found it to be twenty fathoms; and when they had gone a little farther, they took soundings again and found it to be fifteen fathoms.
Bahnar: Na lu sư tơjur tơlei pơtŏ wă băt kơ đak jrŭ dang yơ. Lu sư pơtŏ đak truh tơ 'bar-jĭt plaih. Pă 'biơ̆ dơ̆ng sư pơtŏ jrŭ oei mơjĭt-pơđăm plaih.

English: Then, fearing lest we should run aground on the rocks, they dropped four anchors from the stern, and prayed for day to come.
Bahnar: Lu sư hli kơ thŏng-nan hơtŭt 'bơm tơmo tih na lu sư tơjur lăm đak puăn tŏ mam trăp yua wă pơkơ̆ng gah rŏng thŏng-nan. Hăm lu sư chang 'năr dah lĕch đĕch boih, yua kơ lu sư hli kơ thŏng-nan ei kơtĕch.

English: And as the sailors were seeking to escape from the ship, when they had let down the skiff into the sea, under pretense of putting out anchors from the prow
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei thŏng-nan ei wă chă tơdrong gơh klĕnh đơ̆ng thŏng-nan. Lu sư tơjur plŭng tơ đak khan wă tơjur mam gah anăp thŏng-nan, mă-lei lu sư wă kơdâu klĕnh đĕch.

English: Paul said to the centurion and the soldiers, “Unless these men stay in the ship, you cannot be saved.”
Bahnar: Na Pôl khan kơ 'bok yŏng linh hăm lu linh sư: “Tơdah lu tơ'ngla wei thŏng-nan jăk, bơ̆n gô lôch đĭ-đăng.”

English: Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the skiff and let it fall off.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai linh kăt tơlei đơ̆ng chô̆ plŭng ei, achăng plŭng tơ đak.

English: And as day was about to dawn, Paul implored them all to take food, saying, “Today is the fourteenth day you have waited and continued without food, and eaten nothing.
Bahnar: Wă jê̆ 'năr lĕch boih na Pôl apinh đĭ lu sư sŏng sa. Pôl khan: “Bơ̆n nŏng kơ chang gô kial dơhlu dă 'biơ̆ ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa mơjĭt-puăn năr boih.

English: Therefore I urge you to take nourishment, for this is for your survival, since not a hair will fall from the head of any of you.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei inh wă kơ bơ̆n sŏng sa wă kơ bơ̆n pran huay kơ rơmơ̆n. Iĕm 'nĕ pă mah hli dêh hŏ, inh băt ưh kơ đei bu jĭ kiơ ôh.”

English: And when he had said these things, he took bread and gave thanks to God in the presence of them all; and when he had broken it he began to eat.
Bahnar: Hlôi kơ pơma thoi noh, Pôl iŏk 'bĕng mi, krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ-đăng lu sư, na phĕ hloi 'bĕng mi ei sa.

English: Then they were all encouraged, and also took food themselves.
Bahnar: Na lu sư ưh pă gan mah hli dêh boih. Đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư kư̆m sŏng sa mơ̆n.

English: And in all we were two hundred and seventy-six persons on the ship.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu nhôn oei kơpal thŏng-nan ei đei 'bar-hrĕng tơpơh-jĭt tơdrâu 'nu bơngai.

English: So when they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship and threw out the wheat into the sea.
Bahnar: Lu nhôn sŏng sa phĭ mah boih, na nhôn tŭk lê̆ pơđĭ phe lăm đak dơsĭ wă kơ thŏng-nan huay kơ trăp.

English: When it was day, they did not recognize the land; but they observed a bay with a beach, onto which they planned to run the ship if possible.
Bahnar: 'Năr lĕch boih na nhôn 'bôh bŏl đak noh mă-lei lu bơngai wei thŏng-nan ei, lu sư ưh kơ băt dêh char đe bu ei. Na sư tơmang 'bôh sơlam kông ei đei pơlao chuơh, na lu sư wă wơ̆r thŏng-nan mơ̆t sơlam chuơh ei.

English: And they let go the anchors and left them in the sea, meanwhile loosing the rudder ropes; and they hoisted the mainsail to the wind and made for shore.
Bahnar: Na lu sư kăt tơlei đêl chô̆ mam pơkơ̆ng, na tơhuŏng tŭk lê̆ lăm đak. Lu sư yaih tơlei chô̆ 'long wơ̆r na đơ̆ng noh lu sư atŏk che chô̆ 'bơ̆t anăp thŏng-nan, wă kơ kial dơhlu năm tơ anăp.

English: But striking a place where two seas met, they ran the ship aground; and the prow stuck fast and remained immovable, but the stern was being broken up by the violence of the waves.
Bahnar: Na thŏng-nan năm 'blep hloi sơlam bŏl đak, mă-lei đei bŏl iĕ ala kơ đak, na kơtơh thŏng-nan hơtŭt 'bơm bŏl iĕ. Thŏng-nan ưh pă gơh năm dơ̆ng. Na đak dơsĭ ei poh-yă tih tơpă, đak tơglăk gah rŏng thŏng-nan pơchah hloi.

English: And the soldiers’ plan was to kill the prisoners, lest any of them should swim away and escape.
Bahnar: Lu linh sư tơchĕng wă pơlôch đĭ lu bơngai bơnă, yua kơ lu sư hli kơ mơ'nah gơh glơi đak na kơdâu jăk tơ nai.

English: But the centurion, wanting to save Paul, kept them from their purpose, and commanded that those who could swim should jump overboard first and get to land
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bok yŏng linh ưh kơeng wă pơlôch Pôl, na păng ưh kơ ăn pơlôch đĭ-đăng bơngai phak. Mă hơdrol sư athei lu bơngai gơh glơi kơtah tơ đak glơi tŏk tơ kông.

English: Now when they had escaped, they then found out that the island was called Malta.
Bahnar: Lăp nhôn tŏk đơ̆ng đak tơ kông boih nhôn kơtơ̆ng đe khan bŏl đak âu đe anăn bŏl đak Malitơ.

English: And the natives showed us unusual kindness; for they kindled a fire and made us all welcome, because of the rain that was falling and because of the cold.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai nai oei tơ bŏl đak ei mơnat kơ nhôn na tơgŭm nhôn, yua kơ tơ ei bơyan 'mi păng tơngiĕt. Na lu bơngai ei rŭk ŭnh, na pơtơm nhôn nhur ŭnh sư ei.

English: But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire, a viper came out because of the heat, and fastened on his hand.
Bahnar: Pôl năm chă 'long ŭnh, na sư pơgơ̆p thim dơ̆ng 'long ŭnh, na đei hloi 'bih lĕch đơ̆ng ei yua kơ 'bih tơnŏ đơ̆ng ŭnh, na kăp pơđom hloi ti Pôl.

English: So when the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they said to one another, “No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he has escaped the sea, yet justice does not allow to live.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai nai oei tơ bŏl đak ei 'bôh 'bih kăp pơđom ti Pôl, na lu sư pơma dih băl: “Rŏ lăng bơngai âu chă pơlôch đe rŏ lăng; mă-lei sư huay kơ lôch tơ đak dơsĭ iih, na dang ei yang Đêke kuă kơ lăng sư yua kơ sư pơm kơnê̆ kơ đe dêh, na sư wă lôch kơ 'bih choh.”

English: But he shook off the creature into the fire and suffered no harm.
Bahnar: Na Pôl tơtreh 'bih ei tơ ŭnh. Mă-lei Pôl huay kơ jĭ ôh.

English: However, they were expecting that he would swell up or suddenly fall down dead. But after they had looked for a long time and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds and said that he was a god.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei lăng Pôl ngeh kơ ti Pôl wă pơ'ngeh, dah sư wă lôch hloi. Lu sư lăng khŏm khŏm 'bôh sư oei 'lơ̆ng thoi đêl, na lu sư khan dih băl dơ̆ng: “Sư âu yang tơpă iih, 'bih choh sư khan ưh kơ lôch.”

English: In that region there was an estate of the leading citizen of the island, whose name was Publius, who received us and entertained us courteously for three days.
Bahnar: Jê̆ 'bơ̆t ei đei mir Publiu, bơngai pơgơ̆r bŏl đak ei. Sư pơtơm nhôn mơ̆t tơ hnam sư, na nhôn oei păng sư pêng năr.

English: And it happened that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and dysentery. Paul went in to him and prayed, and he laid his hands on him and healed him.
Bahnar: 'Bă Publiu ei oei păn kơ bơlŏ păng chroh hăk. Pôl mơ̆t tơ lăm anih sư păng krao khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, na pel akâu sư păng pơklaih jĭ sư ei.

English: So when this was done, the rest of those on the island who had diseases also came and were healed.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai nai oei tơ bŏl đak ei kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, đĭ-đăng lu bơngai jĭ jăn năm tơ Pôl na Pôl kư̆m pơklaih lu sư mơ̆n.

English: They also honored us in many ways; and when we departed, they provided such things as were necessary.
Bahnar: Lu sư ăn kơ nhôn tơmam kư̆m lơ mơ̆n. Hơtai nhôn wă yak tŏk tơ thŏng-nan yak đơ̆ng ei dơ̆ng lu sư ăn kơ nhôn đĭ tơmam nhôn kăl wă yak.

English: After three months we sailed in an Alexandrian ship whose figurehead was the Twin Brothers, which had wintered at the island.
Bahnar: Nhôn oei tơ bŏl đak ei đei pêng khei boih na đĭ kơ bơyan 'mi păng tơngiĕt. Na nhôn chă thŏng-nan plơ̆ng. Thŏng-nan ei đe anăn Điôtkur. Thŏng-nan âu đơ̆ng Pơlei Aleksandrê, mă-lei oei tơ bŏl đak ei đĭ kơ bơyan 'mi.

English: And landing at Syracuse, we stayed three days.
Bahnar: Na nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan năm truh tơ Pơlei Sirakus, oei tơ ei pêng năr.

English: From there we circled round and reached Rhegium. And after one day the south wind blew; and the next day we came to Puteoli
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh nhôn tŏk thŏng-nan năm truh tơ Pơlei Rêgiơ. Năr dơning dơ̆ng đei kial thu đơ̆ng gơal na nhôn yak truh tơ Pơlei Pusôl lăp 'bar năr đĕch.

English: where we found brethren, and were invited to stay with them seven days. And so we went toward Rome.
Bahnar: Na nhôn tơ'bơ̆p bơngai lui kơ Yêsu tơ ei păng lu sư pơtơm nhôn oei păng lu sư minh 'măng giĕng. Đơ̆ng noh nhôn năm jơ̆ng hoh wă năm tơ Pơlei Rôm.

English: And from there, when the brethren heard about us, they came to meet us as far as Appii Forum and Three Inns. When Paul saw them, he thanked God and took courage.
Bahnar: Lu 'nhŏng oh lui kơ Yêsu oei tơ Pơlei Rôm kơtơ̆ng ang nhôn wă năm tơ pơlei sư, na lu sư năm truh tơ Pơlei Appi păng Pơlei Tre Taberna, na lu sư sơng iŏk nhôn. Lăp Pôl tơ'bơ̆p lu sư, na Pôl khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng sư 'nă hal yua kơ sư 'bôh bôl sư.

English: Now when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard; but Paul was permitted to dwell by himself with the soldier who guarded him.
Bahnar: Nhôn truh tơ Pơlei Rôm, na đe ăn kơ Pôl oei hnam kơdrô̆, đei minh 'nu bơngai linh kiơ̆ wei-lăng sư.

English: And it came to pass after three days that Paul called the leaders of the Jews together. So when they had come together, he said to them: “Men and brethren, though I have done nothing against our people or the customs of our fathers, yet I was delivered as a prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans
Bahnar: Nhôn oei tơ ei đei pêng năr boih na Pôl krao akŭm lu kră bơngai Juđê. Lăp sư akŭm boih Pôl khan kơ lu sư: “Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, inh ưh kơ đei pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu bơngai Juđê bơ̆n dah tơdrong juăt lu kră bơ̆n sơ̆. Mă-lei lu bơngai Juđê đơ̆ng nai rôp inh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem păng jao inh tơ lu bơngai Rôm.

English: who, when they had examined me, wanted to let me go, because there was no cause for putting me to death.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Rôm sek tơlang tơdrong inh khan ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ ôh. Na lu sư ưh kơ gơh pơlôch inh. Na lu sư wă tơlĕch inh đĕch.

English: But when the Jews spoke against it, I was compelled to appeal to Caesar, not that I had anything of which to accuse my nation.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai Juđê ưh kơ chu kơ lu bơngai Rôm wă tơlĕch inh ôh. Na inh athei apinh 'bok kuan tih Phêtus ăn kơ 'bok pơtao tơm bơngai Rôm sek tơlang tơdrong inh. Mă-lei gah inh, ưh kơ đei jâu lu bơngai Juđê tơdrong kiơ ôh.

English: For this reason therefore I have called for you, to see you and speak with you, because for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.”
Bahnar: Kơlih yua kơ thoi noh inh apinh iĕm năm tơ âu wă kơ inh gơh tơ'bơ̆p iĕm păng pơma dơnuh păng iĕm. Âu iĕm lăng deh ti inh đe oei chô̆ păng tơlei glang mam yua kơ inh lui kơ 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih bơ̆n. Đĭ lu bơngai Juđê kư̆m chang gô Sư mơ̆n.”

English: Then they said to him, “We neither received letters from Judea concerning you, nor have any of the brethren who came reported or spoken any evil of you.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê khan kơ Pôl: “Nhôn ưh kơ đei 'bôh hla kơthơ đơ̆ng dêh char Juđê roi gah tơdrong ih ôh. Lăm lu 'nhŏng oh nhôn đơ̆ng dêh char Juđê ưh kơ đei bơngai bu năm tơ âu roi tơdrong ih, khan ih pơm tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: But we desire to hear from you what you think; for concerning this sect, we know that it is spoken against everywhere.”
Bahnar: Mă nhôn wă mơ̆ng tơdrong ih bơtho yua kơ lơ bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak khan khŭl iĕm kiơ̆ Yêsu ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng.”

English: So when they had appointed him a day, many came to him at his lodging, to whom he explained and solemnly testified of the kingdom of God, persuading them concerning Jesus from both the Law of Moses and the Prophets, from morning till evening.
Bahnar: Na Pôl hăm lu sư pơkă năr wă akŭm dơ̆ng. Truh năr ei boih lu sư lơ tơpă năm akŭm tơ hnam Pôl. Đơ̆ng pơgê truh kơsơ̆ Pôl bơtho lu sư gah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n thoi yơ. Sư đŏk lăng đơ̆ng sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong juăt Môis păng sơ̆p hla bơar lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơbăt kơ lu sư Yêsu boih 'Bok Dŏng Pơklaih tơpă.

English: And some were persuaded by the things which were spoken, and some disbelieved.
Bahnar: Đei lu mơ'nah lui kơ nơ̆r Pôl bơtho, lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng ưh kơ lui.

English: So when they did not agree among themselves, they departed after Paul had said one word: “The Holy Spirit spoke rightly through Isaiah the prophet to our fathers
Bahnar: Na lu sư wă tơklah dih băl brŏk tơ hnam kơdih, lu sư oei pơjah dih băl gah tơdrong Pôl bơtho. Hơdrol kơ lu sư wă brŏk, Pôl khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, anăn sư Êsai, khan kơ lu 'bok kơdră bơ̆n sơ̆, na 'blep kơ iĕm ưh kơ lui dang ei.

English: saying, ‘Go to this people and say: “Hearing you will hear, and shall not understand; And seeing you will see, and not perceive
Bahnar: Êsai khan thoi âu: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ inh: Ih năm bơtho lu bơngai âu khan: Iĕm mơ̆ng inh bơtho khŏm khŏm ră, mă-lei iĕm ưh kơ hlôh; măt iĕm lăng khŏm khŏm ră mă ưh kơ 'bôh tơdrong kiơ.

English: For the hearts of this people have grown dull. Their ears are hard of hearing, And their eyes they have closed, Lest they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears, Lest they should understand with their hearts and turn, So that I should heal them.” ’
Bahnar: Ih năm bơtho lu sư thoi noh yua kơ đon lu sư jing kơtul dêh; mă-lei lu sư oei wă pơchĭt đon sư kơdih khŏm khŏm 'mơ̆i, păng măt lu sư wă kơ tep ling-lang. Dah lu sư 'nĕ kơ pơm đon thoi noh, lei măt lu sư gơh 'bôh, đon lu sư kơtơ̆ng nhên, lu sư gơh tơchĕng kơdih băt wih tơ Inh 'Bok Kei-Dei, na Inh gô pơklaih đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch sư.’ ”

English: “Therefore let it be known to you that the salvation of God has been sent to the Gentiles, and they will hear it!”
Bahnar: Pôl roi dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Na inh wă kơ iĕm băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơklaih lu bơngai tơmoi mă ưh kơ khŭl bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch mơ̆n. Lu sư gô lui kơ nơ̆r inh bơtho gah tơdrong Yêsu.”

English: And when he had said these words, the Jews departed and had a great dispute among themselves.
Bahnar: Pôl pơma thoi noh boih na lu bơngai Juđê ei brŏk tơ hnam sư kơdih oei pơjah pơjăng dih băl gah tơdrong Pôl bơtho.

English: Then Paul dwelt two whole years in his own rented house, and received all who came to him
Bahnar: Pôl oei 'bar sơnăm tơ Pơlei Rôm lăm hnam sư mơng đơ̆ng đe. Pôl đih sơng dôm lu bơngai wă năm hơpong tơ sư.

English: preaching the kingdom of God and teaching the things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ with all confidence, no one forbidding him.
Bahnar: Pôl bơtho lu sư gah tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r bơ̆n păng tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu Krist. Sư bơtho đe kư̆m nuih tơpă păng ưh kơ đei bu khă sư.
